loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Sullcataca Baja sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segunda actividad  ella trabaja como profesora escolar en la ciudad de El Alto, mientras su esposo es quien se encarga de los cuidados  del ganado y también el cuidado de sus hijos los cuales están entre los 5 y 3 años respectivamente.

  
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Maribel raises cattle and sells the milk that her herd produces to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). She lives in the Sullcataca Baja community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. As a second job, she also works as a schoolteacher in the city of El Alto while her husband is responsible for the care of their herd as well as the care of their children, who are between the ages of 5 and 3 respectively. This loan will be used to buy a better breed of cattle, and thereby increase her production of milk and her income as well. This is her first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified her to be eligible for one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of  Naawan, Misamis. She is 49 years old and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns  and operates a specialized retail store. While this is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Emma has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the firstt loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en:
Yassine is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Yassine has owned a barber shop since 1998. He decided to open this business because he learned the skills in an academy. He gained experience while working with his brother, so that he could open his own shop. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the necessary tools for his shop.

His clients are his family members, friends, neighbors and others. Yassine is exceptionA. because he does good work and offers quality hair products to his clients.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to change the décor of his shop. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, Yassine plans to improve his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: F. Célestine est née le 11 Février 1962 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Depuis près de 10 ans, Célestine vit à PK10 Enafa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à ZOCLANCLOUNON Bertin, un entrepreneur bâtiment, Célestine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Célestine a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Célestine mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (conserves, lait, cigarettes, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, insecticides, savons, etc.) à son domicile. Célestine vend également des produits de mercerie, de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine achète ses produits. Célestine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursé. Le bon usage desdits crédits obtenus auparavant lui a permis d’étendre son activité. C’est donc pour assurer une diversification de son activité qu’elle souhaiterait bénéficier d’un autre concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Célestine F. was born February 11, 1962 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé department of Benin. For almost ten years, Célestine has been living at PK10 Enafa, in the Sèmè-Podji area. She is married to Bertin ZOCLANCLOUNON, a building contractor, and mother of three children, all in school. Célestine lives with her husband and children, and the couple share family expenses. She attended school up to secondary level. To cope with different household expenses, Célestine sells various items from her home (canned goods, milk, cigarettes, sugar, pasta, insecticides, soap, etc.). Additionally, she sells haberdashery articles, which diversifies her sources of income. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Célestine is a long-time member of ALIDé, having already been granted five loans, all of which were fully reimbursed. These loans were put to good use and allowed her to expand her activities. It is to strengthen this diversification of her business that Célestine now seeks another financial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various grocery products (canned goods, milk, sugar, pasta) and haberdashery articles

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de buen carácter, tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en su cómoda casa (propia) de material noble y prime piso. 

Lo que más le gusta hacer a Judith es tejer y lo hace muy bien, todos los días de la semana, sobre todo por las tardes, se sienta a tejer chompas, ya sea a palitos o a crochet. 
Con un sin número de coloridos hilos, poco a poco, va dándole forma a diferente modelos y tamaños de prendas, las cuales son muy solicitadas por sus clientes.
En este negocio lleva aproximadamente 10 años, y ya cuenta con dos ayudantes tejedoras con quienes trabaja para cumplir con sus pedidos.
Judith está muy contenta con lo que hace, jamás imaginó que el arte que su madre le enseñó en hoy sea su soporte económico. 
Su deseo a futuro es construir varios cuartos en su casa para posteriormente rentarlos y de ese modo generarse ingresos sin demasiado esfuerzo.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y renueva compromiso de seguir siendo muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que le gustaría seguir contando con posteriores créditos. Asimismo  dice sentirse muy bien con sus compañeras de grupo, a quienes les tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diversas variedades, para tener en stock y tenga la seguridad de poder crear cualquier prenda.
texts.en:
Judith is a woman of good character. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a comfortable one-story home that they own and is made of solid materials.

What Judith enjoys most is knitting and she does it very well. She engages in this activity every day of the week, especially in the evenings. Her creations are mainly sweaters made using knitting needles or by crochet. Using an endless number of colorful yarns, Judith gives shape to different styles and sizes of garments. Her products are highly sought after by her customers. She has been in this business for approximately ten years and she has two assistants who help with completing her orders.

Judith is very happy with what she does. She never imagined that the skill that her mother taught her would one day help provide financial support. Her wish for the future is to build various rooms to her house that can be rented. This will help generate income with little effort.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Judith has renewed her commitment to continue being responsible with her payments because she would like to receive subsequent loans. In addition, she gets along well with the other members of her Communal Bank, who have much appreciation for her. Judith will use the money to purchase yarns of different varieties so that she will have it on stock for making any type of garment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca la flor, el señor Mauro Q. se dedica a la producción agropecuaria en la que realiza varios cultivos como son la crianza de ganado como es bobino, porcino y avícola en sistema intensivo y el establecimiento de cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo los que proveen el medio para el sostén de sus cinco hijas y su esposa, el señor Mauro Q. trabaja de 6 a 2 de la tarde en las tareas agropecuarias junto con su familia.
El crédito que el solicita será empleado en la compra de una vaca parida la cual ayudara a aumentar su hato ganadero y mejorara los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, in the Flor district, Señor Mauro Q. raises animals and crops. He produces various products, raising animals such as cattle, young pigs, and poultry in an intensive system and establishing crops such as corn, sesame, and sorghum, which provide the means of support for his five daughters and his wife. Señor Mauro Q. works with his family from 6 until 2 in the afternoon doing the farm chores. The loan which he is requesting will be used in the purchase of a cow that has just given birth, which will help increase his herd and improve the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow that has just given birth

loans.name: Arlly Maria

texts.es:
esta cliente esta ubicado en la comunidad de el cambio las lomas y ella ya ha tenido 5 creditos con nuestra empresa .
ella ha obtenido para diferemtes sectores economico porque le financiamos para crianza de cerdo y hoy le dimos para ganado pero como esta barato tiene pensado incrementar mas el ganado.
tiene una espiritu de superacion y agrandar mas el hato ganadero.
texts.en:
This client is located in el Cambio, Las Lomas. She has had 5 loans with our firm. She has gotten loans for a variety of commercial activities. We have funded pig raising and today we provided funds for cattle because it's inexpensive now and she plans to increase her cattle herd. She has the spirit for self-improvement and to increase her herd size.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep her calves.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamin C. A. de 46 años de edad es de profesión carpintero muy conocido en la zona de Villarrica, se dedica a la preparación de puertas, ventanas, marcos y variedades de muebles. Empezó hace mas de 5 años con la ayuda de su señora, trabaja con su hijo Walter Gustavo C. de 20 años de edad, la carpintería es de su popiedad y lo tiene en su domicilio ubicado en la ciudad de Villarrica departamento del Guairá.

Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima, especialmnte madera e insumos como clavo, lijas,  además quiere aprovechar una oferta en la zona en cuanto a la madera y con estos materiales y herramientas podrá mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 46 years old and is very well known as a carpenter in the Villarrica area. He works making doors, windows, frames, and a variety of furniture. He began doing this more than five years ago, with the help of his wife. He works with his son, 20 year old Walter Gustavo. He owns the carpentry business and runs it from his home in the city of Villarrica, in the department of Guairá.

He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials, especially wood and supplies such as nails and sandpaper. He also wants to take advantage of an offer available with regard to the wood, and with these materials and tools he will be able to improve the quality of his products and so increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (wood), supplied (nails), and tools

loans.name: Navoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Navoeun D. (in the photo), is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yan, also 35 years old, have been married since 1994. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of the children are in school and the third is still young and stays at home. They live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Navoeun used to be a garment factory worker. She started a new business selling gasoline and ice in front of her house. Her husband drives a motor remoque taxi. Remoque is a motorbike with a trailer attached to the back. 

Navoeun is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Santiago II, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Yungueñitas.

Rosa L. Vaquez, con 43 años es casada y tiene el negocio de tejido de prendas de vestir, como las chompas. Rosa trabaja en su domicilio ya que le hacen pedidos por mayor y menor y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana.

Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Yungueñitas tienen variados negocios como la elaboración de puertas, reparación de radios, venta de edredones, frutas, costura de deportivos y venta de CDS.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios
texts.en:
The “Yungueñitas” Communal Association meets every two weeks at one of the Community Centers of Pro Mujer – Santiago II.

Rosa L. V. is 43 years old, married, and has a business selling woven apparel such as sweaters. She works from home and fulfills both wholesale and retail orders. Rosa needs a loan to buy raw materials such as wool.

The remaining members of the “Yungueñitas” Communal Association have various businesses such as manufacturing doors, repairing radios, selling bedspreads, selling fruit, manufacturing sportswear, and selling CDs. They all need a loan to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old and the single mother of three children who range from 7 to 15 years old. All three currently attend school while she works as a farmer and sells milk in the local market. She also runs a hotel in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. Susan went into business many years ago by selling groceries, then switched to farming, where her biggest challenge is the fluctuating price of milk, especially during the rainy season when prices are very low.

To improve her life and standard of living, she has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 20,000 to begin raising poultry. She hopes the income from this loan will help her lease enough land to expand her farm. She is optimistic that this is the best way to increase opportunity for her and her family.

loans.use: To begin raising poultry

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena L. is from the village of Babanlagan, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old. Rowena is single and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is a married woman who lives in Jingjang Village, Brgy. Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business venture as an Avon Cosmetics Dealer.  

Her husband, Francis B., is 30 years old and works as a laborer to earn his living. They have no children.

Victoria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Victoria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty through hard work. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP which increased the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th loan cycle, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP which she intends to use to to improve her business so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. 

Victoria B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de la Concepción tiene 44 años,  tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica es una pulpería hace más de 10 años que Doña María se dedica a su negocio Y dio inicio con muy poco capital, y es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mejorar su negocio. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El destino de este es capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa y así no perdería su clientela.
texts.en:
María de la Concepción is 44 years old and has three children. She has worked in her store for more than 10 years, which she began with very little working capital. This is not the first loan that she has applied for; it was thanks to previous loans that she has been able to improve her business. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase pulses, chicken, meat, cheese and soft drinks so that she does not lose her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eighteen members which located in Samraong village, Kandal province. Mr. Phat P. is 62 years old and he is the leader of a group loan having been selected by its members. While the members of this village loan will use it’s to support their different purpose. 
Mr. Phat P. is a farmer who owns a plot a plot of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, he will use the loan that asked from AMK to pay for laborer to plow his farm and pay for farming laborer. His wife, Mrs. Soeun Ouch, is mate weaving who is able to earn a small income to support her family living. This couple has two children, one is a farmer and one is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To pay for laborer to plow his farm and pay for farming laborer

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa que le fue heredada por su suegra. Desde hace 5 meses vende comida, y con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos mayores, puede atender a la clientela que acude en su pequeño establecimiento. Siendo este puesto habilitado con un triciclo como base, y del que se encuentra instalado en la puerta de su casa, asimismo tiene mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Una de sus  estrategias para atraer a sus comensales es el televisor que tiene, por lo que garantiza el retorno de sus consumidores. Afirma que le gusta trabajar porque se genera sus propios recursos, ya así puede dar bienestar a sus hijos, además que siempre ha sido una gran salida para afrontar momentos difíciles en la economía. Considera que este negocio es rentable porque  no requiere de mucha inversión y le da rentas que puede  cubrir sus gastos por lo que su deseo es mejorar su negocio con mejores instalaciones en su propio local. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra mercadería como gaseosa y dulces para que tenga mayores opciones de ventas.
texts.en:
Yudith is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in a house that they inherited from her mother-in-law. She has been selling food for five months and with the help of her two oldest children she is able to serve the clients that come to her small establishment. She sells food from a stall at the door of her home where she has tables and chairs for the comfort of her clients. One of her strategies to attract diners is the television that she has which guarantees that consumers will return. She says she likes to work because she generates her own income and can provide for the well being of her children and it is a great way to face difficult economic times. Yudith believes this business is profitable because it does not require much investment and gives her the income to cover her expenses so her desire is to improve this business with better facilities. This is the first loan with field partner MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support. She is also happy to be part of a community bank because all of its members are responsible people and very supportive. Yudith is grateful to all those people who will be managing the loan which will be very helpful in the progress of her business. She will invest the loan she is requesting on the purchase of merchandise such as soft drinks and candies so that she can provide more options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Djabir

texts.ru:
Djabir Yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz okupirovannix territoriy Azerbaydjana iz Fuzuli, Seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione poselok Bala-Bahmanli. Djabir A. 28 let. On ne jenat i jivet so svoyey semyoy.

Djabir nachal zanimatysa skotovodstvom 5 let tamu nazad posle toqo kak eqo otec zabolel. Etomu biznessu eqo nauchil eqo otec  s detstva. Seychas Djabir nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov. Djabir sam delayet sir i yoqur i prodayet.
texts.en:
Djabir A. is an internally displaced person. He is a refugee from Azerbaijan’s occupied territories in Fuzuli. At present he lives in the village of Bala-Bahmanli in the Fuzuli region. He is 28 years old. He is single and lives with his relatives. Djabir started raising cattle five years ago, after his father had fallen ill. He has learned this trade from his father, from his childhood on. At present he needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy cattle. Djabir makes his own cheese and yogurt for sale.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 22 years old and single. He is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last three years and has employed one farmhand. He sells his milk at the local market. He also earns some income from his small-scale farming of tea, which he sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority in Kapset market.

Jeremiah has requested this loan of 50,000 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from the sale of the milk will enable him repay his loan and meet the basic needs of his family. However, he faces the challenge of amimal diseases and a poor transportation network. In the future, he would like to improve his dairy farming so that it becomes a high-yielding business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is from San Jose, Antique. She is 55 years old. She is married and has three adult children. To make a good living, Florinda owns and operates a vegetable vending business at Trade Town of San Jose. Florinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns good profits for these activities. In 1999, Florinda aimed to join ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living condition and to have the ability to engage in more business activities. Florinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. Since she was able to repay her previous loan, she is now qualified to apply for another loan with a higher amount than the first one she had. Now, she plans to utilize this and future loans in the same business until it grows. She wishes that some day, she can put up her own stall, not rent in the public market, so that her income will increase and she will be able to give her customers convenient purchases in their village that is far away from the marketplace.

She hopes that, with the help of this KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambitions to step out from under the umbrella of poverty, develop her business, and provide for the needs of her grandchildren in school.

Florinda's aspiration for all of her children is for them to have a decent living, and this is the reason she wants her business to succeed. Her loan in ASHI is a very important factor that could lead her towards fulfillment. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Florinda is hopeful that her business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: To use for selling vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Maela

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años tiene 5 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio, por lo que anteriormente tenía una pulpería, pero con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando la venta de cosméticos además que algunos clientes no le pagaban es por eso que no pudo seguir. Por lo que es cliente de Fundación León 2000 desde hace tiempo y ha tenido cierta experiencia con los financiamientos. Juana solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como lápiz labial, polvos, sombras, perfumes, cremas y tratamientos.
texts.en: Juana, 46, has 5 children and works selling cosmetics. She has been in the cosmetics business for 16 years, which has not always been easy. Prior to this she had a stationary store but over time she came to enjoy selling cosmetics. Moreover, some of her customers were not making payments and she was not able to continue the stationary business. A client of Fundación León 2000 for some time, Juana has experience with loans. She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as lipstick, powders, eye shadows, perfumes, creams, and hair and body treatments.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Marcelo Ruben

texts.es: Marcelo Rubén se dedica al comercio de cerdo y ganado en pie. El  inicio hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy  gratificante obtener este medio de vida. El negocio lo inicio cuando se caso pues sus padres anteriormente tenían este medio de vida y que necesitaban que Marcelo lo aprendiera para que en el futuro brindara la manutención de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ganado pues ha recibido muy buenas ofertas y no quiere desperdiciarlas.
texts.en: Marcelo Rubén works selling live pigs and cattle.  He has had this business for more than 11 years and it has been very rewarding to have this means of income.  He began the business when he got married because his parents previously worked in this trade and they needed Marcelo to learn it so that he could support his family in the future.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of cattle because he has received very good offers and doesn’t want to miss them.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia Elena M. A. es comerciante del Mercado Central desde hace cuatro años tiene un puesto de venta de ropa. Es casada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00  que fueron aporte de su esposo, poco inventario, antes ella se dedicaba a cuidar a sus hijos y  su casa pero quiso poner un negocio para no depender de nadie y con esta situación económica que estamos atravesando contar con otros ingresos ya que son tres niños los que hay que mantener y actualmente está esperando a otro.
La Señora M. A. tiene 1 año de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos obtenidos por nosotros le han servido de mucho ya que su inventario ha incrementado ha podido sacar adelante a sus niños se esfuerza por ellos y para ellos trabaja diario busca la manera de cómo colocar la mercadería en otros tramos dejándola al crédito y cobrando al  diario.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Elena M. A. is a merchant at the Central Market where she been managing a clothing stand for the past four years. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. With the support of her husband, Silvia was able to start her business with capital of 3000 NIO that he gave her to acquire a small inventory. Previously her only responsibility was to take care of the house and the children, but she wanted to have a business so that she would not become dependent on anyone. With the current economic situation, Silvia needed another form of income in order to support her three children and another one coming soon.

Sra. M. A. has been working with CEPRODEL for the past year and used the loans she obtained to increase her inventory. This has allowed her children to move forward. Every day Silvia looks for different ways to display her merchandise. She extends credit and collects payments on a daily basis.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for adults & children

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros P. is 47 years old and married, and she supports her family by operating fishing and fish-vending businesses. She lives in Tagumapay, Barangay Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of approximately $117. 

Milagros is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can continue to fund operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. She hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita T. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Rosita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to like "afritada", "caldereta" & beef steak to customers in the local community. Rosita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Elma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells snack foods and instant noodles. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & detergents. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 55 años, está casada con Jesús, de 63 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Eden, de 18 y César, de 15 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Está pareja de esposos, a pesar de su avanzada edad, siguen unidos, y sobre todo trabajando mucho, para sacar a delante a sus dos últimos hijos. Hace 15 años que se dedican a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, palta y plátanos. Herlinda nos cuenta que ambos coordinan para poder vender sus sembríos, mientras que ella lleva a vender al mercado central de La Merced, los plátanos que cada 15 días cosecha, su esposo Jesús, comercializa, su grano de café en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar. Todo el esfuerzo que realizaron en estos años, lograron que ahora obtengan más de 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, en los que planean incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus cultivos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera lograr sus objetivos con el apoyo de los que integran está nueva asociación. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en sus viveros de café.
texts.en: 55-year-old Herlinda is married to 63-year-old Jesús. These two have 9 children, but only two of them live with them: Eden (18) and César (15). In family union, they live in their own home, located in the town of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle).  This married couple, despite their advanced age, continues together and, above all, works a lot in order to help their two last children get ahead. They have worked in agriculture for the last 15 years. Their principal crops consist of coffee, avocados and bananas. Herlinda tells us that they both coordinate to be able to sell their crops; while she goes to sell the bananas (which they harvest every 15 days) at the central market La Merced, her husband Jesús sells their coffee beans in the Alto Palomar cooperative. Through all the effort they put in these years, they have succeeded in obtaining more than 3 hectares of land for agriculture, in which they plan on increasing the quality and quantity of their crops. This is the first time that Herlinda is taking a loan with MFP, and she hopes to achieve her goals with the support of the members of this new association. With the loan that she will receive, she plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer that she will spread over her coffee nursery.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for her coffee plantation

loans.name: Marilin

texts.es:
Marilin es una cliente de 24 años, conviviente, que reside con su pareja y su hija en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a preparar y vender salchipollos (plato consistente en una fritura de pollo, mezclado con papas fritas, hot dog y ensalada de verduras).  El ofrece este producto en su casa, los días sábado y domingo y debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos, actualmente goza de una clientela estable y fiel que siempre recurre a su negocio para solicitar los alimentos que ofrece.

Marilin necesita adquirir insumos para ampliar su producción y responder a la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta.  Por ello ha creído conveniente comprar diversos artículos como aceite, verduras y hot dog.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente pedir un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Marilin is a 24 year old client.  She is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her life partner and their daughter in the Tambogrande district.  It is an agricultural district in the Piura region.  It is over three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She prepares and sells “salchipollos” (a dish which consists of fried chicken mixed with fried potatoes, hot dog, and a medley of vegetables).  She sells this product at her house on Saturdays and Sundays.  Due to the good seasoning that she uses to prepare her dishes, she now has stable and loyal customers.  They always go to her business to request the foods that she makes.

Marilin needs to get supplies to increase her production to respond to the demand she now has.  That is why she believes it is advisable to buy various things like oil, vegetables, and hot dogs.  In order to achieve her objective she believes it is wise to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To get supplies to increase her production

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order  to eradicate poverty in her family and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: 5 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Tu N. T. (23) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh H..  Tu is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 5 Nam Ngan (02.06.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Tu is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Tu owns & operates a tailoring business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2011, Tu joined Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tu is requesting  a loan from Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women for the first time.    She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women.  Tu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Ha (24) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


2.  V. T. Ngoc (25) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her general store.


3.  L. T. D. H. (26) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


4.  L. T. H. (27) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall.


5.  N. T. Su (28) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall.


6.  L. T. Thuc (29) is a 65-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


7.  D. T. H. (30) is a 41-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh H. Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh H. province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tu N. T. (23) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh H..  Tu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 5 Nam Ngan (02.06.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tu kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Tu đã tham gia Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Ha (24) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  V. T. Ngoc (25) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  L. T. D. H. (26) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


4.  L. T. H. (27) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5.  N. T. Su (28) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


6.  L. T. Thuc (29) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  D. T. H. (30) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh H. Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer, seeds, and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim T., 53, is a villager in Shahristan town in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own a 0.5 hectare of land where they cultivate vegetables. They are also engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. On their plantation, they now face the obstacle of not having enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. Ibrohim is therefore requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop, as well as to buy young cattle.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International: 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Firdavsjon

texts.ru: Бозоров Фирдавсчон проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Фирдавсчон предоставляет услугу, он развозит людей по маршруту Куляб-Хамадони. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки новой машины этой же марки. Он хочет продать свою имеющуюся машину и, положив сверху деньги, купить новую.
texts.en: Firdavsjon B. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Firdavsjon provides a service driving people along the route between Kulyab and Hamadoni. He has been doing this for four years. He is taking out a loan to buy a new car just like his old one.  He wants to sell his current car and, with the money from the loan, buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Jalol

texts.en:
Jalol is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of his family. He works hard raising cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt, it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. His wife is also engaged in this business. Currently, Jalol wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle, which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is 37 years old and has three children who are between the ages of five and 17. Her husband sells shoes. Nelie has been selling tomatoes in the market on a wholesale scale for the past 11 years. This business has enabled her pay school fees for her children and pays her house rent as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell and make more profits. She plans to buy a piece of land with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Zabron

texts.en: Zabron is 30 years old and single.  He runs a retail business selling cereals to earn a living.   His business is only six months old.  In addition, he does outside catering for extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a saving culture.  This has helped him to manage his finances.  He hopes to have a well-established business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to start a business selling mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To start a business selling mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Rosita is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business buying and selling coconuts for copra in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional coconuts & green bananas. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & green bananas

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 1 est composé  de femmes mariées du village de MORIBILA KAFONO de la sous préfecture de Kimparana  dans la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 7 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide et du sésame.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
KADIA, assise en T-shirt blanc, compte acheter,  des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 75 000 à 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI 1 is composed of married women from the village of MORIBILA KAFONO, in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana, Prefecture of SAN, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women live in traditional families, and they average 33 years of age and seven children each. They grow peanuts and sesame. 

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. After properly repaying the previous loans, they are now on their fourth farm loan.

KADIA, who is seated in the photo and wearing a white T-shirt, intends to buy some peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and soil amendments for farming. These items will be purchased at the main market of Kimparana and at surrounding markets. Following the off-season, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then they are sold retail (often wholesale) for cash. Their customers generally come from large cities. 

After selling their produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 75,000 to 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for paying the interest on the loan and for typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana tiene 55 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y un chica de 17 años que este mes empieza a estudiar en la universidad, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Esta  en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio,  es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección por lo cual para sacar a sus hijos adelante hace nueve años puso un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en donde  se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa, nos cuenta que lo que más confecciona es  ropa de dormir, ella trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también entrega en bazares  las prendas que ella elabora. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura.

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde  pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
In the municipal fortress of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, (known for many years as "The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees"), the members of the New Star Community Bank for Development meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Señora Mariana.  She is 55 years old, and a single mother of three children; two of them are grown and the third is a 17 year old girl who this month began to study in university.  All her children still live at home.  She has been part of the Community Bank from the beginning and is the president of it, and she likes it for the support they have provided.

Several years ago she learned to cut and sew clothing.  In order to help her children get ahead, she started a small sewing shop in her home nine years ago, where she works sewing all kinds of clothes.  She tells us that what she makes most is sleepwear.  She works based on orders from individuals and also delivers the garments she makes to bazaars​​. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver.  Her daughter helps her when she has time.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a warehouse in the center of the city where she can sell her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 26 years old, married and has a three-year-old child who goes to school.  He has been operating a retail shop for five years and has employed two people.  He also does motorbike (bodaboda) transport business to earn a living. 
 
Onesmus testifies that he has improved his business through the seminars held by Faulu Kenya where he was trained in business management.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. Она – мать двоих сыновей: 8 и 3 лет. Светлана частный предприниматель из Ивано-Франковска. Там она работает на центральном промышленном рынке Траян. После училища Светлана не захотела идти работать на маленькую зарплату и пошла на базар продавцом. Поработав года 3 как наемный работник, она решила начать свое дело, чем и занимается по сей день. Светлана торгует разнообразными галантерейными товарами: ремнями, сумочками, кепками, блейзерами, тапками и т.д. Ее товарное место хорошо известно многим покупателям своими умеренными ценами на весь ассортимент товарного ряда. Светлана работает в этой сфере торговли уже 8 лет. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 5.000 гривен.  

Светлана просит кредит на сумму 10.000 гривен. Она планирует закупить ассортимент ремней – 250 штук и 15 штук сумок на продажу в розницу. Она хотела бы подготовиться к августу и обновить ассортимент товара для молодежи. Бизнес Светланы – главный источник дохода для семьи клиента.  Светлана не унывает, ведь хотя в результате кризиса она потеряла одну торговую точку, ей все равно удалось сохранить бизнес и она успешно продолжает его развивать дальше. На полученную прибыль, Светлана хотела бы доделать ремонт в квартире, где живет вся ее семья. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Svitlana is married and the mother of two sons, eight and three years old. She is an entrepreneur living in Ivano-Frankivsk. She works as a vendor at the main industrial market “Traian.” After finishing technical college, Svitlana decided against accepting a low-paying job and started working as a marketplace vendor instead. After having worked for three years as an employee, she decided to launch her own business, which she is still running at present. She sells various accessories such as belts, handbags, caps, blazers, slippers etc. Her stall is well known with customers thanks to her low prices on a wide variety of goods. Svitlana has been doing this line of work for eight years. Her monthly income is 5,000 Hryvnias (UAH). She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH. She plans to stock up on belts (250 pcs) and handbags (15 pcs) for retail. She would like to get ready for August and replenish her selection of goods oriented toward young people. Svitlana’s business is the main source of income for her family. She does not get discouraged, even though she had to give up one of her stalls due to   financial crisis. At least she  has managed to preserve her business, and now she continues to grow it further. Svitlana would like to use her anticipated earnings to pay for repairs in the apartment where her whole family lives. Note: this loan description is provided in Russian.

loans.use: to buy 250 belts and 15 handbags for retailing

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina sells fruit, clothes and aluminum pans by peddling in the vicinity of Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She has received junior high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is into wood products. 

Ernestina has been in this business for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more clothes and pans for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and pans for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her husband is a professional carpenter and expert in making furniture. He operates his business in the market and manufactures very good quality  furniture. Due to his good quality work, he receives good appreciation from his customers. 

Kalsoom is the mother of seven children. Two elder sons work in a factory while others support their mother in her embroidery work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because she wants to buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. This will help her make more income every month. 

She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and is confident that an investment will help her improve her business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material in bulk

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, es una mujer luchadora D. 56 años. Hace 20 años que enviudo. Ella tiene 7 hijos y una economía estable, pero ahora solo vive con su hija Karina, “madre soltera”, a quien apoya en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D.  Huancal - Huaricolca.  
Su vitalidad y coraje lo demuestra en sus logros obtenidos. El orgullo que tiene por su última hija; Mily, D. 25 años, que terminó la carrera D. enfermería y así como ella 2 D. sus hermanos son profesionales. A pesar D. sus limitaciones pudo pagar los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos. Todo esto gracias a la siembra D. papa, olluco, cebada y avena, que le proporcionaron buenas utilidades. En la actualidad sus cosechas, son muy cotizadas en el mercado central D. la ciudad y, como mujer luchadora, en campañas agrícolas viaja a las ciudades D. Lima, Chanchamayo y Masamari a ofrecer tubérculos al por mayor y verduras al menudeo. Pero consiente que las campañas agrícolas no duran todo el año, muy hábil ella tiene varias cabezas D. ganado ovino y vacuno que le ayudan en solventar algunos gastos. Para más adelante está planeando, ampliar su negocio D. ganadería con la mejora D. su granja D. animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza” y este es el décimo tercer préstamo con MFP, donD. es reconocida en su banco comunal, como una persona responsable; por ello ocupa un cargo importante dentro D. su grupo. Además promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Rosalia está pensando sembrar 50 sacos D. semilla D. papa “yungay, única y canchan”, por ello D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra. Asimismo el pago D. los peones que le ayudarán en la jornada.
texts.en:
Rosalia, 56, is a hard-working woman. She has been a widow for 20 years. She has seven children and her economic situation is stable, but she now lives in her own home with her daughter Karina, a single mother, whom she helps. They live in the Huancal - Huaricolca town.
Her vitality and and courage are demonstrated in her successes. She is proud of her oldest daughter, Mily, age 25, who just finished nursing school; like Mily, two of her brothers are professionals. Despite her limitations, Rosalia was able to pay for her children's university studies. All of this is thanks to her crops of potato, ulluco, barley and oats, which bring her a good income. Currently her harvests are very sought-after in the city's central market. And, as the hard-working woman that she is, during agricultural seasons she travels to the cities of Lima, Chanchamayo and Masamari to sell her tubers wholesale, and to sell vegetables at retail prices. However, the agricultural seasons do not last all year, so this bright woman has several heads of ovine and bovine livestock which helps her to cover some costs. For the future, she is planning to expand her livestock business through improving her animal farm. She belongs to the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] Communal Bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. In MFP she is known in her communal bank as a responsible person, and because of this she occupies an important position in the group. She promises to be punctual with her quotas. Rosalia plans to purchase 50 bags of potato seeds of the Yungay, Unica and Canchan variety. Upon receiving your support, she will invest the requested loan in the purchase of various bags of natural fertilizers to start her new planting with success. She will also pay the labourers who help her during the day.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Don Jaime es un hombre luchador de 50 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos.

El señor Jaime desde muy pequeño inicio a trabajar en el campo siendo un agricultor. Sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo y ya tiene 40 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Para que sus cultivos produzcan buenos frutos el señor Jaime tiene que adquirir insumos como fertilizantes, herbecidas estos los compra  en una cuidad del oriente del país.

El señor Jaime utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbecidas ya que el desea obtener una mejor producción. De esta manera don Jaime podrá tener una seguridad económica y le brindara un mejor futuro a su familia.

Los planes del señor Jaime son principalmente la educación académica de sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda ya que solo tiene dos cuartos y desea construir otro mas.
texts.en:
Jaime is a tenacious, 50-year-old man who’s married and has two children.  Jaime has been working as a farmer since a very young age.  His parents taught him this occupation and he has been dedicated to this activity for 40 years.

So that his crops will be more productive Jaime must acquire supplies like fertilizer and herbicides.  He buys these things in a city in the east of the country.

Jaime will use the loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers and herbicides because he wants to obtain better crops.  In this way Jaime will be able to have economic security and provide a better future for his family.

Jaime’s plans are primarily his children’s education and to do some home improvements because it only has two rooms and he’d like to add another one.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una D. las miembros, quien oyó hablar del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, se informó y quedó encantada con la idea, por lo que organizó y formó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio. D. allí surge el comité denominado Mujeres Activas, que cuenta con 18 integrantes, las cuales trabajan D. forma conjunta para la consecución D. los objetivos que ellas persiguen. Sus sueños son sacar siempre adelante a su empresa a su familia.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Domiciana, ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, comenta que tiene muchos clientes y clientas que siempre compran D. ella, hace un tiempo que se dedica a esto por lo que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Le gustara poder seguir con su negocio, por lo que quiere poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías, tanto masculina como femenina, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to one of the members.  She heard talk about a program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya.  She learned about it and was delighted with the idea.  Therefore, she organized and educated her friends and neighbors.  From there the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) Communal Bank emerged.  There are 18 members, and they work together in order to achieve the objectives that they pursue.  Their dreams are always to get their businesses and their families ahead. 

Domiciana is one of the members.  She sells underwear.  She says that she has a lot of customers, and customers always buy from her.  She has been doing this for some time; therefore she now has solid customer base.  She would like to be able to continue her business, and that is why she wants to be able to keep investing in it.

She is requesting the loan to buy underwear, as much for men as women.  With the loan she will be able to fill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy underwear to later sell.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es: Minerva esta casada y tienen 6 hijos la mayor estudia para estilista,  y los que siguen estudian preparatoria y primaria, y el menor tiene un año. Ella es originaria de una población donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de flor de nochebuena y donde hacen unas artesanías en barro preciosas las cuales los turistas las compran por el atractivo que tienen. Mini como de cariño le dicen tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 17 años aproximadamente, esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para invertir en la tienda de abarrotes que atiende, con el crédito que le otorgaran ella comprara artículos como pañales desechables, enlatados, sopas, cerillos veladoras, café, focos etc. platica que surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de ella donde le dan precios bajos. Platica que ahorita en este momento no tiene problemas fuertes su única preocupación es que sus hijos estén bien de salud y en la escuela. El crédito le beneficiara por que podrá tener su negocio muy surtido y así podrá tener mejores ganancias. Comenta que la meta que tiene es poner otra tiendita en una comunidad donde no aya para que sus hijos los mayores se hagan responsables y la atiendan.
texts.en:
Minerva is married and has six children. The oldest is studying to be a hairstylist and the others are still in secondary and primary school. The youngest is one year old. She is originally from a town where the principal activity is the growing of poinsettias and where they make some beautiful precious clay handicrafts that the tourists find attractive and buy.

Her nickname is Mini and she says that she has had a grocery store for around 17 years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as disposable diapers, canned soups, matches, candles, coffee, light bulbs, and other items.

She says she buys her products in different stores from a town near hers, which has low prices. She tells us that right now at this very moment she has no major problems and her only concern is that her children are healthy and attend school. This loan would benefit her because she could have a well-stocked business and thus higher profits.

She comments that her goal is to have another little store in a community that doesn't have one and for her older children to take responsibility for it and look after it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали проживает в городе Куляб. Он женат. Ему 23 года. У него трое детей. Курбонали уже три года как занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает парфюмерию. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Он хочет купить лаки для ногтей, маски для лица, шампуни и косметику.
texts.en: Kurbonali lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 23 years old, married and has three children.  Kurbonali has been involved in sales for three years.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells perfumes.  He is requesting this loan to expand merchandise assortment.  He wants to purchase nail polish, facial masks, shampoos and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase polish, masks, shampoos and cosmetics

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman having three children. Zenaida is 56 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Zenaida owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 43,200 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

Zenaida has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Zenaida wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Nuru has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Nuru has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Nuru to generate greater profits and expand her business. Nuru hopes that in the future she will be able to own another business. 

Nuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has four children. She is a fishmonger and also sells cooked rice and stew, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She assists her husband in paying utility bills.  

Adjoa is requesting a loan to purchase fish and rice in bulk. Adjoa will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
