La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad, la socia es viuda, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 10  años de edad; la socia  es comerciante minorista, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia también tiene un terreno de cultivo y siembra verduras, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a Huaran. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar verduras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin."  This communal bank is located in the Arin district in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

Elizabeth is 27 years old and is a widow.  She has a son who is 10 years old.  She works in retail trade, buying and selling vegetables.  She also has some land where she cultivates vegetables.  Elizabeth takes her merchandise to sell in Huaran.  She requests a loan to invest in seeds to plant vegetables.

Elizabeth is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant vegetables

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis, vive en casa familiar con sus tres hijos de 15,18 y 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa y tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, estos negocios lo inicio debido a la necesidad económica, todos los días se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas y comprar productos de la canasta básica: arroz, aceite, café instantáneo, sopas, maruchan con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y poder obtener más ingresos.
La aspiración de Gertrudis es tener un negocio más amplio en el comercio e incrementar sus ventas para que sus ingresos sean mejores darles mejor estabilidad a sus hijos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Gertrudis lives in her family's home with her three children, ages 15, 18 and 28. She sells clothing and has a small store in her house. She started her businesses because of financial need, and she works every day. 

She needs a loan to buy more merchandise like skirts, blouses, pants and shirts as well as basic groceries like rice, oil, instant coffee, soups and noodles, with the goal of increasing her sales and earning more money. 

Gertrudis's goal is to have a bigger business and to increase her sales so that her income increases and she can give her children more stability.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Bonne Nouvelle Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BONNE NOUVELLE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de kossiwa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. kossiwa est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. kossiwa n’a pas fréquenté l’école. kossiwa est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a trois autres enfants à charge. kossiwa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, kossiwa vend depuis quinze environs des friperies pour enfants par le système de distribution et de manière ambulante. kossiwa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, kossiwa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BONNE NOUVELLE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group Bonne Nouvelle ("good news") is made up of three people living in the same neighbourhood. This is the third time they have requested financial assistance from Alidé to improve their business. The group's representative, Kossiwa, has her hand raised in the photo. 

Kossiwa is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is married to a man named Bruno. The couple has one child to support, who goes to school. As well as their child, they look after three other children. Kossiwa lives with her husband and the children. 

The couple together provide for the various needs of their family. Kossiwa supports the family by working as an itinerant vendor selling children's second-hand clothing. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Kossiwa is requesting a third loan from Alidé along with the other members of the group Bonne Nouvelle. The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with nine children. 
Luz has a snack vending business and earns approximately 1,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Luz has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Luz hopes to see her children finish their studies in order to help their financial problems. Luz is a hardworking mother and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.en: Josiane is a mother of two children whose ages are between 2 and 6. The oldest attends school and another one is still young.  Her husband works as a farmer.  Josiane is a group leader for the group called Amahoro meaning "Peace" in English.  The group members sell different products and all are very happy with the new loan they wish to get.  Josiane as a group leader sells foodstuff and she has been in this business for the past three years. She has decided to request the loan to buy more foodstuffs for sell.  With the profits from the business, she plans to build her commercial house instead of renting. In the future, she plans to expand her business and gain better profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Inmer Yovany

texts.es:
Inmer, es propietario de una venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/as, vive con su hermana y tres sobrinos, económicamente dependen de él sus padres y un hermano, no tiene parientes en el extranjero; su negocio nació hace un año, en sus inicios era una pequeña venta de ropa y celulares, lo hace de manera móvil, poco a poco ha mejorado su inventario y ganado buena clientela.
Comprará pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas y otras prendas para mejorar la mercadería que oferta en su negocio, sus clientes encontraran lo que buscan a buen precio y espera aumentar las ventas e ingresos para mantener la continuidad de su progreso.
Aspira tener su propio almacén para superar las malas circunstancias familiares y resarcir su deuda.

loans.use: Comprará pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas y otras prendas para mejorar la mercadería que oferta en su negocio.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives with her husband and her 15 years old son in Vratza. She graduated economics in university and has worked as an economist expert in a state company for 12 years.

After liquidation of this company Valentina and her husband tried some different businesses and now they keep a coffee shop in one of the city quarters.

Now their coffee shop needs some repairs and Valentina wants to change the furniture. She needa 12 tables, 60 chairs and a new bar plot. The loan amount is $ 1 800.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for the cafe

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 4. I repair watches for a living. I intend to use the loan to expand and diversify my business so as to enable me to pay school fees for my children with ease.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Alasgar is an internal refugee from Nagorno Karabakh. He is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. He fled to the Bilasuvar district of Azerbaijan in 1993. In 1994, he started his private animal breeding/sale business with a little money at his own expense. With this business, he started to make a living for his family little-by-little. After some time, he  expanded his business to meet the greater needs of his family and to make the business financially sustainable. Now, he has applied for an Agroinvest loan of $500 to buy a cow and further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Werlinton

texts.es:
Werlinton began his business four years ago. He sells delicious coconut and tropical fruit ice cream. His business is open everyday from 8:00am to 8:00pm.

Werlinton needs the loan to buy fruit and supplies needed in the production, maintenance, and sale of the ice cream.

Werlinton is 40 years old and is single with four children. From a young age we was interested in work. His first business was in the production of coconut sweets, a typical delicacy from his country. With the high demand for his sweets, Werlinton came up with the idea to make ice cream from tropical fruits. His house is made out of wood. He hopes to improve his business and income in order to generate work for those who sell his product.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Werlinton inicio su negocio hace 4 años. El producto que vende son los deliciosos helados de coco y frutas tropicales. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -20pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Werlinton necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más frutas y materiales que se utilizan para la elaboración, conservación y venta de los helados.

Información Personal

Werlinton tiene 40 años es soltero tiene 4 hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar. Siendo su primer negocio la elaboración de los dulces de coco típicos de su tierra la sobre oferta de estos dulces Hizo que en Werlinton surja la idea de crear los helados de frutas tropicales. Su vivienda esta construida de madera. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir creando fuente de trabajo para las personas que venden sus productos.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y otros ingredientes para sus helados // Purchase of fruit and other ingredients for his ice cream

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margret O., a 53-year-old woman, is married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and food. She is soliciting the loan amount of $400 to enable her to buy more drinks, food, and provisions. She has been in this business since 1996 and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & food

loans.name: Ninfa Juana

texts.es:
Miss Ninfa belongs to the Women in action Communal Bank. Her business is located at her home, near the Agua Blanca highway, at the May 2nd town, San Jose de Sisa district, El Dorado province, San Martin state. She sells groceries and bread. She recently expanded her business to distribute sodas. She has had this store for twelve years.

She recently received loan of S/. 3,000.00 ( US $1,000.00) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in four quotas. With this loan, she will be able to purchase various brands and varieties of of noodles (8 packages), preserved fish (4 boxes), rice and sugar ( 2 bags of each), oil gallos (for retail) and by liters. These products are highly required by Ninfa's customers. She will also supply her soda stock.

She is 41 years old. She has three children , two girls and a boy. The oldest daughter studies outside the city and she also works to help with her schooling expenses. She was born in the state of Ancash. Her wishes to move forward and help her husband with the home expenses drew them to migrate. She considers herself to be a fighter, persevering and she feels that this is a great job for her children because of her dedication to the business and unconditional support to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres en acción, tiene ubicado su negocio en un local propio en su misma casa, por la carretera a la Localidad de Agua Blanca, Centro Poblado de 02 de Mayo, distrito de San José de Sisa, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar y abarrotes, además amplió su negocio principalmente a la distribución de bebidas gasificadas, tiene desarrollando la actividad hace 12 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00), para pagar en 4 cuotas, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (08 paquetes), conservas de pescado (04 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (02 sacos de cada producto), aceite en galón (para su venta al menudeo) y en litros; debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su stock de bebidas gasificadas. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujeres y 01 varón, la mayor de sus hijas estudia fuera de la ciudad y que a su vez trabaja para ayudar en los gastos de sus estudios. Nació en el departamento de Ancash, los deseos de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en contribuir con el hogar los impulsó a migar. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase various items (groceries)

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima G. is married and has three children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2004, and in that time has used several loans to increase her sales volume and attract many new clients. She is a very skilled saleswoman, and people like to do business with her because she is polite, energetic and has a great selection of shoes to choose from. She buys these shoes in Istaravshan and Isfara and sells them in the community where she lives, Spitamen. Sales are strong, and she has applied for a loan to buy new inventory and further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Every day Guillermina starts work very early and works tirelessly to see the fruits of her labor. She is an expert baker who makes a wide variety of goods such as empanadas and flour pastries which she sells to different stores throughout the city. Guillermina learned the art of baking while studying at an occupational training center. When she was satisfied with the training she had received, she decided to install her production center at home so as to generate enough income for the benefit of her family. Right now she rents an oven to cook her bakery goods, and she wants to install her own oven to increase production. The price of flour, the raw material needed for her work, has increased considerably as of late, naturally causing her production to decrease. Her desire to own an oven so that she can sell her treats, as well as her desire to build a soda fountain in the near future, has led her to apply for a loan with which she will quickly make her plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina, trabaja incansablemente cada día desde muy temprano para ver los frutos de su trabajo.Ella es una experta pastelera que produce una inmensa variedad de productos como: empanadas y bocaditos a base de harina; para distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas de su ciudad.Guillermina aprendió el arte panadero cuando estudió en un centro de formación laboral; al culminar con satisfacción esta etapa de aprendizaje decidió implementar su centro de producción en casa a fin de generar ingresos en beneficio de su familia. Por ahora alquila un horno para la cocción de sus bocaditos y anhela construir su propio horno para incrementar su producción debido a que la harina materia prima de su trabajo durante estas semanas ha sufrido un incremento en su valor muy notable y desde luego su producción ha disminuido.Este deseo en especial y el de construir muy pronto una fuente de soda para ofrecer sus delicias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cristalizar en corto tiempo sus planes.

loans.use: To renovate her home oven in order to increase production.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya B., the mother of four young children, lives in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan. She makes snacks to sell to a local school canteen, while her husband builds bamboo cages for hens and other pets.

Last year, Suriya and three other women applied for a loan and saw their businesses grow. This year, she hopes to do the same so she'll be able to get brick floors for her home and do some repairs. With their shares of the loan, Sajida and Kalsoom want to purchase rickshaws for their husbands' businesses, while Koser hopes to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for a cage-making business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 35 year old married woman with 2 children, aged 20 and 15 years old. Magdalena owns a small saloon, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6m to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Magdalena has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem C. is 35 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells sugar cane juice and porridge to the people in her area; she makes an average of around $10 each day in income.

She has four children, two of whom work with at her food store and the others who are still in school. Mrs. Chem C. needs a loan to purchase an electrical sugar cane grinder to facilitate her business. This will give her an opportunity to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sugar cane grinder to facilitate her business.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is an entrepreneur from the city of Noviy Rosdil in western Ukraine. She has a small business selling women’s clothing from a little space at an outdoor market. Mariya has been self-employed for about nine years. Her business has been a good source of income for her and her husband, Vladimir. One of Mariya’s goals is to change out the old windows in their home with newer windows that will help them keep warmer in the winter.

Mariya has requested a short term loan to help restock her inventory for the spring and summer seasons. A new supply of clothing will allow to her maintain a good sales rate and help ensure a profitable summer.

loans.use: Restock inventory for the spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika works hard on her farm, and her work is increasing due to the absence of her partner, who works in remote areas and gets together with the family every month. Coping with the daily demands of her children is very difficult for Erika, despite having the support of her husband, and she needs help in providing an education for them. This really gets her down, but until now she has without doubt been a very good mother to her children. And thanks to her hard agricultural work, she is able to meet the daily needs of her little ones. Erika needs a loan so that she can buy the various tools necessary for her work, as well as the products she needs to take care of her plots of land, which will help her to cultivate products which are both profitable and of high quality.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Erika, trabaja duramente en la chacra y su esfuerzo se acrecienta debido a la ausencia de su pareja quien trabaja en zonas alejadas y mensualmente se reúne con su familia.Para Erika es muy difícil tener que lidiar diariamente con las necesidades de sus hijos y a pesar de tener el gran apoyo de su esposo requiere de ayuda para educar a sus hijos, este motivo la deprime mucho pero sin duda hasta hoy ha sabido ser una buena madre para sus hijos y gracias a sus labores de agricultora y ganadera satisface las necesidades diarias de sus pequeños.Requiere un préstamo para la compra de diversas herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y diversas productos para el cuidado de sus parcelas agrícolas que le ayude a cosechar productos rentables y de buena calidad.

loans.use: To buy tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tafiau

texts.en: 28 year old Tafiau A. is married, with three children.  Tafiau is in the food vending business where she sells banana chips and ice cakes to the general public five days per week. She earns a weekly net cash flow of 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Tafiau’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for loans from traditional banks. She plans to use the loan to purchase plastic bags, cordial, sugar, bananas, salt and cooking oil. As well, she will also purchase timber and iron roofing for her house.Tafiau has received four previous loans from SPBD.

loans.use: To expand food vending business

loans.name: Raquel Hermelinda

texts.es:
Raquel is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and her 12 year old son, and she is currently pregnant. She started her own business more than a year ago, selling baby clothes. In the past she sold books, so she had to walk plenty from door to door. She got the opportunity to start her own business, and she invested all the money she had saved. She works only in the mornings because due to the condition it is very hard for her to work more time. She has always liked sales, and that is why she is happy with this job, and she can help provide better things for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, and in the future would like to add books to her list of items for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel tiene 33 años, actualmente está embarazada, vive junto a su esposo y un niño de 12 años. Desde hace más de un año, se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebe, años atrás vendía de libros, por los que tenía que caminar por la calle, tocando puerta por puerta.Se le presentó la oportunidad de empezar un nuevo negocio, y no dudó en hacerlo, invirtiendo lo que había ahorrado hasta el momento.Solo atiende por las mañanas y ya que se le hace pesado más tiempo debido a su actual estado. Siempre ha sido de su agrado dedicarse a las ventas, por ello con este trabajo se siente feliz y puede brindarle mejores cosas a su familia. Solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería, en un futuro, piensa también añadir la venta de libros a su negocio de ropa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama S. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à  Apéyémé un village commercial des plateaux de Danyi à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle achète à chaque saison des produits tropicaux tels le café et le cacao qu’elle revend aux exportateurs. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle désire faire beaucoup plus de stocks. Le bénéfice étant lié directement à la quantité vendue, elle compte vraiment gagner avec cette opportunité de kiva ce qui lui permettra de rembourser promptement et améliorer la qualité de la vie.
texts.en:
Ama S. is 38 years old. She is married with five children. She lives in Apéyémé, a village on the Danyi plateau, about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Each season, she buys tropical products like coffee and cacao, which she sells to exporters. With this new loan, she wishes to greatly increase her stocks. Her profits being directly linked to the volume of her sales, she expects to benefit greatly from this opportunity Kiva has given her. This will allow her to pay off her debt promptly and improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cacao and coffee for resale

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación del presente comité fue la Sra. Gloria Caballero , reside en km10_Acaray De Ciudad Del Este, quien invito a las demás compañeras para formar el comité. Dichas señoras son caracterizadas por realizar Manualidades todas juntas ,trabajan en este oficio, aparte de eso también cada una de ellas tiene sus labores específicos como ser venta de ropas, bijouteria, joyas, confites, comidas rápidas , algunas tienen su propio comercio como despensa o kiosko. El comité se denomina Santa Lucía en honor a las señoras muy trabajadoras y solidarias . El monto retirado por el grupo fue de 15.100 .000. A cada una retiraron el monto de 300.0000. gs hasta 1.200.000 , el grupo esta constituido por 16 integrantes muy activas.

1. Donatilda A.: Peluquereia. 2. Graciela L. : Despensa 3. Gladys A.: Despensa. 4. Lilian V. : Venta de Toalla. 5. Antonia M.: Confección de Ropa . 6. Susana C. : Venta de Ropas 7. Silvia L.: Venta de Mercería. 8. Carmen R. D. : Venta de Comida. 9. Bernarda B.: Despensa 10.Rosa G. : Confitería. 11.Rosa S.: Despensa. 12.Felisa G. : Venta de Ropas. 13.Blanca A.: Venta de Bijuteri. 14.Blanca A. : Confección De Ropa. 15.Ilda Barrreto: Elaboración de Productos De Limpieza. 16.Tranquilina N.: Venta de Zapatos
texts.en:
The contact for the formation of this committee is Ms Glooria Caballero, who lives at km 10_Acaray De Ciudad Del Este. She invited the rest of the partners to form the committee. These women work together creating handicrafts. Besides working in this trade, all of them have specific duties, including clothing sales, jewelry, baked goods, fast food, and some have their own locations, such as kiosks or pantries. The committee is names Santa Lucia in honor of these dependable and hard working women. The groups loan is 15,100,000. Each member will receive 300,0000 to 1,200,000. There are 16 very active women in the group.

1. Donatilda A.: Hair styling.

2. Graciela L. : Pantry

3. Gladys A.: Pantry.

4. Lilian V. : Towel sales.

5. Antonia M.: Seamstress .

6. Susana C. : Clothing sales

7. Silvia L.: Sewing supplies.

8. Carmen R. D. : Food sales.

9. Bernarda B.: Despensa

10.Rosa G. : Bakery.

11.Rosa S.: Pantry.

12.Felisa G. : Clothing sales.

13.Blanca A.: Jewelry store.

14.Blanca A. : Seamstress.

15.Ilda Barrreto: Manufacture of cleaning products.

16.Tranquilina N.: Shoe sales


Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, meat, material, cosmetics, sugar, oil, convenience items, among others.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy P. is a villager in Samraong Khang Kiet Village in the Takeo Province. Soy P. is 25 years old and the mother of two young children ages 5 and 1.  She and her husband, Mr. Choek Sokhorn, cultivate rice for a living. The field has become infertile and is not producing enough of a crop. Mrs. Soy P. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and increase crop yield. Her husband is shown on the right of picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Носирова Соджида проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 32 лет .Замужем , имеет двоих детей, работает на центральном рынке районе. Торгует одеждой. В бизнесе уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sojida N. lives in the Gissar District. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She sells clothing in the district's central market. She has been in this business for 8 years already. She plans to receive a loan to be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juana Vilma se ha destacado en el Mercado La Terminal por sus ventas de productos como prensadores, colas, chapas, cosméticos entre otros.

Se dedica a vender estos productos desde el año 1993 y este ha sido su único ingreso con el que mantiene su hogar supliendo las necesidades que en él se presentan. Por ser madre soltera ella ha sido la única que ha llevado el sustento a su hogar y para esto se ha apoyado de las ventas obtenidas de sus productos gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos. Una vez más espera que le sea entregado su crédito para continuar con su negocio que tanto necesita de inversión.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma has excelled at La Terminal market by selling pins, hair ties, decorative buttons, and cosmetics, among other things. She has been selling these products since 1993, and it has been the only source of income for maintaining her home and meeting needs as they arise. Since she is a single mother she has been the only one providing for her home. Her merchandise sales have helped her, thanks to Ceprodel's support in purchasing those products. Once more she hopes Ceprodel will grant her loan so that she can continue her business, which very much needs investment.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra Mané est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du miel, de la myrrhe en Guinée Bissau et revendre à Ziguinchor. Diarra veut renforcer son commerce Ses revenus vont permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diarra Mané is married and the mother of four and has been a member of the village loan group in Ziguinchor for seven years. She wants to buy palm oil, honey, and myrrh in Guinea-Bissau and to resell them in Ziguinchor in order to boost her commerce. The income is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, honey, and myrrh

loans.name: Mirko

texts.es: Mirko tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres. Su familia es natural de la sierra, por motivos de estudios migró a la ciudad, a un kilómetro de la ciudad lograron adquirir sus terrenos hace 5 años, con el liderazgo de sus padres se dedicaron a sembrar café, cítricos y plátanos. A Mirko le agrada realizar la labor de un agricultor, lo que no le gusta es vender los productos en el mercado, pero cuando las frutas están maduras tiene que  comercializarlo sea como sea, aunque no le guste. Sus anhelos son de producir y cosechar en grandes cantidades. Mirko es un cliente muy dinámico, y tiene muchas expectativas positivas acerca del banco comunal, los demás integrantes acaban de nombrarle tesoro, y él alegremente juró cumplir su cargo con responsabilidad, y motivó a los demás clientes a realizar sus pagos en forma puntual. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para el abonado correspondiente de sus chacras de café y los cítricos. Desde ya Mirko está muy agradecido con todos aquellos que hacen posible este crédito, el cual le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mirko is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents. His family originally come from the mountains, but they migrated to the city for educational reasons, and managed to buy their land a kilometre from the city 5 years ago. Under his parents' direction, the family worked planting coffee, citrus trees and banana trees. Whereas farm work appeals to Mirko, he doesn't enjoy selling produce at market, but the ripe fruit must be sold regardless. What he really wants is to grow and harvest produce on a large scale. Mirko is a highly motivated client, encouraging the other clients to keep up with their repayments, and his prospects at the local communal bank are very promising, the other members having just appointed him Treasurer, a role he has gladly vowed to perform with full responsibility. He will use the money he is currently requesting to buy fertilizers for his coffee and citrus plantations. Mirko is extremely grateful in advance to all those who make this loan possible, which will help him to keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin, the 40-year-old mother of three children, is married to a commercial driver. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La señora María Antonia M. tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña María es venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio ella dio inicio por que necesitaba un trabajo, para sustentar a su familia y educar a sus hijos y decide establecer este negocio rentable en su vivienda. Los propósitos de Doña María son de mantener su clientela ya que tiene que mejorar cada día en la elaboración de sus productos. El financiamiento solicitado por Doña María es para la compra de materia prima como leña, cal y maíz. Sus sueños son de obtener un local para su negocio. la cantidad que solicita Doña María es de C$5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Antonia M. is 57 years old. She is married, and has six grown children, all of whom work. She earns her living by making and selling tortillas. She has been doing this for over 20 years, and she got into the business because she needed to find a way to earn a living from her home while she raised her children. Maris’s goals are to keep her existing clients while at the same time improving the quality of her products. Her loan will be used to buy raw materials for the tortilla production – such as corn, lime, and firewood. Her long-term goal is to have her own locale for her business. She is requesting C$5,000 Nicaraguan Cordobas [US $250].

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - raw materials

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa C. E. tiene 51 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, abandonó los estudios debido a que no le gustaba ir al colegio y se quedo en casa ayudando a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 03 hijos de los cuales solo 01 depende económicamente de ella.
Justa se dedica a la venta de tejidos, inició su negocio hace 25 años tejiendo chompas con lanas que le daban sus clientas en Huamachuco, luego se trasladó a Trujillo donde empezó tejiendo con lanas que ella misma compraba en el mercado, con el tiempo se hizo conocida y tiene muchos clientes. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra de lanas y herramientas para tejido. 

Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de lanas para la elaboración de las prendas de vestir.
Justa tiene el gran sueño de comprarse una máquina tejedora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justa C. E. is 51 and lives in Urb, in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed elementary school, but she she left her studies when she decided that she did not like going to school. She stayed at home helping her mother with the household chores. She has 3 children, but only one is economically dependent upon her. Justa sells needlework. She started her business 25 years ago by knitting sweaters with wool that her customers in Huamachuco gave her. Then, she moved to Trujillo where she started knitting with wool that she bought in the market. In time she became known and had many customers. She runs her business in her own home. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Nuevo Perú” (New Peru), she bought wool and tools for knitting. With a loan for 1700 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy wool for making clothes. Justa has the big dream of buying a knitting machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods (Wool)

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Maha has been selling used clothes from her house for ten years. She requested a loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her business. This is the first time that Maha has requested a loan. 
Maha is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started, she had difficulty building networking. Maha decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Agar Marlene

texts.en:
Mrs. Agar is single and lives with her parents. She does not have any children. She is a hairdresser and has a complete hair salon. Additionally she has a small stock of hair products for sale.

She studied to be a hairdresser, and her parents helped her gather capital in order to start her business.

The hair salon has a solid base of clientele thanks to the good attention it has received. Additonally she has a consistent location, as it has been in the same place for 5 years.

The credit applied for goes to the purchase of clothing, as her hair salon is very busy and she has faith that it could be a very profitable salesplace.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Caacupé Poty 2 Group

texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Seminario neighborhood of Caacupe, which is about four kilometers outsiD. the downtown area. 

With the financial support of the Fundación Paraguaya, they have been able to succeed. They have been sure of themselves in their businesses, despite the economic risks, and have planned ahead for whatever comes. 

This group is working on their 11th loan cycle with the Fundación. Every day they work at bettering their projects for their own personal and economic development. 

1. Rogelia G. D. B. - Beverage sales 
2. Mary Nelly F. - Clothing sales 
3. Maria Graciela C. - Food sales 
4. Euliana B. -	Small grocery store 
5. Rosa Ramona V. - Clothing sales 
6. Luisa Ramona V. - Small grocery store  
7. Elva M. - Raising and selling chickens 
8. Amalia G. - Dressmaker 
9. Delfina P. - Small grocery store  
10. María Luisa M. - Small grocery store 
11. Hilda Ramona M. - Raising and selling pigs  
12. Ramona Ignacia V. - Domestic employee 
13. Eloisa Natalia G. - Clothing sales 
14. María Agueda V. - Food sales 
15. Lilian Rossana L. - Domestic employee 
16. Marta A. - Plant sales

loans.use: The 16 participants all have their own commercial activities, and each member invests her credit in the sustainment of her business through the purchase of merchandise to sell or of raw materials.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy tiene 34 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la ganadería, todos los días de manera constante limpia, alimenta y desparasita a sus animales, lo cuales vende en la feria ganadera, junto con la leche que producen sus vacas. Paralelamente siembra en sus tierras papa, maíz y otros productos nativos de su localidad, pero en lo que más intensifica su trabajo es en el cultivo de la alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales. Para un futuro cercano, Percy desea tener un establo más grande y mejorar su infraestructura para poder criar a más animales. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él se siente muy integrado y comprometido con su trabajo en su banco comunal porque todos son organizados y juntos han superado muchos obstáculos. El monto que está ahora solicitando será destinado a la compra de abono para sembrar más extensiones de alfalfa y asegurar la alimentación de su ganado.
texts.en:
Percy is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his 3 children. He has been in the livestock business for the past 10 years. Every day he cleans, feeds, and treats his animals for parasites. He sells his animals in the livestock market, along with the milk produced by his cows. He also grows potatoes, corn, and other crops on his land that are native to his area. However, what intensifies his work the most is the cultivation of alfalfa to feed his animals. In the near future, Percy wants to have a bigger stable and improve the infrastructure so that he can raise more animals. This is his second loan with MFP. He feels very integrated and committed to the work at his community bank because everyone is organized and together they have overcome many obstacles. The loan that he is asking for will be used for the purchase of fertilizer to plant more alfalfa and to assure the feeding of his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 33 años, es natural de la ciudad de Chiclayo (norte peruano), vive en su propia casa con su hijo Jahir de 10 años de edad. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de un postre típico de su departamento, llamado “King Kong”, el cual se prepara a base de harina, leche, capas de manjar blanco, dulce de membrillo o piña y maní, las presentaciones son de medio kilo o un kilo. Este producto lo prepara en su casa y lo vende según pedidos de sus clientes, hasta el momento le ha resultado muy rentable, ya que son muy ricos y solicitados. A Cecilia le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que la cocina siempre ha sido una de sus aficiones, aunque preparar grandes cantidades resulta cansado, pero ella ha sabido sobrellevar estos pequeños inconvenientes, pues trabaja por un fin en particular, el progreso de su pequeño hijo Jahir. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y Cecilia siempre ha sido muy puntual con su banco comunal llamado “Estrella Azul”, así que se siente muy bien trabajando con su grupo, el cual es muy unido y trabajador. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus dulces y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 33 years old and is a native of the city of Chiclayo (in Northern Peru), and lives in her own house with her 10 year old son Jahir. She is dedicated to making and selling a typical dessert from her area, called "King Kong," which is prepared with a base of flower, milk, white caramel, pineapple or quince sweet, and mani, the presentations of which are a half kilo or a kilo. She prepares this product in her house and she sells it to order to her clients. Until now, it has been very profitable, since they are very good and sought after. Cecilia likes her job a lo, since cooking has always been one of her hobbies, even though cooking large quantities results in her being tired, but she has learned to overcome the small inconveniences, so she works for a specific end, the progress of her young son Jahir. This is her fourth loan with MFP and Cecilia has always been on time with her community bank called Blue Star, since she feels very good working with her group which is very united and hardworking. With the requested money she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients for the preparation of her sweets and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyin ingredients to make her desserts

loans.name: Mrs. So Kear Khon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Tnaot village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. So Kear K. is the 39-year-old village bank president.

Mrs. So Kear K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a weaver who makes cloth from Khmer silk. Her husband, Mr. Sor Mab, is a security guard. This couple has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. So Kear K. wants to expand it by purchasing more silk to weave more cloth. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave more cloth

loans.name: Camila Apolonia

texts.es: Doña Camila es Originaria de la comunidad de Coxom Totonicapan situado a 8 Kilometros de  de la ciudad ella es casada con tres hijos su actividad principal es el bordado manual dicha actividad lo viene ejeciendo desde mas de veinte años con ello a podido darle estudio a sus hijos hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR para un credito como lo manifiesta que solicito un credito en el sitema Bancario por ser una persona humilde y muy sencilla no le consediero el credito ella confia que ASDIR  se le concede el credito que le permitira con ello una inversion en la compra de Materiales para bordados.
texts.en:
Doña Camila is originally from the community of Coxom Totonicapan, which is located 8 kilometers away from the city. She is married and has 3 children. She has been making embroidered items by hand for the past 20 years. Through her business, she has been able to provide her children with everything they need to study.

Today she needs the support of Asociación ASDIR. Being a humble and sincere person, Doña Camila tried to apply for a loan from a traditional bank but was denied. She has confidence that ASDIR will approve her request so that she can purchase more materials for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr:
T. Suzanne est âgée de 43 ans. Suzanne est mariée et  est mère de trois enfants.
Suzanne n’est  jamais allée à l’école ni appris un métier. Dès son enfance, Suzanne fut placée chez une parente qui l'a initiée au commerce. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Suzanne s’est installée à son propre compte et vend divers articles: chaussures, sacs, verres à boire, etc. Suzanne a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part d’ALIDé et a bien remboursé ces crédits. Suzanne sollicite un cinquième crédit d’ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de ses chaussures afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Suzanne T. is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Suzanne has never been to school nor learnt a craft. As a child, Suzanne went to live with a female relative who introduced her to commerce. For about a decade, Suzanne has had her own business selling a variety of items: shoes, handbags, drinking glasses, etc. She has already had four loans from Alidé, which she repaid successfully. Suzanne is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé to increase her stock of shoes in order to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci J. reside en Tecoluca el departamento de San Vicente. Ana tiene 32 años de edad se encuentra casada con Oscar quien trabaja como jornalero, juntos han cuidado de sus tres hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, y  ahora el nuevo integrante de la familia de tan solo15 meses . Ana tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio, el cual lleva siete años al servicio de sus clientes, Ana elabora tortillas desde su casa con un sabor singular por el cual sus clientes la prefieren, ya que se cocinan a leña y comal, una práctica ya poco utilizada para muchos negocios de los mismos. El crédito que Ana solicita es para comprar maíz y leña.

loans.use: Compra leña y maiz

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the village of Miputak. She is 53 years old. Mercedita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish products in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mercedita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Mercedita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es: Francisca Elena Q. M. residente del pueblo de Santiago Nonualco del departamento de La Paz. A sus 57 años de edad Francisca sigue siendo una persona alegre y con gran empeño en su negocio una venta de antojitos y productos como golosinas y bebidas, el cual ha manejado ya por una larga trayectoria de veinte años, Francisca manifiesta que su negocio ha ido mejorando con los años gracias a créditos otorgados que le han permitido consolidar su negocio y crecer económicamente, ella solicita ahora de un nuevo préstamo para poder así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Francisca Elena Q. M. lives in the town of Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. At 57 years old Francisca is still a happy person and a hard worker. She has run her business selling fast food, snacks, and drinks for 20 years. Francisca says that her business has been improving over the years thanks to the loans she has received. These loans have allowed her to consolidate and grow her business. She is now applying for a loan in order to continue investing in her business by purchasing supplies and increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo (Darío), de 46 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Karen de 12, Moisés de 11, Ruth de 9 y Benjamin de 4 años de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia, ayudándose mutuamente.

Desde hace un año y medio ella se dedica a la fábrica de metales que con mucho esfuerzo logró poner junto con su esposo. Ellos funden bronce y crean peculiares llaveros de diferentes formas, los cuales son vendidos en diferentes mercados del distrito en el que viven. 
Darío, su esposo, es el encargado de crear los llaveros, dejando volar su imaginación modelando diversos objetos que van desde manos en miniatura, escudos de equipos de futbol, personajes de dibujos animados, animales, etc. Emilia lo apoya puliendo y dando el acabado final, poniéndole las argollas que sirven para sujetarlos y adjuntarlos a las llaves. De esta manera lograr buenos ingresos, ya que juntos son un gran equipo para el bienestar de su familia.  

Este es el segundo crédito de Emilia con MFP, siendo muy puntual con todos sus pagos y le gusta mucho ser parte de un grupo solidario, ya que todas sus compañeras son buenas amigas y muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará material para seguir elaborando sus bonitos llaveros y así incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia, 43, lives with her husband (Darío, 46) and with their four children: Karen, 12, Moisés, 11, Ruth, 9 and Benjamin, 4. They all helpeach other out and live in their own house. After much effort, she and her husband managed to start a metal foundery and have been working there for the past year and a half. They melt down bronze and make singular, multi-shaped keyrings which they sell in various markets in their home district. Darío, her husband, creates the keyrings letting his imagination run wild shaping objects that range from miniature hands, to football team emblems, to cartoon characters, animals, etc. Emilia helps him by polishing and giving the final touches like attaching the rings that serve to secure the keys. This earns them good income because they make a good team working together for the wellbeing of the family. This is Emilia's second loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with repayments and she enjoys being part of a cooperative group very much because all the members are good, responsible friends. With the funds she is requesting now she will buy supplies to continue making pretty keyrings and thus increase her profits and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora María R. se dedica arduamente a su trabajo para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ella es madre soltera y con cuatro hijos a su cargo de los cuales tres de ellos estudian.
Es de importancia destacar que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superarse en la vida. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de matriculas del colegio de sus hijos por lo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de sus pequeños que tanto los ama.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mrs. María R. works very hard at her job to improve the conditions of her home since she is now a single mother of four children, three of whom study. It is important to point out that she is a very hard working woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is asking for a loan to pay for the school registration fees of her children, and hopes her loan is approved so she can supply for the needs of her little ones she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her children's school enrollment fees

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo D. is from Molicay, Ozamiz City. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Romulo owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motor cab services to local community members. Romulo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Romulo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Romulo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: El Alto Cenepa Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EL ALTO CENEPA

Flora pertenece a la Alcancia Conumal EL ALTO CENEPA, ella es madre D. 3 pequeños hijos que aún dependen D. ella, sus inicios en su vida laboral fueron en una empresa D. costura, hasta que gracias a sus ahorros y al apoyo D. esposo y sus familiares pudo comprar una máquina D. costura entonces en su pequeña casa hizo un espacio donD. colocó un taller D. costura, ahora ya tiene 3 años con su negocio, tiempo en que gracias a el ha podido dar educación y alimentos a sus hijos, ella no piensa descansar hasta ver a sus hijos hechos unos profesionales, tambien espera y sueña tener su propia empresa D. costura.
texts.en:
El Alto Cenepa Communal Bank Flora belongs to the El Alto Cenepa communal bank. She is the mother of three small children who are still dependent on her. Her first experience in the labor force was with a clothing business. Then, thanks to her savings and the support of her husband and family, she was able to buy a sewing machine. In her small house, she maD. a space for a sewing workshop. Now, Flora has been in business for three years and has been able to proviD. food and education for her children. She will not rest until she sees her children become professionals. Also, she dreams of having her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 43 años, vive con su madre Juliana, de 72 años, a quien cuida. Los dos viven en su casa propia, localizada en una zona fría de la sierra del Perú.
Su padre murió cuando él era aun muy joven (23 años), un así tuvo que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su casa, y a pesar de no gustarle la agricultura empezó a sembrar papa, arveja y maíz en los terrenos de su padre.
Lo que entristece a Andrés es no tener una familia propia para que lo acompañe y apoye en las actividades agrícolas, o que lo esperen con la comida caliente después de un día difícil. 
Pese a las dificultades que atraviesa, considera que su trabajo es rentable porque gracias a las ganancias puede solventar los gastos de su casa, además logró comprar más terrenos con los que ahora produce grandes cosechas. 
Aún con la esperanza de formar una familia y tener varios hijos, para el futuro, desea seguir ahorrando para construir una casa en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar un negocio de venta de tubérculos, además quiere incrementar su producción agrícola.    

Este el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y ya conoce la metodología de un banco comunal, por lo que está más que fascinado de continuar trabajando en su grupo, donde las personas son exigentes y muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita complementará al monto que tiene ahorrado para comprar una camioneta, con la que podrá trasladar sus cosechas desde su pueblo hacia la ciudad para comercializarlos. Aproximadamente, el vehículo de segundo uso está valorizado en 6 mil soles.
texts.en:
Andrés is 43 years old and lives with his mother, Juliana, 72, whom he cares for. The two live in a home they own located in a frigid zone in the Peruvian mountains. His father died when Andrés was a young man (23 years old), so he was forced to take control of the household finances. Even though he didn't care for agriculture, he started planting potatoes, peas, and corn on his father's land. What saddens Andrés is not having his own family to accompany him and support his farming activities, or expecting a hot meal after a difficult day. Despite the difficulties he has faced, he considers his work lucrative because thanks to his profits he has been able to take care of household expenses as well as purchase more land that is now producing great harvests. Along with the hope of forming a family and having a number of children, in the future he wishes to keep saving money so he can build a home in the city where he can set up a business selling tubers, and he also wants to increase his agricultural production. This is his sixth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and he already is familiar with the workings of a community bank and wants to continue working with his group of demanding and responsible people. He plans to use the money he is requesting to complement his saving to purchase a truck so he can haul his harvest from his village to the city to sell it. A second-hand vehicle cost approximately 6,000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a truck

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijas que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. La Socia presenta Estudios Superiores Técnica en  Forestal.

Jessica, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva 05 años en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles  iniciándose  con 02  paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bebidas gasificadas  como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Jessica, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así, su sueño es tener una Distribuidora de bebidas gasificadas y vender al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Jessica belongs to the “Las Aguerridas” ("The Brave Women") communal bank, in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, in the Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old and has a live-in partner. She is the mother of 2 daughters, who are in school and still dependent on her. Jessica has studied forestry at a technical institute of higher education. Jessica is a woman who has succeeded in overcoming many difficulties during her life. Her desire to get ahead has served her well, and today she operates a business selling soft drinks. She has had this business for 5 years, and today it is quite successful; she feels very satisfied with what she has achieved. The business is located in a well-equipped space within her own home, where she serves her customers with the friendliness and charm which have always characterized her. Jessica runs the business herself, without a boss or a fixed schedule. She tells us that she began with working capital of 200 Peruvian new soles, starting with 22 cartons of soft drinks. Seeing that the business was going well, she gradually invested more and more in it. With this loan for 1000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy additional cartons of soft drinks in various flavors, brands and sizes, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Jessica is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsible with her payments and plans to continue in the same manner. Her dream is to become a soft drink distributor and sell her products on both a wholesale and retail basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks to stock her business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay S., age 46, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business of selling hand-made brooms, earning approximately US $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2000. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of US $2 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more brooms to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more hand-made brooms to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 32 años, está casado con Elizabeth de 28 años, con quien tiene 3 pequeños hijos. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada en una comunidad de la sierra central.

A diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana porque tiene que caminar alrededor de una hora y media para poder trabajar en sus cultivos. Esto no le molesta, al contrario considera que es normal debido a la ubicación de sus terrenos y porque cada esfuerzo que realiza lo hace pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Hace 5 años que se dedica a esto y lo que más le gusta es cosechar porque luego comercializa sus productos para cubrir los gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos. Pero como no es una persona conformista y quiere compartir más actividades con los miembros de su familia, desea encontrar un trabajo estable y seguro, pero también rentable como la agricultura.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y confiesa que ya viene ahorrando para no fallar a los integrantes de su banco comunal con los pagos, pues todos se esfuerzan para sacar adelante su grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará cinco sacos de fertilizantes para cuidar adecuadamente sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 32-year-old man who is married to Elizabeth, age 28, with whom he has 3 young children. They live in a rented house in the town of La Sierra Central.

He wakes up at 5 in the morning daily because he has to walk for about an-hour-and-a-half to be able to get to his crops. However, this does not bother him. To the contrary, he considers this to be normal due to the location of his fields, and because he keeps his family's well-being in mind every time he puts in a lot of effort. He has been in agriculture for 5 years, and what he likes most is harvesting because he then sells his produce and pays for both the household expenses and his children's education. However, since he is a non-conformist, he would like to share more activities with his family, so he wants to find a steady job that is as lucrative as agriculture is.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he admits that he has been saving up money so that he will not default on his loans and let his communal bank members down because they all work hard to help the group get ahead. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is now requesting, he will purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer in order to adequately care for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maritza del Socorro J. Ramírez, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, tiene la edad de 55 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad y casados. Ella trabaja como cocinera en casas particulares.

Solicita un  préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la edificación de un cuarto en su vivienda, esto le permitirá mejores comodidades de habita de la familia, ella es una mujer sola y que ha conseguido brindarles la educación a sus hijos gracias a su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Maritza del Socorro J. Ramírez lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 55 years old. She is a single mother of three, who are all grown and married. She works as a cook in private homes. Maritza is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to build another room in her home. A new room will allow for greater comfort in her family's living situation. She is a single woman and was able to give her a children an education due to her own effort.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room in her house

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun H. is 48 years old and she is a villager who lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn her family living. Her husband is a chef who can earn a small income to support the family living.  
                   
Mrs. Oun H. is requesting for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and the rest of the loan she wants use to pay out for farming labor and to buy rice seed, pesticide to support her dry farming season. Mrs. Oun H. is a mother of six children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory three are students in the local school and also support their mother farming. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow, rice seed, pesticide, farming labor

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has grown children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. Irina sells women’s clothing merchandise in one of the local markets. Irina rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. She admits that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Irina has been in this business for 8 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 19,800 Grivnyas. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Irina has a long-term view of her venture development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this promotes successful growth of her business. Moreover, Irina is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work which reveals her great entrepreneurial potential and secures prompt loan repayment. Irina is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase the selection of clothing items that she offers for sale in her store.

loans.use: To broaden assorted clothing merchandise.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Marie S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children who range from 1 to 7 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because of poverty.

For 8 years, Marie has been selling charcoal at retail at the Thinkers Village community in Paynesville, Liberia. She has a nice manner of approach to her customers which keeps them returning.

Marie started by selling oil and did not have any problems when doing business. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to build a house and send her children to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marie is holding the sign. And Teze D. is inset at the lower left because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 people who live I. Roliek village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Mao H. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Mao H. was born I. 1976. She is a farmer who owns half a hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phey Yem, is a cattle middleman. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Mao H. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for resale. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of three children, one of whO. is a seamstress I. a garment factoR., while the others attend the local public school. Mrs. Sey Na Heng is a group guarantor S. is alS. present I. the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for resale

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty D. is a married woman who lives in Roadside, Barangay Bagonawa, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: pig fattening and a Jeepney transport businesses. Her husband, Antonio, who is 53 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children, 23 and 25 years old. 

Liberty joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liberty has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 - uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to pay for the franchise of a vehicle that will be used for business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Liberty D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan M. is 57 years old and she is the village bank president having been selected by its eight members which located in Toul Sala village, Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this group will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose.   
Mrs. Kan M. is a farmer who works very hard to support her four children. Her husband, Mr.Tach Phoung, is a fisherman and also supports his wife on the farm. With this both businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family living. For her husband fishing, Mrs. Kan M. will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy fishing supplies to support her husband fishing. This couple has four children, two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Mwendia

texts.en:
Mwendia is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been operating his mixed farm for the last 25 years. His farm produces tea, coffee, maize and beans which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the needs of his family.

Mwendia has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this investment will help him pay school fees for his son in college. The family will also be able to have enough milk for consumption.

His biggest challenges have been diseases which attack his poultry and animals like dogs which attack and feed on his poultry. In future, he would like to acquire more dairy cows and increase the stock of poultry.

Mwendia is 60 years old. He is married with 5 children who are all adults.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ruvuma Group

texts.en:
Paulo M. is single and in his late twenties.  He has been selling pork for about two years.  He works from 11am to 10pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulo’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase  the pork stock and has paid back his loan successfully. He will use this loan to buy a deep freezer.  Paulo’s dream is to open more pork shops in different areas.

Paulo will share this loan with his loan group, Ruvuma, which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Paulo is 1st on the left standing.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah K. is a 32-year-old single businessman in Mombasa who has a grocery store in Mombasa's Kongowea market. His business is five years old and is doing well. This loan is Abdalla's first from KADET LTD, and with the money he plans to increase his stock of vegetables and tomatoes. He intends to save the profits from the sales and open another grocery in another location in Mombasa. Abdallah hopes to live a happy and successful life.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 72 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajara, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su  actividad a la que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. artefactos electrodomésticos usados. Su trabajo inicia comprando estos artefactos deteriorados y usados, luego su esposo verifica que repuestos deberá cambiar y después hace el mantenimiento técnico para luego ser vendidos nuevamente. D. esta manera viene trabajando durante 15 años y lo que más le apasiona D. ello, es la comunicación y el contacto con sus clientes, sin embargo le incomoda es que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, porque constantemente le desalojan los policías municipales, del lugar donD. se sitúa. Se siente contenta D. vender artefactos reparados a precios asequibles, por lo que le compran D. todas las condiciones sociales. En adelante anhela alquilar un puesto dentro del mercado o cambiar D. rubro por el que se dedicaría a la venta D. ropa. Este es el 33avo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su grupo comunal, es donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará repuestos D. licuadoras, asimismo juguetes y ropa para iniciar otro rubro y aprovechar la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Rosa, 72 years old, is the mother of a very hard-working family. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She works selling used appliances. She starts by purchasing used and damaged appliances, then her husband determines which parts should be replaced, and then does the repairs so they can be resold. 
She has been working in this business for 15 years, and what she enjoys most is the communication and contact with her customers. However, what troubles her is not having a fixed location, because she is constantly being moved by the local police from wherever she is situated. She is happy to sell these used appliances at reasonable prices, so people in all economic situations can buy them. 
In the future she hopes to rent a location within the market, or change careers and sell clothes. This is her 33rd loan from MFP, she understands that she must make her payments on time, and is committed to doing so, as she doesn't want to harm her communal bank, where she is well liked by the other members. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase parts for blenders, as well as toys and clothes to start another business, and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Comrpar repuestos para arreglar los artefactos que venderá.

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
