María de 34 años, Vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). Vende comida a la gente del centro donde vive.

Ha ella siempre le gusto cocinar debido a que es madre soltera tubo que optar por tener su propio medio económico, inicio haciendo almuerzos y vendiéndolo a sus conocidos, poco a poco fue creciendo su clientela. En la actualidad ella tiene un pequeño comedor donde vende almuerzos muy económicos a $ 1.50, hace todo tipo de platos desde las 08h00am comprar los víveres hasta que llega y comienza a prepararlos para el almuerzo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques para mejorar su negocio ya que la comida la hace en la cocina de su casa. En el futuro quiere adecuar su casa y tener un gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old.  She lives in the “Orquídeas de Guayaquil” (Orchids of Guayaquil).  It is an urban area that got its name because of the many orchid flowers that were there when the area was discovered.  She sells food to people in the center where she lives.

She has always liked to cook.  As a single mother she had to have her own way of earning a living.  She started making lunches and selling them to the people she knows.  Little by little her customer base was growing.  Now she has a small dining room where she sells very economical lunches for $1.50.  She makes all types of dishes starting at 8:00 a.m., when she buys the supplies, and then returns to start preparing the lunches.

She wants to use the loan to buy construction material like cement, paint, and blocks to improve her business.  She makes the food in the kitchen in her house.  In the future she wants to adapt her house and have a beauty parlor.

loans.use: Cement, paint, and blocks

loans.name: Rebeca Del Socorro

texts.es:
REBECA DEL SOCORRO A. G., Trabaja como Operador de Cómputos en el Mercado Iván Montenegro.es madre de familia de un niño y este se encuentra en el colegio.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion como ; arena, cemento y piedra para construir un baño en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Rebeca del Socorro A. G. works as a computer operator at the Iván Montenegro Market. She is the mother of a child who is attending high school.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone in order to build a bathroom for her home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has lived in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen for over 25 years. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. She is married to M. H. who is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. Through the rickshaw, he provides transport services to passengers. He has been in this business for over 10 years. 

Shamim has given birth to 4 sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide her elder children with education due to poor financial conditions. So they started doing different kinds of work in their teenage years. Her eldest son is a hairdresser by trade. The 2nd one works in a factory for a low salary and the third one is a tailor by trade.  

Now, due to her children’s work, Shamim’s financial conditions have become much better and she is able to enroll her younger children in school.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will replace his old tyres with new tyres because the old cart can't cover long distances before it gets a puncture and that is affecting his work and income. Shamim is hopeful that after investing money in his business, her husband will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In past years, she has maintained a good credit history by paying installments on time and attending every meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To replace the tyres of a rickshaw

loans.name: Kiribedda Savings And Credit Farmers Group B-Mityana

texts.en: 39-year-old Emanuel L. says that he has been selling shoes in Mityana Metropolis for the past decade. Because he operates in a largely cosmopolitan area, he has customers from many different sectors of society. This married father of seven says that, to take root in this business, he used savings from his farm, which was then his preeminent busines. Emanuel is a hard-working and progressive-thinking man. Each week, his business generates shillings 120,000. With this loan, he is going to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 47 years old. Arsenio is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Arsenio owns & operates a business venture running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arsenio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arsenio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza M. is a married woman who lives in Kanipaan, Brgy.Punao, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: raising and selling goldfish and dealing in ready-to-wear/Avon. Her husband, Norberto, 37 years old, earns his living as a painter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children between the ages of 4 and 15.

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Flordeliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more varieties of goldfish to raise and sell in order to continue to save up for her children's future education. Flordeliza M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of her goldfish ponds

loans.name: Camilo Benigno

texts.es:
Camilo tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside con su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos en uno de los caseríos agrícolas , que pertenece a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. El cría ganado ovino y aves de corral en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda alimentándoles de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permite ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Camilo desea comprar alimento balanceado para engordar a sus animales, y una vez que estén desarrollados venderlos y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Camilo is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two small children in a farmhouse in the Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambeyeque department.

He does jobs related to the raising and selling of animals. He raises sheep and poultry in a few farmyards near his home. He fattens them with natural fodder. Once they have developed enough, he sells them to the public and to traders who visit the area where he lives. This work allows him to help with his family’s household expenses.

Camilo wants to buy balanced diet of food to fatten his animals. Once they are fattened, he wants to sell them and obtain greater earnings which will allow him to continue progressing and helping his family to move forward. To achieve this goal, he thought it was advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 800 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet of food to fatten his animals

loans.name: Dermis Kellys

texts.es:
Dermis V. es una mujer de 58 años, que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 29 años. Desde la edad de 15 años llegó a esta ciudad con mucha expectativa y buscando una mejor calidad de vida, así fue como estudió parte del bachillerato y luego trabajó en una empresa privada como operaria de confecciones, donde  estuvo por mas de 10 años y finalmente decidió independizarse  con ese conocimiento, emprendiendo su negocio   a la edad de 26 años cuando se casó y tuvo 4 hijos.  A medida que pasó el tiempo el negocio de confección creció y hoy es un taller dotado de maquinarias que funciona con dos operarias que  apoyan la producción. Este es el financiamiento Numero 15 que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización a la que   pertenece  desde hace  16 años, y con la que ha logrado de su mano mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio,  ampliarlo en clientes y adecuar las condiciones locativas del taller. Con este su credikiva   comprará materias primas como telas,  hilos, botones e insumos para elaborar uniformes para colegios. Su inversión sería exitosa porque tiene contratos con  tres colegios del sector para confeccionar sus uniformes de educación física y de a diario.
Su sueño aun consiste en continuar mejorando las  adecuaciones y tener una mayor producción generando más empleos a más operarias.  Este es su desafío y también el de  lograr la eficiencia y la calidad,  que amerita cada vez mas,  el mercado circundante al cual ella quiere llegar.  En la actualidad sus indicadores financieros son los siguientes:   rotación de  cuentas por cobrar   14 días, mientras los inventarios rotan cada 7, su rentabilidad sobre sus ventas de 30%,  su capacidad de pago actual de 68% y  su capacidad de pago futura con el crédito es de un 64%.
texts.en:
Dermis V. is a 58 year old woman who lives in Barranquilla. She is married with four children between the ages of 29 and 13. She arrived in the city at 15 years of age with high hopes of gaining a better quality of life. She studied part of her high school certificate before working for a private company where she made clothes for ten years. With the knowledge she gained throughout her time there, she finally decided to leave the company to start her own business at the age of 26, when she married and had four children. As time passed, her clothing business grew to be a workshop with two employees who operate the machinery.  

This is the fifteenth loan that Dermis has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has been part of this organisation for 16 years. With the help of this foundation she has been able to improve the infrastructure of her business, expand her client base and improve the conditions of the premises where her workshop is located. With this loan from Kiva, Dermis will purchase materials such as fabrics, thread, buttons and supplies to make school uniforms. This investment will be successful because she has contracts to make school uniforms and physical education uniforms for three schools in the area. 

Dermis' dream is to continue improving her premises and to increase her production with more employees and more machinery operators. This is a challenge for her, as is the goal of attaining the ever-increasing efficiency and quality which the market she wishes to tap into demands. Dermis' current financial indicators are as follows: turnover on accounts receivable is 14 days, while inventory turnover is 7 days. Sales profit is at 30%, her current ability to make payments is 68% and her future ability to make payments with the loan is at 64%.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as fabric, thread, buttons and supplies to make school uniforms

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a retail shop for the past nine months; her potential customers are local residents. Lillian faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation of commodities. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale one in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil and detergent. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of loan products that meet her needs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil and detergent

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHASQUIS” (Chasqui es el nombre que se le daba al encargado de llevar las noticias de un extremo a otro del imperio de los Incas, se entiende como “corredor veloz”) es un grupo que iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Est asociación comunal está compuesta por ocho personas, 1 varón y 7 mujeres.

La A.C. “CHASQUIS” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Basilia, la tesorera la señora  Sonia y como secretaria de actas la señora María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio, con los servicios y la producción.  Entre esos negocios tenemos: venta de juguetes, elaboración de mantas, costura de bolsas, chofer de transporte público, venta de pollos a la broster, tienda de barrio.

En el caso de la señora  Basilia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio, desde hace diez años,  ella comenta que siempre tuvo la idea de contar con una tienda y así lo hizo, sin ayuda de nadie.  La señora Basilia atiende su tienda de lunes a lunes de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, las compras para surtir el negocio son realizadas en zonas comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para comprar mercadería para la tienda, conservas, víveres y otros.

La señora Basilia  es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ha trabajado con Pro Mujer desde hace tres ciclos, ingresó al grupo gracias a la invitación de los promotores.   

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación y el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Chasquis” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. (“Chasqui” is the name given to a messenger who carried news from one end of the Incan empire to the other, and is understood to mean “fast runner”.) This Communal Association consists of eight members, one man and seven women.

The Chasquis Communal Association has its Board of Directors organized in the following manner: Sra. Basilia – President, Sra. Sonia – Treasurer, and Sra. María – Secretary of Records. The members engage in various businesses in the retail, service, and manufacturing sectors so that they can get ahead. These include selling toys, weaving blankets, sewing handbags, driving public transportation vehicles, selling roasted chickens, and managing neighborhood stores.

Such is the case of Sra. Basilia, the President of the Communal Association. She says that she has been managing a neighborhood store for ten years. Basilia states that she always had the idea to open a store, so she proceeded to do so without any assistance. She manages her store Monday to Monday from 6am to 9pm. The inventory to restock her business is purchased in the commercial districts of the city of El Alto. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her store such as canned goods, groceries, and other items.

Sra. Basilia is a 42 years old woman who lives with her husband and son. She joined Pro Mujer as a result of an invitation from the program promoters and has participated in three loan cycles. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Basilia says she enjoys the training sessions and the loans.

loans.use: Purchase canned goods, groceries, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface A. is 28 years old and married. He and his wife have one child aged two years old, whom they wish to give a quality education, up to the university level. His business is located at Khayega in Kakamega, and it is known by the name Jakaka Bakeries. Kakamega is in the western part of Kenya. The major activity in the area is sugarcane farming, and it is well known as the sugar belt region. Bonface owns a small bakery in which he sells doughnuts, halfcakes and other baked products to the local people. He has been in this business for the last four years and has four employees. He says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more flour and oil to expand his business and meet the demands of his customers. He plans to expand his business to a big bakery. He describes himself as focused and determined.

loans.use: to buy more flour and oil.

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en:
Itaf is a mother of two daughters and two sons. The daughters are Hana and Haya, and the boys  Hani and Haitham are school students. Itaf and her husband Mahmoud started a shoe store and they took out a loan from FATEN to cover the rest of the expenses such as store decoration, shelves and display windows.

Itaf who is a client of FATEN taking a loan for the second time which will help here start the business earlier than expected refused to be photographed as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to prepare a store to start selling shoes.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La sra. Angelina R. nació en la ciudad D. Belen en el año 1943, luego se mudó a la ciudad D. Luque, donD. posee su vivienda actual y su residencia familiar.
Tiene dos hijos mayores D. edad, es jubilada y tiene un copetin en su domicilio, ella se dedica a esto desD. hace muchos años, pues es el mayor ingreso económico que poseen, gracias a esto pudo mantenerse ella misma y a su familia.
Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desD. el año 2003 logrando aumentar su ingreso gracias a los créditos obtenidos anteriormente.
Por ello deseas obtener otro préstamo, ya que la señora Angelina desea invertir su dinero a la compra D. mercaderias y artículos comestibles para su negocio (productos a granel, bebidas, golosinas, etc.)
texts.en:
Angelina R. was born in the city of Belen in 1943.  She then moved to the city of Luque where she currently lives in her family residence.  She has two adult children, is retired and has a small snack bar in her home.  She’s been in this business for many years because it’s the major source of income they have.  Thanks to it she was able to support herself and her family.

She’s been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2003 managing to increase her income thanks to the previously granted loans.  Because of this she’d like to get another loan because Angelina wants to invest her money buying merchandise and foodstuff for her business (bulk items, beverages, snacks, etc.)

loans.use: to buy bulk foodstuffs, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old.  She is 30 years old. Her husband sells foodstuffs.  Jane owns a restaurant which she has been running for the past 14 years. With the profits from her restaurant, she pays her children’s school fees and built a small family house. 

Jane is requesting a loan to buy restaurant equipment and supplies such as plates, chairs, a charcoal stove and utensils.   From the profits she plans to make, she plans to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 36 years old, married and a father of three.  He sells curios in an open-air market.  He has engaged in the business for 15 years.  In addition, he does farming to earn extra income.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business.  He hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy African design fabric, beads and carved lions, giraffes and zebra.

loans.use: To buy African design fabric, beads and carved lions, giraffes and zebra

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is 53 years old and married with four sons. Her eldest son works in a factory while the others stay at home. Ghulam Fatima couldn’t provide them an education due to financial constraints. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron rods. He sells to different factories and dealers on order. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years. Ghulam Fatima does sewing and embroidery work for her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. Besides her work, she actively manages her household activities as well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron and make iron rods to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits. Ghulam Fatima hopes that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and her family will be able to enjoy more financial benefits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. With previous loans, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ghulam Fatima.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Karamat's Group

texts.en:
Karamat is 55 years old and leads this loan group. She lives in the sunny town of Nookat, where she has three grown children. Everyone in the family works, and most earn money by farming. Six years ago the family business was worth 2 400 soms and based on a very small piece of land. But the family has done a great job of using the money it earns to buy more land, an automobile and furniture for its home. Karamat's husband, who makes a living as a cab driver, believes that they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer -- and when Karamat heard about loans from Mol Bulak Finance, she put this group together so that they could all join together to get the funding they needed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Reyna Cristina

texts.en: Reyna lives with her husband and two children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the past five years she has made and sold freshly prepared food. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 with which to buy ingredients for her food business. In her spare time, Reyna raises chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase meats, rice, cheese, cornmeal, eggs, butter, cooking oil, salt, and condiments.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a married woman with three children. She is 54 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 25 years.

Pedrita sells items like eggs, chips and soft drinks to the people in her community. She also cooks viands that she sells at her town's public school. She rents a stall there where she displays her cooked food. Pedrita earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her businesses.

Pedrita is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like noodles and canned goods and to buy raw ingredients such as meat and vegetables for viands.

In the future, Pedrita hopes to prosper in her business and be able to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like noodles and canned goods and to buy raw ingredients for viands such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Doña Angela es una pequeña comerciante, posee una pulperia en donde ha venido invirtiendo, gracias  a los prestamo que Afodenic ha dado, hoy en dia apoya  a su hija que esta en la universidad.
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora a su vivienda, en donde hoy con este nuevo prestamo podra repellar las paredes de su casa y el fino si alcanza, logrando reforzar paredes como tener mejores condiciones de vivienda. Comprara: arena,cemento, esponja, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Angela is a small business woman who has a grocery store in which she has been making investments. It is thanks to the loans that Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has granted her that today she is able to support her daughter who is in university. 

Her objective has been the improvement of her house. Today, with this new loan, she will be able to plaster the walls of the house and to paint it if there is money left over. It will strengthen the walls and it will improve the living conditions. She will purchase: sand, cement, and sponges to carry out the project.

loans.use: to purchase materials to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: In the photo, Aba has displayed some used clothing on the ground and on her lap for resale. She is divorced and has 5 children. Aba uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She will use the loan to purchase additional used clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Suiun's Group

texts.en:
Suiun is the leader of this group. She is 63, married and has raised a son and three daughters, all of whom are employed.

Together with her husband, Suiun breeds cattle and farms. Their monthly profits are about 5,000 KGS which they use to meet their daily needs. These profits also made it possible for Suiun to purchase household appliances to improve their living conditions.

With a loan of 65,000 KGS received from Mol Bulak, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she plans to start repairing their house.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Ella tiene educación superior.
El primer préstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue por S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales.  Trabaja hace un año con esta institución.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco kilos de lana con matiz y también comprará artesanía en bordados para venderlos.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como profesor.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así generar más ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Amalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Amalia received her higher education.

The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling handicrafts. She has worked with the organization for one year.

With this new loan of 800 PEN, Amalia will buy five kilos of dyed wool. She will also buy embroidered handicrafts to sell. Her husband works as a teacher.

Amalia’s dream is to improve her business and generate more income. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the savings.

loans.use: to buy five kilos of dyed wool and embroidered handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lovita

texts.en:
Ma. Lovita has been in business for the past 20 years providing manicure and pedicure services to the people in her village. She offers the services in a beauty salon owned by her friend. The salon also offers other beauty and hair styling services for occasions such as weddings and debuts. 

Ma. Lovita is 47 years old and a single parent who sacrifices a lot to raise her three children. As of now, all of her children have stopped their studies due to the financial burden of educating them. Her children have found temporary employment to help earn enough money to afford for them to continue their studies. As a responsible mother, Ma. Lovita works all day and doubles her efforts to generate income. She usually earns 300 PHP a day, which is used for daily meals. Other income is saved for her children's education.  

She is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional nail polish, cottons, and hand towels used to provide manicure and pedicure services. She believes through the help of this loan, she will improve the services to her customers, which will increase her earnings.

In the future, Ma. Lovita would like to see all of her children have their own degrees.

loans.use: to buy additional nail polish, cottons, and hand towels

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Santa Lucia se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, todas interesadas en mejorar su vida personal y familiar. Desean darle a sus familias un mejor estilo de vida, ya que no quieren que sus hijos pasen por las mismas necesidades que ellas. Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para que puedan luchar hombro con hombro para lograr los objetivos propuestos  y trabajar conjuntamente con actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora  Mercedes, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, con lo cual puede mantener su casa y paliar los gastos diarios. Además de eso comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes, como así también pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Santa Lucia" was formed by the union of a number of neighbors and friends from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of them were interested in improving their personal and their family lives.  They hope to give their families a better quality of life, since they don't want their children to go through the same need that they themselves experienced.  The members are modest women who formed a group to be able to work shoulder to shoulder to achieve their proposed objectives and to be able to work jointly on activities that will strengthen their friendships.
One of the members is Señora  Mercedes.  She makes her living selling cheese and milk, with which she is able to support her household and meet her daily expenses.  In addition, she states that she always has a lot of customers and orders.  
Señora  Mercedes is requesting the loan to purchase milk and cheese, with which she will be able to stock up to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and milk for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora gloria cuenta con la edad de 45 años, está casada con el señor Anselmo con quien tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 estudian que son los más pequeño, Jerry que cursa sexto año de primaria y Juan Carlos que está en cuarto, ya que los demás todos están casados, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, desde hace mas de 7 años.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, por la falta de trabajo que hay en su comunidad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que como es campesino había días en que no tenía trabajo y más cuando era temporada de lluvias, también para contar con una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de insumos como son: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, pollos, carne, leña, maíz, etc. Para continuar con la elaboración de su rica comida. 
Una de las metas que tiene doña gloria, es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner una fonda de comida mexicana, y así mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos, para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan estudiar una buena carrera profesional.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esta ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old and is married to Anselmo, with whom she has 7 children.  Of these, only the two youngest are still in school: Jerry is in 6th grade, and Juan Carlos is in 4th grade.  All of her other children are married.  Gloria has had a business selling Mexican snacks for more than 7 years.

She says that she started this business due to the lack of jobs in her community, so that she could help out her husband with the expenses.  Since her husband is a farmworker, there have been days when he didn't have work, and this is particularly the case during the rainy season.  In addition, her business allows them to have a better quality of life.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as: chile peppers, tomatoes, onions, chicken, meat, firewood, corn, etc.  She will use these supplies to continue making her delicious dishes.

One of Gloria's goals is to grow her business a lot, since she wants to eventually have a Mexican food restaurant.  This way she could increase her income, so that she can continue to support her children with their education and help them get a professional degree.

Gloria is very grateful to FRAC and to the Kiva lenders for this great support that they are offering her, since thanks to this help, her business and her family life have changed quite a lot.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: chile peppers, tomatoes, onions, chicken, meat firewood, corn, etc.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is 34 years old, married and has 3 daughters and a son. All of her children are enrolled in the local school and are getting their education. 
Her husband is a driver and provides passenger transportation services. He is a very good driver and drives the 32-seat bus with a great sense of responsibility. 
Saima herself is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She learnt the art of sewing from her mother and now she makes money from it. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan to repair his vehicle because its engine is creating problems. This will help him improve the condition of his vehicle and also provide better transport services for his passengers. 
He has been in the driving profession for the past 10 years and Saima is confident that an investment will be productive for him. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saima”.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 47 years old, married with three children, residing at Sebasi Clarin, Philippines. Jerry sells swine and also he owns a corn farm. Jerry earns 20,000 PHP every month with this kind of work. He requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more swine.

Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for three years. Jerry's future plan is to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more swine.

loans.name: Yancy Magali

texts.es: Yancy, por la buena atención de nuestra institución se ha decidido a tener otro crédito, porque quiere mejorar en su inventario y por eso comprara más: faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, el objetivo de ella es ofrecerles a sus clientes más variedad y comprar una plancha para vender pupusas por las tardes y de esa forma aumentar en sus ingresos. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a crecer en su negocio a tener mejores ingresos y a tener más clientela, este avance le ayudado a salir adelante con algunas necesidades de su familia y ahora viven en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Because of the good service she’s gotten from our institution, Yancy has decided to have another loan because she wants to improve her inventory so will buy more: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants.  Her goal is to offer more variety to her customers and to buy griddle to sell pupusas [stuffed griddle corn cakes] in the evening to increase her income.

Previous loans helped her very much to grow in business and earn higher income and to have more customers.  This loan has also helped her meet some family needs and so they now live in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Abini Group

texts.en:
Ben is the facilitator of the Abini group. Ben and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Ben takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and affordable loan repayments. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had a very good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Ben will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Abini group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 20 and 14. She runs a beauty salon and has been in business for 13 years. Right now her monthly income from the business is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is borrowing a loan of 20,000 KES which she intends to use to purchase a dryer for salon work. She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business and to open another business.

This her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to see her business grow to another level.

loans.use: to buy a dryer for her salon

loans.name: Yoner

texts.es: Yoner, de 42 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, amable y  sociable, es conviviente con Raquel quien es empleada de limpieza en una empresa. Vive en compañía de su suegro, su pareja y sus cuatro hijos de 15, 11, 7 y 2 , siendo la casa que habitan de propiedad de sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Yoner es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, para eso cuenta con un mototaxi, el cual compró con sus propios ahorros hace 22 años cuando se inició en ese oficio. En el transcurso del tiempo llegó ha renovar su vehiculo por el deterioro, contando en la actualidad con un vehiculo séminuevo, siendo su herramienta de trabajo y su principal fuente de ingreso económico, brindando ese servicio en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Le gusta su oficio pues ha logrado brindarles a sus  hijos una adecuada alimentación y educación siendo su más grande orgullo, como también solventar y apoyarse a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. Por otro lado tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajado y desea poder ampliar su flota de mototaxi y comprar 01 vehiculo adicional para darlo en alquiler a una personas responsable. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.  Además de sentirse muy cómodo con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en compra de repuestos y accesorios para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, así como el pago por servio de mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Yoner, 42 years old, is a hard-working, amiable, and sociable man who lives with Raquel, a cleaning employee for an enterprise. He lives with his father-in-law, plus his companion, and their 4 children, ages 15, 11, 7, and 2. The house they live in belongs to his father-in-law.

Yoner transports passengers in his mototaxi, which he purchased with his own savings some 22 years ago when he began this business. With the passage of time, he renovated his vehicle, due to deterioration, and at present can count on a semi-new vehicle, since it is his work tool and principal source of economic income. He offers his services in Pucallpa city.

Yoner likes his work and has been able to offer his children adequate food and education, his greatest pride, as well as cover the couples' household expenses. On the other hand, he has a great desire to continue working and he wants to augment his fleet of mototaxis, buying an additional vehicle to rent out to a responsible person. This will be his 2nd loan with MFP.

Consequently, he hopes for a small loan to help reach his objectives. In addition, Yoner feels very comfortable with his communal bank; he knows the members and considers them good people. With the requested 1,000 new sols, he will buy replacement parts and accessories to maintain his vehicle, as well as pay for maintenance services.

loans.use: buy replacement parts and accessories for his mototaxi and to contract the services of a mechanic.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia de 21 años, es una madre joven de 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Ella vive con Armando, su pareja y padre de sus hijos, en una casa propia en la localidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo (selva central). A Katia le gusta el trabajo del campo, que aprendió gracias a la convivencia con sus padres y suegros. De esta manera cuenta con una parcela de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra café hace 4 años. La venta de café es buena en los meses de abril, mayo, junio y julio ya que los precios llegan a costar 1 sol y 80 céntimos (precio mayor). Pero requiere de muchos cuidados y constante abonamiento de fertilizantes. En esta tarea la ayudan operarios a quienes contrata al día, o sino su pareja, siempre y cuando esté en la localidad. Por motivos de trabajo, Armando se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima como empleado de una fábrica de cuadernos, sin embargo siempre regresa a su ciudad natal para ver y atender a su familia. Le gustaría continuar trabajando con la venta de café, y si hay suerte más adelante irse a vivir a la ciudad capital del país, junto a su pareja e hijos, por la mejor educación y acceso a servicios. Animada por sus amigos, Katia ingresa al banco comunal “Aroma de café”, por eso, éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP. Afirma su puntualidad y exactitud en los pagos de las cuotas. Agradece por anticipado su apoyo.
De obtener el crédito, ella podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de café, así como para el pago de personal.
texts.en:
Katia, age 21, is the young mother of two children ages 2 and 4. She lives with Armando (her partner and the father of her children) in their own home in Santa Rosa de Palomar, in the San Luis de Shuaro district, Chanchamayo province (Selva Central). Katia enjoys working in the fields. She learned this work from her parents and in-laws. She has her own plots of land where she has sown coffee for four years. Coffee sales are good in April, May, June and July, because coffee hits its best price at this time: 1 sol and 80 cents. However, coffee crops require a lot of care and constant fertilizing. Katia hires workers by the day to help her with this work, or else her partner helps her whenever he is around. Armando is employed in the city of Lima in a notebook factory, but he always goes back to the city of his birth in order to see and care for his family. He would enjoy continuing to work selling coffee, and with luck in the future he would like to live in the capital city with his family so that they can have better access to services and education.
Katia joined the "Aroma de Cafe" communal bank at the encouragement of friends. This will be her first loan with MFP. She says she will be punctual and precise in the payments of her quotas. She thanks you in advance for your support.
Upon receiving this loan, she will buy bags of fertilizer for her coffee crops and pay for labourers.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 40, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Wenceslao, her business partner, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Bella operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. She buys larger quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells it by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams to be able to give all her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of fruits and vegetables needed in her business

loans.name: Elizabeth Concepción

texts.es: Elizabeth Concepción de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas en el mercado cercano a la localidad donde reside, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el lugar es muy concurrido además su materia prima es de excelente calidad y vende a precios accesibles; Elizabeth es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, se levanta desde muy temprano para atender el negocio, ella piensa que el éxito no es la clave de la felicidad, sino que la felicidad es la clave del éxito, si amas lo que haces serás exitoso; Elizabeth quiere tomar ese camino porque ama su trabajo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Elizabeth Concepción tiene fe que con su esfuerzo logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Concepción is 42 years old and lives with her partner and their children in their own home. She owns a stall selling tortas in the market close to the area where she lives. She has made many customers as the place is very busy. Also, her ingredients are top quality and she sells at reasonable prices. 

Elizabeth is a woman who is very devoted to her work. She gets up very early to care for her business. She thinks that success is not the key to happiness but rather that happiness is the key to success; if you love what you do, you will be successful. Elizabeth wants to take this road to success because she loves her job and this is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy corn wholesale. Elizabeth Concepción has faith in that through her efforts she will manage to bring economic stability to her house and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with two children, one of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle business, operating from home to the market whereby his neighbours are the potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate his business. Emmanuel dreams of establishing a retail shop for his wife to operate.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to pay school fees for his child who attends school. He decided to join Yehu to  access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Since 1986 Juelieta has had her small business and it has allowed her to cover all the family expenses. However, she has had to deal with the sickness of her son, who is paralyzed. She is the only person that assists him and also she is a divorced woman. The life has been difficult to Julieta, but she always has a smile to offer to the people, especially to her clients. She sells groceries and it allows her have time to care her special son and her business.

She needs a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise. Julieta wants to grow the business capacity and hopes from this way, her sales will increase. She just wants to continue supporting her son and offer him a quality of life like any other person. They need your generosity and affection.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Desde 1986 Juelieta tiene un pequeño negocio y le ha permitido cubrir los gastos de la familia, sin embargo también ha tenido que luchar por su hijo quien tiene discapacidad, ella es la única persona que atiende a su hijo ya que también esta divorciada. La vida ha sido difícil para Julieta, pero siempre tiene una sonrisa que ofrecer a las personas, especialmente a sus clientes. Vende abarrotes y esto le permite estar al cuidado de su propio negocio y de su hijo.

Necesita un préstamo de $ 475 para comprar mercancía, ya que Julieta quiere aumentar la capacidad de su negocio y espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten. Ella solo quiere seguir apoyando a su hijo y ofrecerle una calidad de vida como cualquier otra persona. Ella y su hijo necesitan de tu generosidad y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: I am a widow, a mother of 4. I sell cooked food for a living. I intend to use the loan to venture into a more organised food-selling business, selling varieties of dishes so as to be able to meet my family's needs.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin T. is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Peyyeng province in Cambodia. He makes his living by growing crops and raising animals on the farm. His wife helps him on the farm and together they typically make 5 USD/day in revenue. One of their children works in a local garment factory, while the other is a blacksmith. The income they earn is contributed to the household once per month.

With part of his loan, Hin hopes to purchase additional construction tools to build a house. With the rest of his loan, Hin hopes to purchase additional seeds for his plantation. In the future, Hin would like to expand his farm by increasing the number of crops and animals to respond to the increase in his clients’ demand.

loans.use: To purchase some construction tools and some seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for her current business.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Emigdio is 36 years old, married and has two children. His auto repair shop is centrally located in the Cabanas area of the city of Caacupe. He got started in his trade by attending trade school in the city of San Lorenzo and later working as an apprentice with an uncle who owns an auto repair shop in Caacupe. He worked there for 10 years and gained the experience necessary to feel confident about his professional knowledge and ability.

Currently Emigdio runs his own auto repair shop from his home and has the most up to date equipment, thanks to other loans he received through the Paraguayan Foundation. In the beginning it was difficult, because customers didn't know him well, but thanks to the referrals and recommendations of customers, friends and family, he now has a well established clientele.

His biggest achievement has been taking risks and succeeding at being gainfully self-employed. Today he owns all the necessary tools and equipment to complete the most complex repair jobs. He also plans to expand his shop by adding a shed where he will be able to store engines and parts. He's requesting this loan to purchase a portable welding machine.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Emigdio 36 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su taller está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia en la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, se inició en el oficio estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de San Lorenzo y posteriormente en forma práctica con su tío quién es propietario de un taller de vehículo en la ciudad de Caacupé allí trabajó durante 10 años dónde adquirió la experiencia necesaria como para sentirse seguro dentro de lo que es su oficio. Actualmente Emigdio ya cuenta con su propio taller en su domicilio, con los equipos más modernos, que lo fue adquiriendo gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, al comienzo fue difícil porque los clientes tenían que conocer su trabajo, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus propios clientes, vecinos y amigos, hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada. Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber asumido riesgos y lograr la independencia laboral, hoy día ya cuenta con todos los equipos necesarios para realizar los trabajos más exigentes, además está pensando ampliar su taller con la construcción de un pequeño tinglado esto le permitirá tener más espacio para almacenar los motores de los vehículos. Solicita el crédito para comprar un soldador autógeno.

loans.use: To purchase a portable welding machine

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Sra. Rosa belongs to the Santa Rosa community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 39 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a day laborer but his earning don't cover the basic household expenses so Rosa began looking for ways to help. She didn't have enough capital to start a business, though, so she turned to Manuela Ramos for a loan to start a shop selling candy, cookies, etc. She now has a small store stocked with a variety of products and can count on help from her children.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles or about US$500), to be repaid in 4 months, she'll be able to improve her store and buy 1 case of milk, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 3 cases of soft drinks and 5 "casilleros" of eggs.

She's very happy to have the extra income to cover the family's various expenses and also that the family has been able to work together, united.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa, A. H. Juan Bautista Mz C Lt 18 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su pareja es obrero y lo que gana no alcanza para las necesidades básicas D. su hogar, por ello Rosa buscó oportunidad D. negocio pero al no contar con el capital necesario recurrió a Manuela Ramos y desD. ese entonces, y con su primer préstamo, decidió vender galletas, caramelos, chocalatillos, etc. Ahora tiene una pequeña bodega con una variedad D. productos y cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500 (US$ 500.00 aprox.), el mismo que será cancelado en 4 meses, podrá mejorar su local y podrá comprar 1 caja D. leche, 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar 3 cajas D. gaseosa y 5 casilleros D. huevo.

Ella está muy contenta D. contar con un ingreso adicional y así cubrir los diferentes gastos, además tiene una familia muy unida donD. trabajan juntos.

loans.use: Buy supplies for resale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a small business owner from Kherson, Ukraine. She started her business about ten years ago because there were no other jobs available for her. Today, Tatyana has a little sales kiosk at the Dneprovski market in Kherson where she sells women’s clothing. Her kiosk is in a good location at the market which gives her a competitive edge in attracting passing customers. Tatyana is divorced and is raising a fifteen year old son. Her business provides valuable income for Tatyana to support herself and her son.

Tatyana has requested a loan of $1000 that will help her purchase new inventory and increase her profits. She has been an ideal loan client with Nadiya Ukraine and has benefited from the financial assistance that is available to her. We look forward to many more opportunities to help Tatyana run a successful, prosperous business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.en:
Cruz María is the proprietor and operator of a casual clothing store which she started three years ago.  Cruz is thirty-three years old, and she and her husband have two children.  She is currently pregnant.
Cruz mentions that in the beginning things were not easy and she was very worried about finding money to start the small store.  “Obtaining funds for my business have never been so stress-free”, she says showing a hearty smile, referring  to the loan she got from FSMA a few months ago.  She used her loan to buy men and women’s clothing for her store.  She has also remodeled a room of her house and there she is operating the store.  Cruz María hopes her business can keep growing so that she can continue on supporting her children's studies.
With her loan, the entrepreneur will get clothing in bulk to move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Kasharara Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en: B. Judith, the chairperson of Kasharara Bakyara Twimukye Group, is 40 years old and has 2 children: 1 is at a university, while the other is in secondary school. Judith also takes care of her 2 brothers. For the past 12 years, she has been running a shop that also operates as a bar in Kagongo, Ibanda district. She has borrowed from the loan organization before, and currently needs support to expand her business by increasing the stock of sodas, beer, and other drinks. Judith's dream is to see her business transform into a whole-sale business, so that she can afford to buy a new business car.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of sodas, beer, and other drinks to expand business

loans.name: Busazi East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zainabu K.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more furniture. Zainabu is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Zainabu makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Zainabu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zainabu is joined in her small group by Jaliat M., Loy Namatume, Nulu Nalubanga, and Yisa N.. Jaliat M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase another fridge. Loy Namatume is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to purchase more hair oils and chemicals. Nulu Nalubanga operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase more shop items. Yisa N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more utensils and cutlery.

loans.use: To boost and expand restaurant business

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 37 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 2 and 14 years old. Zainabu is a cereals seller, a business she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria launched her business because her husband really likes hojarascas (a traditional Mexican sweet) and baked cookies. Since she had never made them at home, she decided to learn how. She grew to enjoy it, and offered the homemade sweets to her acquaintances, who told her that it would be a good idea to sell them. She listened to them, and that's how her business came to be.

She felt the need to open the business because of her family's low income. They were spending more now that their son was older, and so she opened a bakery - a business that she enjoyed - which enabled her to earn extra money to cover her family's needs.

Luz Maria began her business seven years ago, and has never regretted that decision. She has brought in good earnings, which have allowed her to pay for severla unforseen expenses. She has a very good clientele, and even distributes her sweets to big businesses like Helados Sultana, an ice cream company. This creates a steady stream of income to cover household expenses.

Today, Luz Maria needs a loan of $600, which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the money to buy ingredients to make her sweets so that she can fill her existing long list of orders.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz Maria inició el negocio porque a su esposo le gustan mucho las hojarascas y galletas horneadas y como en su casa ya no le hacian, se propuso aprender a hacerlas y poco a poco le comenzo a gustar mas, entonces las ofrecio a conocidos quienes le comentaron que, seria buen negocio el venderlas y les hizo caso, asi fue como inicio el negocio que ahora tiene.

Su principal necesidad para emprender su negocio, fue la poca entrada de dinero, ya que tenian mas gastos ahora que su hijo estaba creciendo por lo que tomo la reposteria como un negocio que ademas le gustaba, y le iba a dejar dinero extra para cubrir sus necesidades.

Comenzó hace 7 años con el negocio y no piensa dejarlo porque desde aquel entonces, le ha dejado buenas ganancias para salir de algunos imprevistos, tiene muy buena clientela e inclusive tiene reparto a negocios grandes como Helados Sultana donde coloco sus productos y este tambien es un ingreso seguro para los gastos de su casa.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses, le va a servir para comprar materia prima para hacer su productos ya que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make cookies

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai V., 37, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience selling Taro, taamu and bananas. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faafetai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be used also for home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: General store  with school supplies

loans.name: Palo Rosa Uno Group

texts.en:
The group bank Palo Rosa Uno ("Rose Stick I") consists of 14 partners who dedicate themselves to working hard and strengthening their small businesses with the help of credit given by AgroCapital. The group is located in the Pampa La Madre zone of Montero, in the tropical Santa C. region of eastern Bolivia.

Most of the group members have businesses in the German Moreno market selling animals, animal feed, food (sweets, salteña pastries, dry goods, and vegetables), and cosmetics. Most plan to invest their loan in additional livestock or supplies for their respective businesses.

The group's president, Elena M., has bought and sold livestock in this market for more than 15 years. She says that she is very happy to be working with the institution, having been a client now for more than a year. Newly reorganized, the group is quite excited to begin working toward common goals.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Don Blas Sosa está casado con Doña Adriana Moreno, ellos son una pareja muy trabajadora .Doña Adriana tiene una despensa que atiende día tras día, la despensa tiene todos los articulos de primera necesidad, tambien de mercería, y carnes.

Ellos proveen a toda la zona del Barrio Maria del Carmen, que es un barrio donde conviven personas de escasos recursos. Don Blas es jubilado de una entidad pública que provee electricidad al país y que se llama ANDE. Tiene un sueldo fijo que invierte en la despensa.

El crédito que Fundación Paraguaya le brindo le ha sido de gran ayuda para acrecentar los ingresos de la familia, de esta manera Fundacion Praguaya colabora con capital social para nuestro querido Paraguay.

El crédito que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y variedad, así los clientes van a poder encontrar todo lo que buscan en su despensa y a buen precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Blas Sosa is married to Mrs. Adriana Moreno. Together, they are a hard working couple. Adriana has a pantry which she attends to every day. The pantry is well stocked with convenience items, as well as sewing supplies and meat. .

They sell ot the Maria del Carmen neighborhood, which is a low income area. Blas is retired from a public agency names ANDE which provides electricity to the country. He has a fixed income which he invests in the pantry.

The credit that they have received from Fundacion Paraguaya has been a great help in increasing family income. In this manner Fundacion Paraguaya collaborates with social capital for our beloved Paraguay.

The loan requested in this circumstance will be used to purchase more and a greater variety of inventory, so that customers may find what they need from the pantry at a fair price.


Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, noodles, meat, fruit, vegetables, canned goods, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Fayzidin

texts.ru:
Шарипов Файзидин, 1983 года рождения, женат и у них 3 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи продуктов питания. У него 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Накопив капитал Файзидин купил собственный магазин и переоборудовал его под продовольственный магазин. У него в ассортименте все необходимые продукты питания, мука, растительное масло, сахар, конфеты, хлебобулочные и кондитерские изделия, печени, пряники, консервная продукция и т.д. Также в продаже имеются товары народного потребления и хозтовары, стиральные порошки, туалетное мыло, шампуни и другие принадлежности. У илхома много постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар в магазинах Сафар-Центра.
Файзидин хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить сахар, масло и муки.
texts.en:
Fayzidin S. was born in 1983, he is married and has three children. He started his business selling food and produce. He has eight years of experience in this field. By saving some capital, Fayzidin has bought his own store and remodeled it as a convenience store. In his assortment there are all kinds of necessary products such as flour, vegetable oil, sugar, candy, baked goods and sweets, cookies, doughnuts, canned products and more. There are also products for personal and household use such as detergents, soap, shampoo and other products. He has many regular customers. Fayzidin buys his merchandise from stores in the Safar center.

He wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy more sugar, oil and flour.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil and flour

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is 56 years old and the mother of five. She and her huband are rice farmers, and have been in this trade ever since Fe inherited a three-hectare plot from her mother. Her husband cultivates the land it, planting rice for his family to consume and more to sell on the open market. During harvest season, Fe sells a portion of their crop to traders in their town. The profit they make covers their expenses and helps pay for their children's schooling.

Fe is applying for a loan to buy six bags of fertilizer and two quarts of insecticide. “I need this loan to increase the yield of my farm and augment my income," she said. 

Mrs. A. is a loyal CEV client who has benefited from our insurance program along with the training and credit assistance we provide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., a 49-year-old mother, is a food vendor. She has spent her whole life working to help her family and support her children. Her husband is a farmer who helps her run her business and she is doing her best to send all her children to school and provide them with a good future.

Josephine needs a loan to purchase additional ingredients and food items to sell. She cooks food as well as selling vegetables to earn a living. She also is looking at some other possible income areas to address her family's needs.

In an interview she said, “CEVI has given me a chance to change our lives. They provide us with credit assistance so our business can grow, with training for social growth and insurance coverage for our security and protection.”

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and food items to sell

loans.name: Valentina J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Valentina M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with six children between the ages of 20 and 30. Valentina has been running a crop-selling business since 1985. This client’s business is purchasing crops from villagers on a wholesale basis and selling them retail.

She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. Valentina currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more rice and maize for re-selling. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing such varieties of cereals as beans and wheat. Valentina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  more  rice and maize for re-sale

loans.name: Sophors' Group

texts.en: Mr. Sophors S. is a leader of a group of four who all live in the Ta Krong village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a firewood seller, and his wife, Mrs. Yeim Him, is a farmer who owns a piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice and vegetables. Currently, he does not have enough money to purchase firewood to re-sell to his customers. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy firewood to re-sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mahamadou Dembelé  est âgé de 31 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une famille élargie dans le quartier Torakabougou  de la préfecture de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique d’articles divers.  Il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand frère et cela durant des années.  Pour qu’il soit responsable c’est à dire assurer les dépenses de sa propre famille, son grand frère décida de lui donner un fonds de commerce depuis maintenant 6 ans. Monsieur Mahamadou Dembélé  maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité dans son quartier.    
Afin d’agrandir son fonds de commerce, Monsieur Mahamadou Dembélé  décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt indididuel. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter des articles divers  pour sa boutique à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales, il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 500FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour agrandir sa boutique, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie.
texts.en:
Mr. Mahamadou Dembelé, age 31, lives with his three children and wife in an extended family in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he quickly started in economic work, notably selling various goods in a shop. He learned this business from his older brother over a few years. For him to be responsible, that is to say, to ensure that the expenses of his own family are covered, his older brother decided to give him some seed money six years ago. Mr. Mahamadou Dembelé is mastering his work and is in high demand in this area.

To increase his working capital, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which he is on his first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy various goods from wholesalers to supply his shop in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali).

Having customers from all walks of life, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA that he envisions using to expand his shop, to repay the loan interest, and to provide for his extended family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good for the shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma cuenta con 34 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en la casa de sus suegros. Añas atrás se dedicaba solamente a la siembra plátanos y cítricos, desde que vive con su esposo ha incrementando cultivos de café en chacras alquiladas, donde le cobran por cada cosecha la suma 150 soles. El cultivo de este producto es muy trabajoso, una vez cosechado se tiene que lavar, después tender al piso para secar, luego tostar en cacerolas para finalmente mole. Pero resulta muy rentable porque abastecen a una casa comercial donde tienen pedidos semanales una vez iniciada la temporada de cosecha. Esos meses de bonanza aprovecha en acumular todas las ganancias, para comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares de sus hijos y algunas prendas para ellos. A Norma le gusta mucho la chacra, porque hay temporadas que les rinde buenas ganancias; ahora están pensando incrementar sus cultivos de café para que de ese modo sus cosechas se den con más frecuencia. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, en el cual se compromete en pagar las cuotas con responsabilidad; los integrantes de su banco comunal la han nombrado secretaria, cargo que asume con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de café, para apurar su cosecha para esta campaña.
texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old, the mother of two children and lives in her in-laws´ house. Some years ago she only grew bananas and citrus fruits. Since living with her husband she has incremented her crops and grows coffee in some rented fields, where she is charged 150 soles for each harvest. Growing this product is very hard; once it is harvested it has to be washed, later spead out on the ground to dry, later toasted and finally ground. But it has turned out to be very profitable because they supply a business which places orders every week once the harvest begins. They take advantage of those times during which they accumulate earnings to buy school uniforms and supplies for their children and clothing for themselves. Norma likes farming because there are times when they have good earnings. She is thinking about increasing her coffee crops so she can increase her output. This is her first loan with MFP, for which she commits to making repayments responsibly. The members of the communal bank have named her secretary, a position she assumes with great responsibility. The money she request is to buy fertilizers for her coffee crops so she can accelerate her harvest this season.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
