Lesina I., 41, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the clothing sales business. She sells to the General Public 6 days per week.

Lesina is asking for a loan to purchase design boards, rollers of ie lavalava materials, poplins, paints, and brushes. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~312 USD). SPBD loans are Lesina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials for decorating clothing

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass has owned a butcher shop since 2006. He is a 53-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Abass has requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and tools for his shop. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop as well as his financiA. situation. Abass knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capitA.. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and tools for a butcher shop

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor. Miguel C. tiene 52 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, en la ciudad de Managua, casado tiene cinco hijos todos los tiene estudiando. Los planes que posee para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y que sus hijos preparen profesionalmente. Don Miguel de profesión técnico industrial, pero se ha hecho difícil desempeñarse en su oficio por lo cual se dedico ha iniciar su pequeño negocio de reciclajes de chatarras y otros materiales. Iniciando con  poco recurso económico. Unas de la dificultares que se encontró en el negocio es falta de financiamientos. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha establecido su empresa de reciclajes. Con la solicitud de un nuevo préstamo lograra comprar materiales de: hierro, zinc, etc. logrando aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel C. is 52 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood in the city of Managua. He is married and has five children, all of whom are students. His plans include improving his family’s standard of living and seeing his children prepare themselves professionally. Mr. Miguel is an industrial technician but he had a hard time finding work in his field, so he decided to start a small recycling business for scrap metal and other materials. One of the difficulties that he has run into is the lack of financing. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, he has established his recycling business. With this loan he will be able to buy materials such as iron, zinc, etc., which will allow him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron and zinc

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma R. is married and has three young children. Norma studied tailoring when she lived with her parents, who took care of the costs of her studies, as she was their only daughter.

With a little bit of savings she had from a previous job, and with the help of her husband, Mrs. Norma bought her first sewing machine and started her own small business. Due to the quality of her garments and good attention to detail, she now has a well-established clientele, for whom she makes school and work uniforms.

Mrs. Norma was part of a committee of women, with whom she paid off her debts and demonstrated herself to be hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make uniforms for a local business

loans.name: Olubukola

texts.en: Olubukola sells provisions and drinks. She is 48 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“I want to make my life productive, so I make the best out of it,” Erlinda L. shared. At 52, Erlinda is still craving a good life, not only for her, but most importantly for her family. At present she owns a general store, which is situated at their house at Buenavista, Santiago City, Isabela. Aside from that she is also engaged in hog raising. In spite of her age, she really doesn't feel exhausted managing a store and, at the same time, cleaning the animal pen with the bad smell of animal manure. With her and husband’s hard work, they are able to support their family's needs.

However, Erlinda wants to further expand her business, thus she decided to seek a loan amounting to PHP5,000 from Kiva lenders. She knows that she will become successful in her plan because her family is always there to support her. Their care and love is her motivation to strive in every step that she makes. Furthermore, she hopes that Kiva lenders will help her achieve her dream.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Eunice  Nyambura

texts.en:
Eunice Nyambura is 26 years old, married and blessed with one child. She owns a beauty salon in Gitaru, Kikuyu.

Eunice has been running the business for a period of six years with a monthly profit of about 27,500 Kenyan shillings (about $350). With the proceeds from this loan, she plans to restock her salon with beauty products of different varieties. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a member.

Eunice's clients are mainly children and ladies.  She hopes to own a bigger salon someday, and open a hair-styling and beauty-training college.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to resell at a salon

loans.name: Geraldo Francisco

texts.pt:
Geraldo Francisco C. nasceu em Zavala província de inhambane,de 38 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 9 e 13 anos de idades, todos frenquentam escola. Para alem da família sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos que estão sob sua responsabilidade. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado devido à guerra. Vive com sua família na casa própria.

Geraldo saiu de Zavala quando tinha 16 anos para refugiar se na cidade de maputo devido à guerra civil que terminou no ano de 1992, juntamente com sua família. Chegado a maputo, trabalhou com seu primo como cobrador no transporte semi- colectivo durante 10 anos e mais tarde arranjou emprego formal nas bombas de combustível da Petromoc (Petróleos de Moçambique) onde trabalha ate data hoje.

Para alem de estar a trabalhar e como o salário mensal de 5.000,00MT, com o qual sustenta sua família, faz o negocio de venda de pneus para viaturas. Compra o pneu a 1.350,00MT e vende a 1.950,00MT e consegue um bom rendimento que ate poupa no banco comercial.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de pneus e outros acessórios para revender. Obteve informações acerca da instituição através de amigos e vizinhos que também são clientes da hluvuku. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de para a mesma actividade nos valores de (7.500,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 25.000,00MT) respectivamente.

Propõe se a pagar os empréstimos sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos para cumprir o sonho de melhorar a forma de prestação de serviços construindo um estabelecimento convencional, incluindo lavagem de viaturas.
texts.en:
Geraldo Francisco C. was born in the Zavala province of Inhambane. He is 38 years old, married, and is the father of 2 children who are 9 and 13 and both attend school. Aside from his own family, he also supports 3 nephews. He studied until the 6th grade but had to stop because of the war. He lives with his family in his own home.

Geraldo left Zavala for Maputo with his family when he was 16 to take refuge from the civil war that ended in 1992. He arrived in Maputo and worked with his cousin as a driver for a tram for 10 years. Later on he found a job with the gas station Petromoc (Petroleum of Mozambique) where he continues to work today.

Aside from this work and as his monthly salary is 5.000,00MT, with which he supports his family, he has a business selling tires. He buys the tires at 1.350,00MT and sells them for 1.950,00MT and he earns a good return which he saves in the bank.

He has never taken out a loan with another bank and this is his 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 15.000,00MT to buy and sell the tires and other accessories. He learned of the institution through his friends and neighbors who are also clients. The first loans he took were used for the same purpose and were for the amounts of 7.500,00MT, 15.000,00MT, and 25.000,00MT, respectively.

He plans to pay back the loans without problems to be able to have access to more loans to finance his dream of improving his services, constructing a conventional establishment, including a car wash.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of car tires

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Francisco de 32 y su hijo Ubaldo de 6 años, y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. En su pequeña casa hecha de adobe, Dionisia teje unos pequeños y graciosos muñequitos de lana, los cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puno, donde son los turistas los que más se entusiasman con sus muñequitos y los compran muy rápidamente, ya que son un bonito recuerdo para llevar a su país. Lo que más la divierte de su trabajo es tejer, lo cual la llena de satisfacción, pues sabe que también de esa manera puede darle de comer a su familia. Lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que salir a vender todo el día de forma ambulante, lo cual la cansa mucho; por tal motivo espera que con el tiempo pueda tener un negocio más estable que le brinde mejores ingresos económicos y un puesto de venta estable, pues desea darle unos buenos estudios a su querido hijo. Ya son 5 los préstamos que Dionisia ha solicitado en MFP y ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, pues nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a sus compañeras muy felices. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para aumentar la cantidad de muñequitos que teje.
texts.en:
Dionisia, who is 30 years old, is a loving and hard-working woman. She lives in a house she owns, along with her husband Francisco who is 32 years old and her son Ubaldo who is 6. What she wishes for the most is to give them a good life. In her small home built of adobe, she knits small, cute little dolls out of wool that she takes to sell in the city of Puno where there are many tourists who appreciate her work and buy her product very quickly as they are a wonderful keepsake to take back home. What she enjoys most about her work is the knitting, an activity that fills her with satisfaction since she knows it will provide food for her family. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she considers the most difficult part having to be gone the entire day to sell her wares, which makes her very tired. For this reason, she hopes to – in time – establish her business in a stable place where she doesn’t have to travel to market her dolls. She would like to provide an education for her beloved son. Dionisia has had 5 loans with MFP by now, and she has been very punctual with her payments. She has never had any problems with her cooperative bank, where she is in charge of installments and her good humor makes her colleagues very happy. With the three hundred soles she is requesting, she will purchase more yarn to increase the quantity of little dolls she knits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: A. Charlotte est née vers 1981. Charlotte est mariée et mère de Cinq (05) enfants dont quatre (04) sont  scolarisés. Charlotte et sa famille vivent à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Charlotte est vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, etc.) ; des condiments de sauces (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gingembre, gombo, piment, sel, œufs, huiles végétales, etc.) et des poissons fumés. Charlotte est dans cette activité depuis fort longtemps mais, elle n'a pas pu constituer son propre capital. C’est la raison pour laquelle  Charlotte sollicite un prêt d’ALIDé.  Charlotte veut mieux développer  son activité génératrice de revenu dans le but de  constituer son propre capital ; ce qui lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement.
texts.en:
A. Charlotte was born around 1981.  She is married and the mother of five children, of whom four are in school.  Charlotte and her family live in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She sells various items:  candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, etc.;  sauce condiments, including fresh tomatoes, onions, black pepper, garlic, ginger, okra, chili peppers, salt, eggs, vegetable oil, etc.;  and smoked fish.  Charlotte has been in this business for quite a long time, but she has not been able to build up her own capital.  For this reason, she’s requesting a loan from ALIDé.  She wants to develop further her income-generating business with the goal of building capital.  This will enable her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (tomatoes, cassava flour, lamp fuel, red palm oil, sugar) and boxes of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk for her business

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe joined CEV last May to take advantage of the financial help it offers. She makes a living growing rice on her 1.5 hectare farm. Her crop has just begun to grow, and she needs supplies such as fertilizer to keep it healthy and free from weeds and pests. Mariafe is 35 years old and lives with her husband Ruben. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000, which she will use to expand her business and achieve greater success in life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
En Managua, capital de Nicaragua, la señora María C. se esfuerza a diario para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos siendo ofrecidos por ella en vitrinas y son varios los clientes que le visitan para comprar los cosméticos. También ella se destaca en la venta de comestibles como hot dogs los que son preparados por ella misma.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo a lo inmediato en la compra de los cosméticos y también en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los comestibles y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Sra. María C. strives daily to improve the condition of her business selling cosmetics. Her products are presented in display cases as many customers pass through to buy her merchandise. In addition, María sells snacks, such as hot dogs, that she prepares herself.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics and also ingredients for preparing snacks so that she can improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase cosmetics & ingredients for preparing snacks

loans.name: Bernie Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Bernie Joy T. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, is married, and is blessed with one infant child. Bernie Joy owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. and earns 4,000 PHP net monthly. In 2007, Bernie Joy joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 7th loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora Yolanda tiene estudios de primaria completa y tiene 1 hijo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: ovejas.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar una casa para ella y su hijo.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y los ahorros que gana.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a partner of the communal bank "Manuelas de hoy II" and lives in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old and is a live-in partner. She has completed elementary education and has one son. She makes a living by purchasing and selling small animals. Yolanda has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months now. Her first loan was 500 nuevos soles, which she used to buy small animals. Now she is requesting another loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of livestock, such as sheep. Her desire for the future is to buy a house for herself and her son. The things she likes most about her organization are the meetings and the savings she earns.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en: Badamtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her three children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works in a foreign country and sends 150,000-250,000 tugrug (~100-200 USD) per month in order to help them with their living expenses. Her two daughters and son all attend a local secondary school while Badamtsetseg operates a grocery retail business near her home. She began her business in 2001 by operating a small booth. At that time, her working capital was 100,000-150,000 tugrug (~70-105 USD). Since then, she has been able to move from her small booth into a shop and now her working capital is between 300,000 and 500,000 tugrug (~210-350 USD). Her business is the main source of family income and she attributes her success to her good accounting and financial skills. She says, “I want my children to be better educated people who can contribute to their country’s development.” Badamtsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large variety of grocery products for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of grocery products

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es viuda, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Maria se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus tierras, además compra verduras de los productores y los comercializa en su puesto del mercado de abastos, además tiene una tienda en su casa, negocio que esta a cargo de su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo, tomate, ajo.
Los sueños de Maria son implementar un restaurante para su hija y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. Maria is a 49 year old widow, and she has two children. Maria plants vegetables on her land. She also buys vegetables from growers and sells them at her stand in the Abastos Market. She also has a store in her house, which her daughter runs. Maria needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy zucchini, tomatoes, and garlic. Maria’s dreams are to set up a restaurant for her daughter and to buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zucchini, tomatoes, and garlic

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna  es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Creceremos en quechua.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Reyna vive en el distrito de Quinua en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Reyna vende ropa en las diferentes ferias.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar.
Los sueños de Reyna es construir su casa y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiñarisun”, which means “We Will Grow” in Quecha. She is 48 years old, single, and has two children. Reyna lives in the District of Quinua where she manages a grocery store from a rented location. She works every day. In addition, Reyna sells clothing at the different fairs.

She needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy rice and sugar. Reyna dreams of building a house and making subsequent improvements to it.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Working For Success Group

texts.en:
Gabriel M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Working for Success. He is 23 years old, single and a high school graduate waiting to enter university. He doesn’t have a child.  Gabriel lives and works on the 20th Street in Sinkor, a community that is mixed with both poor and middle class Liberians in the capital, Monrovia.

Gabriel’s business is a motorcycle taxi service. He transports people from one location to another in Monrovia. He has been running this business for one year and six months and hopes to own a car in the near future. Gabriel started by selling rice but realized that transportation was more profitable than rice sales.

He gives his customers good service and drives them with care in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business.  Gabriel needs this loan to purchase spare parts and service for his motorbike. He dreams of improving his living conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Gabriel is the one holding the sign. Yawa F. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and service for a motorbike.

loans.name: Phum

texts.en: Phum S., age 28, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the business of sewing and designing clothes, earning approximately US $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2002. Her husband is engaged in the business of producing furniture, earning an income of US $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. S. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase Cambodian traditional fabric to design clothes for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy traditional fabric to design clothes for sale

loans.name: Olman

texts.es:
El señor Olman C. V.  tiene 5 años de trabajar con  esta Institución financiera , El se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, habita en la comarca corre viento El Sauce, 
EL está solicitando este crédito para la compra de ternero en desarrollo  lo que venderá a un mejor precio  así poder   obtener  mayores ingreso y  abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Olman C. V. has been working with this financial institution for 5 years. He is involved in agriculture, and lives in the district of Corre Viento El Sauce.

He is requesting this loan to buy a young calf, which he will later sell at a higher price. This way, he will earn a better income and meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Joaquin Exequiel

texts.es:
el sr. Joaquin Exequiel L. T. tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas.
El Sr. L. tiene un restaurante recreativo ubicado en el Municipio de Jacaleapa a orillas de la carretera Panamericana el cual opera bajo el nombre de “TIPICOS EL CARAL” donde vende una gran variedad de comidas como ser: Almuerzos, Cenas, Pescado, Carne Asada, Chilaquiles, Tajaditas, Enchiladas, Papas, Sopa de Jaiba, etc…
El lugar en donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio es de un ambiente agradable, saludable y de muy buena higiene.
La atención especial que les brindan a sus clientes es una caracteristica principal de su negocio.
El Sr. L. nos comento que sus clientes potenciales son personas de la ciudad de Danlí y su mayor volumen de ventas los tiene los fines de semana, ya que los fines de semana pone un ambiente a su negocio contratando un sonido musical los días sábados por la noche; además de eso para esta época de verano como el local es amplio instala unas piscinas para que los clientes puedan comer y bañar a la mismo tiempo. 
El Sr. Joaquín vive en unión libre y su compañera de hogar le ayuda en el negocio a preparar las comidas que venden, tienen una niña la cual esta empezando con sus estudios primarios. 

Don Joaquín utilizara el credito en la compra de 20 sillas plásticas, 1 DVD, y una piscina grande, para darle una mejor presentación a su negocio y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos por el servicio que les brinda.
texts.en:
Joaquin has been selling food for tha past three years. He has a restaurant, called “Tipicos El Caral,” located in Jacaleapa alongside the Pan-American Highway. He sells a variety of meals such as breakfast, dinners, fish, grilled meats, chilaquiles, chops, enchiladas, potatoes, crab soup, etc… His location is clean and friendly and the special attention that he gives his clients is one of its characteristics. He tells us that his potential customers are people from the city of Danlí and that he makes most of his sales on the weekend. He hires a band to play on Saturday nights. And, since summer is coming, he also plans to add some pools so that his customers can eat and sit in the pools at the same time. Joaquin lives with his domestic partner and she helps him prepare the food they sell. They have a daughter who is beginning elementary school. He will use the money from this loan to buy 20 plastic chairs, one DVD player, and a large pool, in order to present a better impression so that his customers feel more satisfied with the service.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chairs, DVD player, pool

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn is the mother of a 5-year-old child. She is 30 and married to Donald. She loves making dresses and she now earns money from it. She makes school uniforms and other types of clothes. She hopes for her business to prosper. She applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI and she will use it to buy cloth and tailoring materials. She also hopes to have her own shop someday.

loans.use: To buy cloth and tailoring materials

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La Sra. Jaqueline se dedica al envasado y venta de condimentos, como locoto molido, pimienta, comino, ajo molido, aji amarillo y rojo, ella los hace secar, los muele y posteriormente los envasa para venderlos, tiene sus clientes en la ciudad de Oruro, y también en la ciudad de El Alto, en esta actividad le ayudan su papá, tine 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, es una cliente muy responsable y puntual. El crédito será invertido en la compra de envases (sobresitos y cajas) para los productos, la Sra. Jaqueline es joven soltera que desea continuar sus estudios pero con su negocio no tiene tiempo ya que esta en constante viaje, le va muy bien y muy pronto espera contratar personal y asi dedicarse a terminar sus estudios, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
Jacqueline packages and sells condiments like ground chilies, pepper, cumin, ground garlic, and red and yellow peppers. She dries them, grinds them, and packages them for sale. She has customers in the city of Oruro and also in the city of El Alto. Her father helps her in this activity. She has five years of experience in this field. She is a very responsible and punctual client. The loan will be used to buy packaging (packets and boxes) for the products. Jaqueline is a young, single woman who wishes to continue her education. But, with her business she does not have time because she is constantly traveling. It is going very well for her, and she hopes to hire people very soon. That way she can devote herself to finishing her education. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Delia es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Delia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y aceite.
Los sueños de Delia son educar a sus hijos y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Delia, 36, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She lives with her life partner and two children. She has a store in her home where she stocks groceries like meats and vegetables; she is open for business every day. Delia needs a 1200 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Her dreams are to educate her children and enlarge her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Asosa

texts.en:
Asosa C. is 32 and married with four children. She owns a business selling BBQ (sausages, chicken and plantains).  Asosa has one year of experience in this business. Asosa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates, utensils and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Asosa joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asosa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates, utensils and coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients to make more "roscas" (rolls in the shape of a circle)

loans.name: Taim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Taim T. is 36 years old and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by the four members, who are located in Samphli village in Takeo province. Mrs. Taim T. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Penh, are farmers who own 1.2 hectares of land. They cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Taim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. Mrs. Taim T. also sells Khmer cakes in the local market to earn extra income.  This couple has four children, all of whom are students and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan ihas lived in a city called Borewala in Pakistan for more than thirty years.  She makes wooden stools to financially assist her husband. She used the items (wooden crushed sticks, leather and soft foam) as building material.  Her husband has a lumber business and sells in a local market. Her husband provides her wood for making the wooden stools that she needs to meet the orders of her customers.  

She is also a good mother as well. She manages the household chores and carried out the responsibilities of a mother and a housewife efficiently. She has three sons and two daughters. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints and her sons had to work to support the family during their teen-age years.  

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband expand his business. With the loan he will buy timber to fill larger orders. 

This is the 2nd loan from Asasah and she maintains a good credit behavior. She hopes that investment in her husband’s business can increase his income which will make her family’s financial life easier.

loans.use: To purchase timber for reselling

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 60 años, es un padre de familia abnegado por el bienestar de sus hijos, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. La crianza y venta de cerdos es el negocio que realiza diariamente, sus cerdos son muy solicitados en el mercado, ya que siempre están bien alimentados y son muy grandes. Todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana se levanta para darles a sus cerdos el alimento que necesitan para crecer, los cuida con mucho cariño, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos tendrá el capital para mantener a su familia. Los 8 años que lleva en este negocio, tuvo que batallar con la gripe porcina; que lo perjudico y sus ventas bajaron, pero hoy en día viene mejorando considerablemente su mercado, por ello se preocupa en  alimentarlos. En adelante piensa elaborar corrales e incrementar el número de porcinos que cría. Este es tercer préstamo de Elizabet en MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, para de ese modo acceder próximos aportes. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará  más comida para sus cerdos y también aprovechará para comprar otros dos porcinos más.
texts.en:
Julio is 60 years old, a family man who has sacrificed for the wellbeing of his children. He and his wife and two children live in their own home. He works at his business every day, raising and selling pork. His product is very sought out in the market because the livestock are always well nourished and large in size. Every day since very early in the morning he wakes to feed the livestock to make them grow. He attends to them with a great deal of care because he knows that it is thanks to them that he will earn the income to support his family. During the 8 years he has been running this business he had to battle against swine flu incidents, damaging his business and depleting his sales. But today the situation has improved considerably, and to maintain it he has been careful to feed them well. In the future he hopes to set up corrals so that he may keep larger numbers of livestock. This is the third loan he has requested from Elizabet en MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to make his payments on time. With this loan he hopes to purchase more feed for the livestock and also to purchase two more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two pigs and feed.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky P. is currently in the business of selling bananas, yams, carrots and sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to stock cassava, fruit such as jack fruits, and Irish potatoes to sell.  Vicky is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock cassava, fruit such as jack fruits, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Ayda Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Ayda del Socorro C. G. es trabajadora activa del Colegio “La Fortuna” el crucero tiene  quince años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación primaria. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayda del Socorro C. G. has been working as an Elementary School Teacher at “La Fortuna” School for 15 years. She has had five CEPRODEL loans that have been used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have improved her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint for her house, cement, zinc metal sheeting and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Phenh

texts.en: Phenh P., 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. P. is a farmer and she also produces traditional baskets for an income of US $4 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to school. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to school

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
As everyone knows, fish is the main essential fresh food for everybody, in particular for families who depend on fishing and fish-selling. Mrs. Em S. currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. 

Mrs. Em S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with seven children. Mrs. Em S. faces difficulty with transporting her items to sell. Mrs. Em S. has been paying money for taxis because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. To decrease the cost of carrying her goods, she would like a $1,200 loan in order to buy a used motorbike for transport needs. Mrs. Em S. proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to transport her items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, American rice, sugar, oil, La Lechera milk, eggs, chicken and soap.

loans.name: Alfonso Alberto

texts.es:
ALFONSO ALBERTO L., Trabaja como Higienista en Commema Mercado Oriental.
El va utilizar la plata en la mejora de su Casa de Habitación que piensa  comprar algunas lamina de zinc  casa de habitación y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
HA TRABAJADO SIETE PRESTAMO CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Alfonso Alberto L. works as a cleaner for COMMEMA (Municipal Markets Corporation of Managua) in the Mercado Oriental market. He will use the funds for home improvements. He plans to purchase some zinc sheets for his home and to take care of some family expenses. He has previously received seven CEPRODEL loans for home improvements.

loans.use: Home improvements and personal expenses

loans.name: Ana Sulema

texts.es: Ana Sulema H. D.
texts.en: Ana Sulema H. D.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a clinical laboratory

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie L., who is 44 and a CCT community partner in Caloocan City, Philippines. Finishing her college education, Rosemarie is ever determined to break people's low expectations of her. She is married to Henry, an auto welder. They were blessed with two children, one of whom is currently employed and the other one is in tertiary education now.

Rosemarie's home serves both as an abode of rest and a venue for business, because at her home she has set up a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She sells a wide range of products to the neighborhood, which includes items from rice and noodles to detergent powder and soap bars. With this, Rosemarie earns a net average of 400 Philippines pesos (Php) per day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 (Php) loan. Adding more products to her store is a priority for her to improve her business, and the money from the loan would certainly be used to purchase these additional products. She looks forward to making the store grow and eventually expand.

At present, Rosemarie finds it hard to follow up with customers who do not pay their debts on time. But just like any other hardworking entrepreneur, Evelyn sees to it that no challenge will  ever wear her out. She dreams of having a progressive life with her children and being financially stable as well.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Additional stock for her variety store

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida R. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 58 years old. Lida is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, in the local community. Lida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothes or ukay-ukay. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is a 32-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a butcher shop. She lives in District 1, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. For her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marivic is now borrowing PHP 18,000 in order to continue funding the operations of the butcher shop. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marivic hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of her butcher shop

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is from the city of Dipolog. She is 59 years old, married and has one adult child. Natividad owns & operates a vegetable selling business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vegetables and spices. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo vizcaíno un joven soñador  y trabajador, padre de 5 hijos en las edades de 10 hasta   menos de un año.  Se dedica  al lado de su cónyuge,  con quien ha logrado salir adelante,  al alquiler de lavadoras y a la venta de detergentes electrodomésticos y ropa  desde hace dos años. Él vive con su familia en Carrizal un barrio carnavalero por excelencia donde la fiesta  y la música compartida entre vecinos es casi su filosofía. En este ambiente se desenvuelve Rodolfo en sus actividades productivas que surgieron de su propia observación en su medio  y de su propia experiencia cuando compraba a crédito., sus clientes son personas naturales, vecinos del barrio, entre  amigos y familiares. Rodolfo se identifica a si mismo como una persona muy responsable y serio en sus obligaciones y acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para reemplazar a los presta diarios, que otorgan créditos a intereses onerosos y este es justamente su máximo desafío.  Su promedio de ventas mensuales es de $1.000.000 COP y su margen de utilidades es de 50% , con su credikiva comprará una lavadora porque tiene mucha demanda que no puede cubrir y con ella empezaría a responder parcialmente a nuevos clientes. Igualmente comprará mercancía variada de contado y en mayor cantidad. 
Su sueño es adquirir una vivienda para su familia y en el negocio seguir  ampliándolo con cada crédito que obtenga de parte de la Fundación  y especialmente con la inversión de sus utilidades que ofrecen estas inyecciones de capital de trabajo. Rodolfo está muy contento con el acceso a su credikiva,  porque   su desafío  era  encontrar la oportunidad de financiamiento en organizaciones y tener vida crediticia, y con su credikiva empieza  a construirla.
texts.en: Rodolfo V. is ambitious and hard-working.  He has 5 children, from one- to ten-years old.  He has worked along with his wife, with whom he has managed to build a successful business renting washing machines and selling washing soap and clothing, over the last two years.  He lives with his family in Carrizal, a neighborhood famous for its Carnivale celebration and for the music that is practically a way of life among the residents.  Rodolfo knows the neighborhood well and he's shaped his business to meet the needs that he sees.  He used to buy on credit himself so he identifies with his customers, normal people from the neighborhood who are often relatives and friends.  Rodolfo describes himself as responsible and serious.  He approached the Fundacion Mario Santo Domino for a low-cost loan to pay off another higher-interest loan.  His average monthly sales are COP$1,000,000 and his margin is 50%.  He will use this loan from Kiva to buy a washing machine so that he can meet growing demand for his washing machine rental business.  He will also pay cash for miscellaneous merchandise that he will buy in bulk.  Rodolfo's dream is to buy a house for his family.  He wants to continue expanding his business, something he can do with each new Fundacion loan.  Rodolfo is happy that he can borrow from Kiva because his greatest challenge before was finding funds to expand his business.  Once he establishes himself as a borrower with Kiva, he can start building a credit history.

loans.use: Buy a washing machine and other merchandise for rental business.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel M. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Razel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Razel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. She also buys and sells green & yellow bananas, "ube" & vegetables like cabbage. Razel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Razel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Razel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Razel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & bananas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Razel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & bananas

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Nilo, who is 56 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 9 to 25 years old. Perlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase fishing equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Perlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en: This is a 34 years-old Abu Bakarr. He is married, and has 2 children aged 8 and 13 years old. He has 2 additional dependents. In 2007, Abu bakarr established his Pharmacy business. He began this business because he wants to be self employed as a result of poor salary structure in other institutions he has been working for. I decided to open a pharmacy to make more profit and be able to take care of my wife and children said. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, Abu Bakar earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000. Abu Bakarr requires a loan in order to purchase more pharmaceutical drugs. In the future, I plan to make life comfortable for my children by way of building a home and to give quality education to them.   I thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 48 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad vendiendo pollos por unidades para sus cliente y así mejorar su condición económica.

Ahora el trabaja en todo el día con la ayuda de su esposa. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia que es frecuencia por el sector, con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo del local. Sus metas es incrementar su negocio en las ventas y hacer adecuar su casa para darle una vida mejor a para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 48, is a hard working man who started his business selling chickens by the unit to his customers and thus improving his economic situation.

He now works every day with help from his wife.  What affects his business is the delinquency that’s frequent in his neighborhood.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to fix up his locale.

His goals are to increase his sales and to equip his house to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Peter Munoro

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 33 years old, married to Lucy Wangui and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of Kshs 50,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Bernard Kamau

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 40 years old, married to Esther Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Bernard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo tiene un pequeño taller donde elabora cotillones para fiestas de cumpleaños y otras ocasiones. El crédito lo requiere para comprar materia prima: cartulina, papeles de distintos colores, pegamentos, así podrá  aumentar su capital de trabajo. Vive en alquiler en una casa  ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz;  es viudo y tiene un hijo.
texts.en: Arturo has a small workshop where he makes party decorations for birthday parties and other occasions. He needs the loan to buy raw materials: posterboard, differnt colored paper, and glue. In this way, he will be able to increase his working capital. He llives in a rented house in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. He is a widower and has one child.

loans.use: to buy posterboard, colored paper, and glue for his business making party decorations.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells scrap metal, which contributes to her other source of income. Josephine faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting charcoal in her business.

With the Kshs 24,000 she wants to purchase 100 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the other two have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail business, selling in a nearby school. Her potential customers are school-going children. Seasonality is a major challenge as during holiday season, children do not attend school, meaning low customer turn out. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kshs loan, she plans to purchase sacks of ground nuts, biscuits and sweets for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of ground nuts, biscuits and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 50 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Es esposa es maestra en un escuela y tienen dos hijos de 20 años y una menor de 10 años que estudia en la escuela donde trabaja su esposa. Realiza show espectáculos Lunita como payaso..

Toda la vida ha trabajado como payaso y hace espectáculos para fiestas como horas locas y magia. Labora los fines de semanas cuando tiene contrataciones en diferentes fiestas y lo realiza junto con su familia. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar amplificadores a $500, arreglos de su vehículo $300 y parlantes $200 para mejorar su negocio. En un futuro desea comprarse una camioneta doble cabina.
texts.en:
Miguel, 50, lives in the urban area of the Guayaquil suburb.  His wife is a school teacher and they have two children, ages 20 and 10.  The youngest attends school where his mother teachers.  Miguel performs as a clown in the Lunita shows.

All of his life he has worked as a clown and performs at parties for "crazy" and "magic" hour.  He works on weekends, together with his family, when contracted for different parties.  With the help of the loan he wants to buy amplifiers ($500) and loudspeakers ($200), and repair his car ($300).  In the future he hopes to buy a twin cabin van.

loans.use: To buy amplifiers, loudspeakers and repair his car.

loans.name: Mammadgasan

texts.ru:
Mammadgasan jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yemu 50 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychasprojivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Uje 11 let kak Mammadgasan zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u starshego brata kotoriy toje razvodit ovec. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Mammadgasan is married and has two children.  He is fifty years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  
 
Mammadgasan has been a shepherd and sheep breeder for eleven years.  He started this business with his brother who breeds sheep.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to increase the number of sheep he can sell.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Yahany Maribel

texts.es:
Yahany es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus 02 menores  hijos. Ella vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en una localidad urbana en el distrito de Tambogrande 

Yahany tiene dos clases de negocios, pues sus padres le han otorgado una parte de su casa para que ella pueda instalar cabinas de Internet para su alquiler y en otro lado de dicha casa, Yahany ha instalado un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios  para damas, cuenta con una año de experiencia en el negocio y ya ha  conseguido clientela fija.

Yahany esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300  nuevos soles para renovación de prendas de vestir aumentar su stock de temporada y por ende seguir creciendo en su negocio. Para ello viajará a la ciudad de Lima para la compra de mercadería en busca de las mejores ofertas.

Yahany es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Yahany is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her partner and two dependent children.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in an urban town in Tambogrande district. 

Yahany has two businesses.  Her parents gave her part of their house in which to set up Internet terminals for customers to use.  Elsewhere in the house, she has set up a small business selling ladies' clothes and accessories.  She has one year's experience in the business and has gained regular customers.

Yahany is requesting a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can renew the clothes she sells, increasing her seasonal stock and consequently growing her business.  In order to achieve this, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy merchandise, looking for the best offers.

Yahany is a hard-working, driven woman and the people who know her admire her desire to get ahead and make progress.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes

loans.name: Verónica Lucía

texts.es:
En San Miguel de los Bancos vive Verónica, una joven mujer de 24 años quien reside con sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad. Es soltera y trabaja sola para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y cerdos, con lo cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y cumplir con sus necesidades. Esta actividad la aprendió de su hermana quien tuvo la iniciativa de realizarla, a atravezado muchas dificultades, en una ocación una peste mató a los polllitos bebés obligandola a empeazr casi de cero. A pesar de las adversidades Verónica realiza su trabajo con mucho optimismo, enseña a sus hijos lo hermoso de la naturaleza. 

Su trabajo es criar pollos y cerdos para luego faenarlos y vender su carne, es un trabajo muy sacrificado. El poco tiempo que libre que tiene se dedica a las tareas del hogar y compartir con sus pequeños hijos. También le gusta practicar deportes y en si actividades al aire libre.

Verónica desea invertir, quiere comprar más pollitos y cerdos para incrementar sus ingresos. Por ello Verónica necesita un crédito, de esta manera estar un poquito más cerca de su sueño que es tener una casa propia con un espacio grande para sus animales.
texts.en:
Verónica lives in “San Miguel de los Bancos.”  She’s 24 years old and lives with her two young children, ages two and seven.  She’s single and works on her own to support her household.

She’s been raising pigs and chickens for the past four years and through this has been getting her children ahead and meeting their needs. She learned this activity from her sister who had the initiative.  She’s faced many difficulties.  On one occasion a plague killed all the chicks, forcing her to start almost from zero.  Despite these adversities, Verónica does her work with great optimism and teaches her children the beauty of nature.

Her work raising chickens and pigs and selling their meat requires lots of sacrifice.  She uses what little spare time she has to work on the household chores and spend time with her young children.  She also likes to play outdoor sports.

Verónica wants to buy more chickens and pigs in order to increase her income.  She needs a loan in order to be a little closer to her dream, which is to have her own home with a large space for her animals.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for two years. Amin requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her in building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for selling tea

loans.name: Floravelia

texts.en:
Floravelia is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Floravelia has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Floravelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Floravelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco, tiene 19 años y es socia hace 1 año.
Liliana tiene un Restaurante y una tienda, a su corta edad siempre se dedicó a trabajar, ella recuerda que su primer crédito lo utilizó para poder ir a Tambo y comprar verduras, ahora hará lo mismo con su préstamo, porque en tambo esta mas baratas las verduras, lo que desea es poder mejorar su tienda.
Las capacitaciones en su Banco Comunal le ayudan a poder administrar mejor su negocio y a ser mejor persona.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of 'Chacco' community bank.  She is 19 years old and has been a member for one year.

Liliana has a restaurant and a store.  At her young age, she has always worked.  She recalls that she used her first loan so that she could travel to Tambo to buy vegetables.  She will do the same thing with this loan because vegetables are cheaper in Tambo.  What she would like is to be able to improve her store.

The training sessions Liliana attends with her community bank help her to be able to better run her business and to be a better person.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in Tambo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married with four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alice owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting crops to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns PHP 13,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the costs of planting rice. Alice has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future Alice hopes to expand her rice farm and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for the costs of planting rice

loans.name: Elba Concepcion

texts.es:
Elba, es comerciante, vive con su esposo, cuatro hijos, ella tiene experiencia en el negocio D. la venta D. verduras, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado, también sale a venD. D. forma ambulante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. verduras frescas: papas, plátanos, zanahorias, pepinos, tomates y cebollas, la compra le permitirá mejorar, abastecer el negocio y brindar una mejor atención a los clientes.
El propósito D. Elba es mejorar y convertirse en una microempresaria, teniendo una buena cantidad D. clientes y mejorando cada día su nivel D. vida con la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Elba is a merchant. She lives with her husband and four children. She has experience in the business of selling vegetables. She has her business at the market. She also sells on an itinerant basis.

Elba is applying for this loan in order to purchase fresh vegetables: potatoes, bananas, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions. This will allow her to improve and supply her business and offer better service to her customers. Elba’s goal is to improve her microenterprise and become a business which has a lot of customers. Each day she wants to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a brother). Sarah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Sarah sells her products at the market, as retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling only wholesale and to own a delivery van. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a seamstress and also sells ladies bags and underwear at Besease near Elmina. She has been into sewing for ten years. She is married to a fisherman and has three children. Rose assists her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags and materials for sewing. Rose will use her new profit to get more machines for sewing.

loans.use: to purchase bags and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Yaneth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yaneth, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos, aprendió estos oficios a través de la educación de su madre trabajando diariamente en diversas actividades, con la intención de siempre mantener una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Ella por el momento solicita un préstamo ya que quiere comprar mariscos como pescado, calamar, Conchas, camarones, para fortalecer el negocio con ya que actualmente no tenía la disponibilidad para recibir nueva mercadería. Éste préstamo que ayudará para ofrecer a los clientes marisco fresco satisfaciendo la demanda.
La aspiración de ella es seguir en el negocio, buscando las alternativas necesarias para darle vida al comercio en su familia, y así ayudar a sus hijos y a su madre.
texts.en:
Yaneth works selling seafood, growing corn, and raising cattle.  She lives with her mother and her two children.  She learned these businesses from her mother while she was working everyday in various activities, with the intent of always having a source of income for her family.

She is currently requesting a loan as she wants to purchase seafood such as fish, squid, conchs, and shrimp to strengthen her business, as she currently doesn't have disposable income to receive new merchandise.  This loan will help her to offer fresh seafood for sale to her customers and meet demand.

Her aspirations are to continue in the business, searching for necessary alternatives to bring life to her family's business and so support her children and her mother.

loans.use: to buy fish, squid, conch, and shrimp.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She has five children. Jane started off her fruits business by planting passion vines, and after two years she began to harvest. She has been in the business for three years.  

She joined Milango to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase chicks for her new farming business. She looks forward to purchasing a vehicle, and she will use the extra income from this business to plant maize.

loans.use: To purchase chicks for her new farming business.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en: Otgonbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a chef in a local restaurant and his son is a school student. He started his furniture-making business in 1999. He makes his furniture at home and sells it at the market. His furniture is modern and highly qualified. Now that the holiday season is here, his product demand is increasing. Therefore, he needs to buy some efficient equipment and needs additional raw materials. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy equipment and raw materials.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Rosa Agripina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive por la comunidad Maluay, que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió y se caracteriza por la belleza de la naturaleza y su estructura arquitectónica que es una mezcla lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente labora en el comercio, cría de animales y en la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña Rosa tiene 55 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos que son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Rosa es costurera y labora en su casa, su especialidad es coser sacos y ternos de mujer, se encuentra en el negocio hace 17 años, este oficio lo aprendió trabajando. Como pasa en casa también se dedica a la cría de  borregos y cerdos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Maluay community bank.  She lives in Maluay, in El Valle parish, in Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area and it is noted for its natural beauty and its architecture which is a mixture of colonial and modern buildings.  The locals work in commerce, livestock raising and farming.  They also work in different business activities in the city.

Rosa is 55 years old, married, and has two grown-up children.  Her children work and help her financially.  Her husband is a farmer and they own their own home.

Rosa is a seamstress and she works from home.  Her specialty is sewing women's bags and suits.  She has been in this business for 17 years.  She learned the trade from working in it.  While she works from home, she also raises lambs and pigs.

Rosa has been a member of her community bank for three years and she will invest her new loan in buying building supplies to fix up her home.  Her goal is to finish repairing her home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low demand for clothes during the rainy season. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell her clothes in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32 year old who is married with 4 children. Agriculture is his business, though he is a teacher by profession. He keeps pigs and cattle and also grows pineapples. He got start-up capital from his salary as a teacher. Seasonal weather affects his business growth.

Joseph wishes to expand his business to new markets and to diversify his business. He wants a loan to buy animal feed and expand his plantation. He has a dream of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and expand his plantation.

loans.name: Gpf Medina Mounawara Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf medina mounawara" se compose de 18 femmes habitantes toutes le même village.Elles exploitent un champs collectif d'arachide à coté du village.En fin d'hivernage, la production est vendue aux grands commerçants et leur permet d'obtenir des revenus financiers assez inintéressants.Elles parviennent ainsi à prendre en charge les besoins vestimentaires de leurs enfants ainsi que leurs propres besoins.Le chef du groupe (en rouge, au milieu, entre les deux vaches),est mère de quatre enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Elle prend en charge leurs frais de scolarité et de santé avec les bénéfices tirés de l'exploitation du champs collectif et d'un petit commerce de denrées alimentaires qu'elle mène en saison sèche.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 990000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais afin de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The group "Gpf Medina Mounawara" is made up of 18 women who live in the same village.  They operate a collective peanut field near the village.  At the end of the rainy season, the produce is sold to large traders and provides rather significant financial income.  They are able to take care of clothing their children as well as their own personal needs. 
The leader of the group (pictured in red in the middle, between the two cows) is the mother of four children, two of whom are in primary school.  She takes care of their tuition and well-being with the income from the collective field and from a small food business she conducts in the dry season.  The group is seeking a loan of 990,000f to buy seeds and fertilizers to strengthen their business.

loans.use: acheter des semences et des engrais

loans.name: Fignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même village.
