C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Albertine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Albertine, âgée de 32 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Albertine est mariée à un couturier du nom de Boniface. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Albertine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, les charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Albertine  vend des mèches et des produits de beauté dans sa région depuis cinq ans. Albertine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Albertine sollicite, ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIGNON un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita B. is a 33 years old woman, married with two (2) children. She has been LAPO client for over 2 years. She lives in Benin City. She wishes that the above amount mentioned, come to her for business expansion.

loans.use: Sales of Provisions and drinks

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Running a pearl business is not an easy task for Naomi. Although she is having difficulty with her earnings she is not giving up, as she gets assistance from SPBD. The business helps her to earn money for her children’s future. She is working hard, with the help of her workers and also family support. Naomi is dependable and a successful mother, and a role model for other people who would want to be in the pearl business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase strings and pearls.

loans.name: Auk

texts.en: Auk P. is 32 years old and a mother of three children, who are students. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She operates her business by selling grocery products including Chinese noodles, instant noodle soup and porridge, at the local market. She usually makes about $5/day. Her husband works at a private company as a driver and contributes his salary to help support the family. P. needs the loan to purchase some grocery items and utensils for her business.  Eventually, P. hopes to own a stand so that she no longer has to spend money renting one.  She also wishes to be able to provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase some grocery products and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoes and material selling business

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Although living with her husband and one child, Ni Luh P. has to work extra to make a family living. Her husband's income as a laborer is not enough to cover daily expenses. Because every day mother P. has to spend Rp 15,000 (about US$1.60) for her child's school expenses, and daily family living. She bought one pig breeder with an initial capital of RP 700,000 (about $75), and within six month until this breeder produced 9 offsprings, which she sold for Rp175,000 (about $18) per baby offspring. For that she profited Rp 875,000 (about $90), that she used to support family living expenses needs, and little by little Luh P. used it to repair her house, although it is still in semi permanent phase.

Walaupun hanya tinggal bersama suami dan satu anaknya Ni Luh P. harus bekerja extra untuk menghidupi keluarganya. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh kasar dirasa kurang cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari., karena setiap harinya Ibu P. harus mengeluarkan biaya Rp. 15.000,- untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Dengan modal usaha Rp. 700.000,- Ibu Luh P. membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk untuk dipelihara dan dalam waktu enam bulan melahirkan 9 ekor anak yang laku dijual Rp. 175.000,- per ekor, sehingga dari hasil penjualan ini Luh P. memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp 875.000,- . keuntungan dari usahanya itu dipakainya untuk menunjang kebutuhan keluarganya dan sedikit demi sedikit Luh P. memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun sekarang masih dalam tahap semi permanent.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal Food

Membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina R. is married with two cute daughters. Her family of four lives in western Ukraine. Irina owns a bakery business located in the historic part of downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Despite the fact that her business location is very favorable and Irina could set high prices, she has decided to stick with a reasonable pricing policy. This approach, along with Irina’s passion for baking, has been a defining factor in the success of her sales.

Irina has been in this trade for 4 years. Her business has witnessed considerable growth since then. Today Irina’s working capital is about $8000 and her monthly income is about $1000-$1400. Her bakery business is now the main source of income for her family. Irina works hard to provide for all of their needs. She wants to see her business grow to guarantee her husband and kids a decent future. Irina is planning to open a small pastry factory and is already saving up to make her dream come true. Irina hopes this loan will assist in meeting her goals and achieving lasting success in business.

loans.use: Remodel vending facility

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en: Saidjon A. lives in Mastchokh, is married and has four children. He is an active Microinvest client. His first appeal to Microinveat was in 2004 and the loan permanently increased his wealth. Keeping the commercial services Saidjon requires another loan to build a barn for 20-30 cows. He also runs a rather successful supplementary business in the flour selling industry, which only increases his growing business potential.

loans.use: Build a barn for 20-30 cows

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati is a 37-year-old woman, who sells chickens to provide for her family's needs. She usually earns US$15.7 per day and earns a small profit. Her husband, A., has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to add to her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad is an eager and humble mother who, for many years, has dedicated herself to the sale of “chicharrónes” (pork rinds) and seasonal wares. Her trade allows her to provide an education and well-being for her young children. In the current season, she has decided to sell a variety of water-proof ponchos (capes) that provide protection from the rain. She brings her wholesale merchandise from the city of Juliaca and sells her products in an ambulatory manner through the busiest streets of her native town, Ayaviri. This business, which sees great demand, permits her to improve her standard of living and that of her family. For this reason, she wishes to expand her market and offer her products in neighboring towns. To seal her plan, she needs to obtain a loan to invest in the purchase of additional merchandise. “Natividad needs your generous heart to get ahead.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad es una afanosa y humilde madre, desde hace muchos años viene dedicándose a la venta de Chicharrón y artículos por campañas, oficios que le permiten brindar educación y bienestar a sus dos hijos menores. Ahora en esta temporada decidió ofrecer gran variedad de ponchos impermeables para la lluvia, mercadería que trae al por mayor de la ciudad de Juliaca y los ofrece en forma ambulatoria por las arterias más concurridas de su pueblo natal Ayaviri.Este negocio que está teniendo gran demanda le permite mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, es por esa razón que desea ampliar su mercado y para eso tiene pensado ofrecer sus productos en los diferentes pueblitos limítrofes de su ciudad, para concretar su proyecto requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que lo invertirá en adquirir más mercadería.“Natividad requiere de tu generoso corazón para salir adelante”

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a greater quantity of ponchos to take to neighboring towns.

loans.name: Ljubina

texts.en: Ljubina is from Srebrenica and she lives with her husband and their 2 children. Her husband works private as a constructor  and he earns about 1200 KM monthly. They have additional income by selling raspberries, blackberries and breeding poultry. Ljubina took this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy raspberry seedlings, streak and fertilizer for her raspberry acres in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying raspberry seedlings.

loans.name: Džemila

texts.en: Džemila, a 52-year- old mother of  three children, two daughters and one son, is from Gradačac. She and her husband, who is awaiting a pension, are involved in agriculture and fruit-growing. This is their third loan from MCO WWI in the amount of  $500, and Džemila will use it for cultivation and maintenance of her orchard.

loans.use: For cultivation and orchard maintenance.

loans.name: Minelva Elizabeth

texts.es:
Minelva is married and is the mother of two adult children, a son and daughter. For over 8 years, she has been in the hammock business. From a very young age, she learned the technique from her mother and with this income has been able to help her husband with the household expenses.

She requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy thread to make new hammocks. With your support, Minelva will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Minelva es casada y es madre de dos hijos, un hombre y una mujer. Tiene mas de 8 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy joven aprendió estas técnicas producto de la enseñanza que su mama le transmitió, y con estos ingresos puede apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para urdir hamacas nuevas. Con tu apoyo Minelva saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Thread

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong T. is 47 years old and has a small laundry business in a town in Siem Reap province, making about $3 a day. She is a widow and has four children, three who are employed and one who is a student.

Kong now is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a clean bathroom. This bathroom is not related to her business but it will give this family the dignity of a clean restroom. It will also benefit their health because hygiene and sanitation will not be a problem anymore

. (Mrs. T. was not available for a photo but her son is pictured above)

loans.use: To build a new bathroom

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en:
Faamanu F., 46, is married and has 3 children. She has many years of experience running a vegetable farm. She sells to the villagers and public 3 days per week.

She is requesting a loan to purchase tomato, round cabbage, and pumpkins seeds to plant on her farm. She plans to use some of the loan to purchase supplies, such as nails, galvanized iron, and cement for home repairs also.

She has repaid 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly profit will be 550 Tala (about 229 USD). SPBD loans are Faamanu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase barbed wire and seeds to increase produce to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Like many other family in rural areas of Vietnam, Mrs. T.'s income mainly come from breeding and planting. With a lot of experience in breeding cattle, but no capital, she was not able to achieve much success until joining TYM in 2001. Her breeding pigs project has achieved a lot of success in the last 7 years and she has been able to breed buffalo and cows as well. Currently, her four children are all grown up and have their own lives. Her husband is the main helper with the breeding now. With 4 million VND monthly income, she has never had any problem with repaying the loan. For this cycle, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest more into this project.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen , Kiva volunteer

Cũng như bao gia đình khác ở vùng nông thôn Việt Nam , thu nhập của gia đình chị Toàn chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Là người phụ nữ có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi nhưng đến năm 2001 gia đình chị mới có điều kiện để mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi nhờ được vay vốn từ Quỹ tình thương. Từ dự án chăn nuôi lợn đến nay qua 7 vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư để chăn nuôi thêm trâu và bò sinh sản. Dự án của gia đình chị ngày càng được mở rộng và phát triển vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng cao. Hiện nay 4 người con của gia đình chị đã lớn và đều có việc làm ổn định, chồng chị cũng là người hỗ trợ đắc lực cho chị trong việc chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Với thu nhập 4 triệu đồng/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ trong vòng vốn tới để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola A. is 42 years old and married with a child. She lives in Egbeda, Lagos State.

Ms. A. makes and sell beads to her customers. She's very industrious; she also sells bags and shoes. She often times organizes training workshops to teach young people how to make beads.

Ms. A. needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more materials for bead-making. She learned how to make beads for six months before setting up her own bead-making business in the year 2000. She says thank you

loans.use: To buy more materials for bead-making

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
Don Emigdio V. cuenta con 41 años, es casado tiene 3 hijo de menor, vive en pareja con la señora Nidia Romero. Con casa propia, el Señor cuenta totalmente con las comodidades básicas como para poder decir que le brinda excelente comodidad a su familia.

El señor se dedica a la carniceria hace mas de 10 años además posee ventas de mercaderias para la canasta familiar, su local comercial se encuentra situada en el barrio Crucecita de la ciudad de Pilar, entre Cerro Cora e/ Manuel Dominguez, dicho local es arrendado.

Además de esto el cliente se dedica a la ganaderia, cría, engorde y luego terminada lo comercializa en su local comercial. Esta en el ramo hace más de 10 años en esta actividad.El cliente gracias a su sacrificio pudo montar su negocio que siempre soño. El cliente posee la ayuda de su conyugue en su local comercial, es un negocio que hace varios años se encuentra en la zona y día a día sigue creciendo gracias al sacrificio que realiza la pareja.
texts.en:
Mr. Emigdio V. is 41 years old and married, with three small children. He lives with his wife, Mrs. Nidia romero. Emigdio owns his home, and counts on basic conveniences to make his family comfortable. Emigdio has been a butcher for 10 years, and sells merchandise for basic family needs. His rents a shop in the Crucecita neighborhood of the city of Pilar, between Cerro Cora and Manuel Dominguez. In addition to his butcher shop, Emigdio raises the animals that he butchers and sells. He has been raising animals for more than 10 years. Emigdio was able to start his business thanks to his own sacrifice, and the shop is always loud. He has the help of his wife, who also works in the butcher shop. This business started in the area some years ago and has grown day by day thanks to the sacrifice of this couple.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a breeding animal.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem T. is a villager in Kruos Village in the Takeo Province. Yoem T. is 26 years old and is the mother of three young children. She and her husband, Mr. Bun San, are farmers. Their field has become infertile and crop yields have diminished. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem T. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support the field.  Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria A. sells drinks to people in her community. She is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. Gloria is a LAPO client and hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mr. Seng L. lives in the village of Pdau Chum Koeut  in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. He is in the business of charging batteries. His wife, Mrs. Kai Eang, is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mr. Seng L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food to expand his wife's business. He hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Mr. Seng L. is 53-years-old and the father of two children who stay at home to do housework.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for his wife's pig breeding business.

loans.name: Ignacia Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora Ignacia R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios ofrecidos en su pulpería donde con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Una de las situaciones que ella está atravesando es que necesita el dinero para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de estos productos para la pulpería.
texts.en:
In León city Mrs. Ignacia R. sells various products in her general store where, with great effort, she has been able to provide for her family that so needs her support. One of the situations that she is confronting is that she needs money to buy products for her store and therefore she has sought the support from CEPRODEL to receive a loan that will enable her to buy these products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has sold charcoal and fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $45. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy food for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.

Mwajuma is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 12, 11, 9 and 6. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, fish and oil in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Comite Villa Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Villa Concepcion” se formó  gracias al deseo D. sus integrantes D. generar mas ingresos para sus hogares y ayudar al sustento D. la casa  , reciben un crédito promedio D. 800.000 y lo utilizaran para diversas opciones D. compra como ser: compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra D. ropas D. ocasión para la venta , compra-venta D. calzados , compra-venta D. productos cárnicos, compra-venta D. lácteos,compra-venta D. huevos etc, todas estas actividades según manifestaciones D. las señoras les ayudan a paliar D. alguna manera las diversas necesidades con que cuentan sus hogares , a la vez anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos.

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Margarita M. 	Vta D. ropas
Elsa C. D. Ruiz	Vta D.  productos  cárnicos                                                                                                                                       
MatilD. Velazquez	Vta D. mercería 
Atanacia F.	Vta D. comestibles
Lilian D. B.	Decoración
Ceferina M.	Vta D. comestibles
Maria Ilda M.	Vta D. art. D. limpieza  
Sinecia S.	Vta D. ropas
Nilsen G.	Vta D. postres
Inocencia D. C. 	Copetín
Maria Elsa C. 	Vta D. remedios
Faustina C.  	Vta D. ropas
Paola G. 	Vta D. comestibles
Norma C.	Manicurista
Nidia C.	Vta D. mercería 
Lorenza R.	Vta D. comestibles
Olga C.	Vta D. ropas
Gloria A.	Vta D. frutas y verduras

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, tea, oil, flour, bakery, meat, cassava, sweet potatoes, for later resale, purchase of ingredients for the manufacture and sale of foods such as: sausage, sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc, selling drinks such as soda, wine, beer, soft drinks, and ice cream, buy fabric for garments

loans.name: Cristian Nahum

texts.es: Cristián Nahum O. G. de 24 años de edad, reside en Colón departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposa y un hijo de cinco años de edad. A pesar de ser un hombre muy joven se destaca por ser una persona muy amable y responsable, el cuál se esfuerza por llevar el alimento a su hogar. Cristián anhela incrementar su negocio, de manera que pueda brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda invertir en su tienda, en la cuál se comercializan productos perecederos como galletas, golosinas, medicinas y jugos, entre otros productos y de esta manera obtener mayor clientela, ya que el posee la ventaja de tener su negocio en calle principal.
texts.en:
Cristián Nahum O. G. is 24 years of age and lives in Colón, La Libertad department, with his wife and 5 year old son. Despite being a very young man he stands out for being a very kind and responsible person who works hard to support his family. Cristián yearns to expand his business so that he can provide a better lifestyle for his family. This is why he is applying for a loan through which he can invest in his store, in which he sells perishable products like cookies, sweets, medicines and juices, among other products, and through this obtain more clients as he already has an advantage of having his buisness located the main street.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products for his store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Mrs. Delia C. is 51 years old, married, and a resident of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been an active member of the Paglaum Co-op for over three years. She engages in selling longanisa (processed meat), various other foods, and dealing dry goods. Delia has already availed several loans financed to her business. She started her business through a consignment basis. Her existing business really helps her to support her family, especially with the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase longanisa to sell

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Madame Magatte M. est une femme mariée  qui a l’âge moyenne de 49 ans, elle habite au quartier hersent de Thiès. Elle est commerçante de céréales locales, huile de palme et poissons sècs. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis sept ans avec ses propres fonds, et elle maîtrise bien ce secteur. Pour renforcer son activité elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC, et est à son premier prêt. Elle réalise un bon chiffre d’affaire qui lui permet de bien rembourser le crédit  du , et de participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Ms. Magatte M. is a married woman who is about 49 years old. She lives in the Hersent district of Thiès. She is a merchant of local grains, palm oil, and dried fish. She started this business seven years ago with her own funds. She has a very good command of this business sector. To bolster her business, she decided to join IMCEC, and she is now on her first loan. She has good sales figures that enable her to repay the loan and to help cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local grains, palm oil, and dried fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị, 53 years old, lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. T. owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing repair services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide repair services. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide repair services

loans.name: Test

texts.en: T.

loans.use: Test

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells weaves, hair extensions and hair cream. She is also a hairdresser. Fumilayo is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more weaves and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more weaves and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon S. lives with his wife and three small children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter is 14 years old and goes to a local school. The next daughter is just 6 years old and goes to a local kindergarten. His son is just 1 month old and stays with his mother at home.

Otgon has a small retail business in clothing. He started his clothing business in 2006 with capital of 150,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He frequently travels to Ereen, China, a border town from where many Chinese cheap products are imported, and buys cheap yet trendy clothes for women and men.

Since the start, Otgon has done well and his business capital has increased to 2,500,000 MNT. With the profit, he was able to purchase a small car for his family’s needs. In the future, he would like to expand his business by selling more diverse clothes for women and men. He requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's apparel

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is twenty-six  years old and a businessman. He is married and has one child, who is currently in school. William trades in jeans clothing for men, like pants, shorts, etc. He buys his jeans clothing at wholesale prices and sells at retail to his customers. William wants to use the loan to include the sale of ladies' jeans clothing so he can meet the demands of both men and women.  He hopes to use part of his profit to support his child in school and also to get his own store. William believes in his ability to achieve the full potential of his business once he increases his working capital by receiving the loan.

loans.use: To buy ladies jeans in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Jenny Luz

texts.es:
Jenny Luz  es una mujer dinámica y alegre, de 29 años de edad. Es madre soltera de un pequeño niño que es la luz de sus ojos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida de la región como son, Juanes (arroz envuelto en hoja), tacacho (plátano aplastado con manteca de chancho), pescado ahumado, de gaseosas. Ella vende afuera de un aserradero (ambulante).  También se dedica a la elaboración de carbón. Jenny es socia hace un año del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles.  En la actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de 1,200 soles. Jenny invertirá una parte de este dinero en gaseosas , productos como arroz, aceite, condimentos  y otra parte invertirá en madera para elaborar carbón.

La meta de Jenny Luz es tener un negocio de tortas y pasteles, porque en el lugar donde vive no hay otras personas que venden estos productos y le generaría mayor ingreso a su economía.  También quiere brindar a su hijo una buena educación .
texts.en:
Jenny Luz is a dynamic, cheerful 29 years old woman. She is the single mom of a young boy, who is the light of her eyes. She sells regional food such as “Juanes” (rice wrapped on leaf), “tacacho” (crushed bananas fried on pork fat), smoked fish and also soft drinks. In addition, she is dedicated to the manufacturing of charcoal.

Jenny has been a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Productivas” for a year. Her first loan was 300 soles. At the moment, she requires a 1,200 soles loan. Jenny will invest part of this money in soft drinks and products such as rice, olive oil and condiments. The rest of the money will be invested in wood for the charcoal production.

Jenny Luz’s goal is to have a pies and pastries business. Since where she lives there is no other person selling these products, this business would generate a bigger income. She also wants to provide her son a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food ingredients, beverages and wood.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 56 years old, married and has five children. She makes a living selling many different kinds of drinks, and has been in this business for a long time. She has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell, and extends her thanks to everyone at Kiva whose participation makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoung M., age 53 (shown in picture with her husband), and her husband Mr. Morn Korng, age 56, were married in 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, while one daughter is a garment factory worker and another one attends university. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phoung and her husband have been farming for 25 years. She now is requesting her first loan of $800 to use for the farm and to pay school fees for her daughters.

loans.use: To use for the farm and to pay school fees for her daughters.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Gemma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma raises pigs for sale. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baby pigs, feed, and necessary supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gemma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and supplies

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Efrena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling  different products like coffee,food for snacks,ice candy, soft drinks and other food product in the local community. Efrena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Efrena joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is 22 years old and happily married to Joaquin S., a local farmer in their village. They are blessed with only one daughter, named Jessabel, who is 3 years old.

She owns a small general store in her home that is open from 6:00 am to 8:30 pm. To set up her store, she needs a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase commodities to meet the needs of her customers. She plans to purchase soft drinks and canned goods.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request because it will be of great help to her business, and because through the additional commodities her income will also increase, which will become very beneficial for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities to sell

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea M. se dedica arduamente al negocio de venta de ropa la que atiende en el departamento de León en el mercado la Terminal ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque necesita invertir en la compra de la ropa para continuar comercializándola. Es importante destacar que ella inicia sus ventas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde todos los días por lo que es una dama muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Andrea M. is conscientiously dedicated to selling clothing in a stall located in the Terminal market in the department of León. She stocks all types of clothing for women, gentlemen and children. She has stood out for being very hard-working and for managing to improve her living conditions. She has called upon Ceprodel because she needs to invest in clothing to add to her stock. It is important to stress that she starts selling at 5am and continues on to 5pm every day; she is a very hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir R. is 26 years old. He is a young trader who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He uses his father’s car to go to the local farmers to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables and afterwards, takes them to the most crowded street of Imishli city to start selling them. He also has a place in the center bazaar, but he goes there every second day of the week. This type of business is very profitable and, at the same time, very hard. Samir wakes up at 5 a.m. to go to the local farmers and by 9 a.m. he usually begins his sales. He enjoys his work because he is very sociable. Samir is married and has three children. He works for welfare of his family and to improve their living conditions. He has applied for a 1600 AZN loan.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is thirty-nine. She is married and has two children who are both attending school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community where the major occupation is trading.

Georgina is a trader: she runs a provision store. She has her store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. 
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Miriam tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Nazarenas en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Miriam junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo. Miriam tiene proyectado implementar un restaurante.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del alquiler para el restaurante.
Los sueños de Miriam son educar a su hijo y que su nuevo negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Kallpanchik cooperative bank, which signifies “Our Strength” in quechua. Miriam is married, 24 years old, and has one child. She has a stall at the Las Nazarenas market where she sells vegetables, an activity she carries out every day. In addition, Miriam has a mototaxi with her husband, which he uses to work with. Miriam has plans to start a restaurant. She needs a loan of 1,050 Peruvian soles to invest into paying rent on a location for her restaurant. Miriam’s dreams are to educate her child and for her business to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay rent for a location for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis A. tiene 56 años, su estado civil es casado, y vive con su esposa y hijos.  Tiene 11 hijos de 15 a 33 años de edad.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Jorge es agricultor y siembra de febrero en adelante cada año.  Su zona es más maicera, pero siembra también trigo y cebada en pocas candidades para consumir.  Trabajar en el campo es duro y es dificil llegar a mantener la familia por la falta de dinero en la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para fertilizar los productos.  Vende las cosechas a los comerciantes y a un socio de la ciudad de Guayaquil para que las cargue por otros lados a vender.

Sus esperanzas en la vida son llegar a tener alimentación para toda la familia y que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, avancen, y compren su casa propia.

Los días domingo en los que no son laborables, Jorge Luis sale a jugar volei en la comunidad y comprar comida para la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis A. is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their children. He has 11 children from the ages of 15 to 33. He belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de la Orquideas", which is located about 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. The large part of the community are farmers and grow potatoes and corn as their principal crops.

Jorge is a farmer and grows crops from February onward every year. His region is best for corn, but he also sows wheat and barley in small quantities for his own consumption. Working in the field is hard, and it is difficult to maintain his family with the lack of money in agriculture. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers in order to fertilize the products. He sells the harvest to shopkeepers and a member from the city of Guayaquil so that he carries them to other sides to sell.

His hope in life is to have food for his entire family, and that all of his children are professionals, advance, and buy their own house. On Sundays that are not working days, Jorge Luis plays volleyball in the community and buys food for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yib

texts.en:
Mrs. Yib S., is a 45-year-old rice farmer earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ou Sitha, is 50. He produces and sells Khmer cakes, earning approximately $5 per day. They have five teenage children, two of whom are employed and the remaining three attend school. 

Yib S. always needs to pay money for a taxi to go anywhere because she does not have a vehicle for travelling. She wants to cut down on the taxi fares and decided to apply for a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL. She will buy a motorcycle to supply her transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes feria de la región en donde compra animales que luego vende en la feria de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Juana se dedica a la venta de pollos para recría.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de animales.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Urubamba Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. Juana travels to different fairs in the region to buys animals that she will sell later at the fair in Ayacucho. She also sells chickens to raise.

Juana needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy animals. Her dreams are to see her children become professionals and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro, la señora María M. se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como queso y crema siendo comercializados por ella misma a diario desde muy temprano en el mercado.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los lácteos como el queso y la crema para ofertarlo y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Iván Montenegro market, Señora María M. sells dairy products such as cheese and cream, which she prepares for sale herself early in the morning in the market.

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of dairy products such as cheese and cream so that she can offer them for sale and thus obtain income for the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and cream

loans.name: Munhchimeg

texts.en: Munhchimeg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her four children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her family lives together in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard. One of her child receives disability payments from the government. Currently, Munhchimeg operates a shoe repair business in her town. She has been operating her business since 2003, and she has gained much experience over the past years. Munhchimeg is a very hardworking businesswoman as well as a good mother to her four children and is working hard to create a bright future for her family. She has many plans for the future and says, "I would like to create my own workplace and a plot of land with a house and yard for my family. I would work hard to improve our family's standard of living." She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase necessary materials for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for shoe repair business

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La Sra.  ClotilD.     es casada  con 3  hijos,  dos   en edad escolar.
Ella  tiene un pequeño restaurant en el barrio Santa Ana, cuya venta es muy satisfactoria, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda D. su esposo  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esmero.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con   muchos  clientes en ascenso, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable D. buen carácter  con deseos D. superación   por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
texts.en:
ClotilD. is married and has three school aged children. She has a small eatery in the Santa Ana neighborhood; sales are satisfactory and they generate a good income. With help from her husband and the entire family they are moving ahead thanks to much sacrifice and dedication. Today she is a successful micro entrepreneur with a growing number of regular customers thanks to the good customer service she provides. She has shown herself to be a responsible, pleasant person who wants to succeed in life; for this reason, we must proviD. her with all necessary support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for the restaurant.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been in the quarry business for 25 years starting when he was young. He is 47 and married to Benta Auma. Richard has been able to take care of his family of six, including four school-going children, from the proceeds of his trade. 

Richard was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to rent another piece of land and become a large-scale supplier of the stones.

loans.use: To rent another quarry site

loans.name: Apolo

texts.en: Apolo Tuali S. is 20 and married with one child. She owns a business selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups) and has one year of experience in this business. Apolo needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 350 talas (approximately USD 140) per week, to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Apolo joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Venus lo integran Cristiana Argentina  M., Ligia P. Porras, Margarita M. y María Eugenia G. quienes empiezan a trabajar con Adim. La coordinadora del grupo es M. quien desde pequeña ha trabajado en la realización de comida, ya que su madre tiene una comideria la cual ella actualmente administra.

Esta joven de 23 años tiene muchas metas y sueños en el ámbito del negocio desea invertir en otros rubros como ropa y en ámbito personal estudiar una carrera técnica como secretariado ejecutivo según comento.

Las otras integrantes de grupo tienen diversos tipos de negocio P. vende prendas de plata y laminado de la marca zafiro, M. vende productos avon marca reconocida por sus productos y G. vende comidas y productos avon.
texts.en:
The members of the Venus group are: Cristiana Argentina M., Ligia P. Porras, Margarita M. & María Eugenia G. who are starting to work with Admin. The group coordinator is M. who has worked preparing food since she was a little girl because her mother has an eatery that she now runs. This 23-year-old young woman has many goals and dreams in the business world; she wants to get into other areas like clothing sales. She told us that in the personal area she wants to study a technical career like executive secretary. The other group members have different types of businesses. P. sells silver and lamínate products of the Zafiro brand and M. sells Avon products; G. sells prepared food and Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Mr. Saran K., pictured with his wife, is 41 years old and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun Khoem, is 42 years old. They live along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Saran and his wife are fishermen and farmers. They grow cucumber and wax gourd on their farmland in the village. Saran does not have a water pumping machine to spray his farm, so he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 US to buy a water pumping machine. He will also use a part of the loan to purchase a fishing net for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine to spray his farm and to buy a fishing net

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: María del Socorro F. M. de 56 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, lugar en el cual realiza parte de su trabajo, vive junto a su esposo de 66 años de edad quien le brinda su ayuda en la venta, y junto a cuatro hijos de 19,14, 8 y 6 años de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar en el que habitan. María se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, tales como jeans, camisas y blusas para dama, ella la comercializa en su hogar y así mismo día con día sale a venderla por diferentes puntos clave de Santa Tecla, entre los cuales están los parques y las afueras de mercado y zonas muy concurridas. Desde hace 4 años que ella trabaja junto a su esposo de esta manera y ambos se esfuerzan mucho por obtener mayores ganancias, así mismo cuentan con diferentes clientes los cuales les compran ropa con mucha frecuencia ya que ellos la comercializan a muy buenos precios los cuales son muy accesibles para la mayoría de personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar diferentes tallas de ropa, y de esta forma mejorar sus ventas y así mismo salir adelante junto a su familia, ya que esto lo que beneficia en primer lugar es a sus hijos, ya que le permite brindarles todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
María del Socorro F. Martinez is 56 years old and resides and works in Santa Tecla. She lives with her husband, who is 66 years old and helps with making sales. They have four children (ages 19, 14, 8, and 6) who attend the local schools. María sells clothing for men, women, and children such as jeans, shirts, and blouses. She sells her products from home and also at different locations throughout Santa Tecla such as parks, outside of the market entrances, and other places that experience heavy traffic. María and her husband have been in business for four years and are striving to earn more income. They have different types of customers who buy clothes from them on a frequent basis because they offer good prices that are affordable for most people.

María is requesting a loan so that she can buy different sizes of clothing. This will allow her to increase her sales and move her family forward. Most of all, her children will be the primary beneficiaries since she will be able to provide them everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in different sizes

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila, de 44 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 14 años vende ropa, de estilo casual como pantalones, casacas, chompas y demás prendas de vestir. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado populoso de su barrio, en un puesto pequeño que alquila, donde trata de acomodar vistosamente la variedad de sus prendas para su fácil venta, de ese modo dinamiza su negocio. Con el pasar de los años ha podido captar buena clientela; quienes le pagan al contado. Cuando se va de compras corre el riesgo de ser asaltada, pero eso no le desanima, ya que lo que más le gusta es el comercio.  En adelante, quiere comprarse su puesto y mejorar su negocio, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia. Es su veinteavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea contar con posteriores aportes. Petronila piensa invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de ropa, para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Petronilla, 44, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has been selling casual clothing, such as trousers, jackets, sweaters and other garments, for over 14 years. In the busy market of her neighborhood she runs her business from a small rented stall, where she displays the items attractively to attract sales and develop her business. Over the years she has managed to attract a good customer base, who all pay in cash. Selling comes with the risk of being robbed, but she does not find that discouraging as trading is what she likes the most. In future she wants to buy her own stall and improve her business so as to improve the quality of life of her whole family. This is her twentieth loan with MFP and she promises to make all payments on time as she would like to requests more loans in future. Petronila plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of clothing, in order to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam sells charcoal in Owino market seven days a week. She uses public transport to and from home but at times she must walk to her business when she is unable to raise enough money for transport. Prior to starting her charcoal business, she sold second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her primary business challenge is the transportation of bags of charcoal from Ndeeba to her stall in Owino market. She chose to join MCDT because they offered timely loans.

Mariam's husband is a radio mechanic. They have three children, all of whom attend school. She aspires toward educating her children up to university level so they can eventually find good jobs and have higher standards of living. The family lives in a rented one-roomed house in Najjanankumbi along the Entebbe road in the Lubaga division of Kampala District. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la administración de su propio restaurante donde prepara desayunos y almuerzos, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su local comprando sillas y mesas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas para mejorar su restaurante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “Capac Qoya”, which is located in the District of Coya in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Graciela is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and managing her own restaurant where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Graciela works from 6am until 7pm. She wants to improve her business by acquiring chairs and tables, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Graciela thanks everyone who has helped fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria T. is from the village of Malamag East. She is 59 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Gloria T.'.

Gloria is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chub

texts.en:
Mr. Chub S., 30, is married with two school-aged children at home in their small house, and he earns his living from fishing. Mr. Chub S. always rises early to prepare their tools and go to the middle of the river by boat to fish. Then Mr. Chub S. sells to the wholesaler at a reasonable price.

To help with the responsiblity of the family, his wife sells grocery products in front of her house. She has been running a grocery business for a long time and earns an average of $4 a day. Recently, some of the grocery items have been sold out from her stock and Mr. Chub S. wants to encourage his wife's business. So Mr. Chub S. is taking out this loan to increase his wife's inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: To increase his wife's inventory to continue selling.

loans.name: Nancy Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy G. es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, su gente, su cultura y tradiciones y es  la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador.
 
Doña Nancy tiene de 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 16 y 15 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive en su casa compartiendo gastos, la segunda  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su tercer hijo es un joven especial tiene parálisis cerebral. Su esposo es carpintero. Con el trabajo y esfuerzo  conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Nancy se dedica a la venta de viandas (lunch o comida), actividad que la realiza hace 6 años, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde y lo demás de su tiempo lo dedica a su hijo.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años, beneficiándose de los créditos en su hogar. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la elaboración de sus viandas.
 
Su sueño es que algún día su hijo pueda caminar y desearía realizarle el tratamiento con las células madres pero es muy costoso.
texts.en:
Mrs Nancy G. is a member of the Las Flores community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is known for the beauty of its historic center, its people, its culture and its traditions.  It is the third most important city in Ecuador.

Nancy is 45 years old.  She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 16 and 15.  Her first daughter is married and lives in her house sharing expenses.  The second daughter studies in a school in the city, her third -  a son – is a special young man who has cerebral palsy.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Through their work and effort, the family have managed to build their own home.

Nancy sells meals (lunches) which she has been doing for 6 years.  She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.  The rest of her time she devotes to her son.

She has been a member of the community bank for 4 years, using the loans to benefit her household.  Her new loan will be used to buy supplies to make her meals.

Her dream is that some day her son will be able to walk. She would like to be able to get him stem cell treatment but it is very expensive.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Esta clienta es trabajadora de la Alcaldía municipal de Chinandega y trabaja en el área de limpieza pública. Esta señora es casada y su familia depende en un 100 % de los ingresos del cliente por lo que su salario no le ajusta para realizar las mejoras necesarias en la vivienda por lo que esta solicitando el credito para mejorar la cocina y el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Concepción is employed by the City of Chinandega as a janitor.  She is married and her family is 100% dependent on her income.  There is not enough left over from her salary to make needed improvements to her home.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to repair the kitchen and the roof of her house.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair the roof & the kitchen

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a fifty-one-year-old ambitious man with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of the family, with a dream of being able to provide a minimal comfortable standard of living to each of his household members. Abdul is both a mechanic and a farmer  and has been working hard in these businesses for twenty-eight years now as they have made him realize incredible results. He needs the loan to pay labor for clearing his farmland and to buy onions seeds for planting.

loans.use: Paying labor for clearing his farmland and buying onions seeds for planting

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.en:
Wilberto A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 33 years old. Wilberto is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Wilberto owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal (motorbike transportation) services to local community members. Wilberto has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wilberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Wilberto is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wilberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue he generates to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Jovencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jovencia also plants and harvests vegetables that she sells at the market.

Jovencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovencia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and farm supplies

loans.name: Teva

texts.es: Teva tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de leche que extrae de sus vacas, ésta actividad le enseñó a sus 3 hijos, quienes también le apoyan en el ordeño de vaca todas las mañanas. Asimismo estos productos son llevados a vender a una compañía de productos lácteos, en donde le pagan buenas ganancias, permitiéndole así cubrir con los gastos de su familia. Es por ello que lo considera una actividad muy rentable ya que no necesita de suficiente capital para invertir, pues ella misma produce el alimento para sus animales. En adelante desea tener más vacas y otros animales para criar. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
texts.en:
Teva is 46 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.

Teva has been selling milk from her own cows her entire life.  She taught this business to her three children and they help her to milk the cows every morning.  Teva takes her products and sells them to a company that sells dairy products.  The company pay her very well which allows her to cover her family's expenses.  Teva considers her business to be a very profitable one.  She doesn't need to invest too much money in it because she produces the feed which she gives to her animals herself.  In the future, she would like to have more cows and other animals to raise.

This is Teva's first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.

Teva is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying some sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Rizalito

texts.en:
Rizalito D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Rizalito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizalito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods & toothpaste in the local community. He is also operating a coconut grinding services. Rizalito has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rizalito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rizalito is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rizalito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods

loans.name: Dieu Devant Saintesuzanne Group

texts.fr:
Irma est la coordinatrice de son groupe Dieu-Devant Saintesuzanne 1 & 2.

Elle est mariée et elle a 4 enfants. Irma habite dans la région Sainte-Suzanne d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Irma a dirigé son commerce de produits alimentaires pendant les 23 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Irma était couturière. Irma voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à tels produits comme du riz, de la sucre, de l’huile et du poids.

Irma espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à gagner beaucoup d’argent pour faire progresser le commerce et avoir une boutique.

Des autres membres Dieu-Devant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du gaz et autres.

Irma  dit que son défi principal est une manque de travail au sein de la communauté ce qui signifie que  les gens qui veulent acheter sur le marche n’ont pas de l’argent.  

Irma  dit que son but principal c’est de gagner beaucoup de l’argent pour faire l’ éducation de ses enfants. Son rêve c’est d’ouvrir une grande boutique a l’avenir.
texts.en:
Irma is the coordinator for her group called "Dieu-Devant Saintesuzanne" 1 & 2. (God First, Saint Suzanne). She is married and has four children. Irma lives in the Sainte-Suzanne region of Haiti where electricity is rare and the water supply is very limited. 

Irma has managed her business selling grocery items for 23 years. Before opening her food stall, Irma was a seamstress. She would like to use this loan to invest in such products as rice, sugar, oil, and peas. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn a lot of money so she can make the business grow and have a shop.

The other members of the 'Dieu-Devant" group need a loan for business ventures such as selling charcoal, bottled gas, etc. 

Irma  says that her main challenge is that members of her community are jobless and so when they want to buy something in the shops, they don't have any money. She says her main goal is to earn a lot of money so that she can educate her children. Her dream is to open up a big shop in future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and peas for her little food stall

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been engaged in crop farming and pig raising for the last seven years. He dreams of diversifying his crops and enlarging his plantations. He wants a loan to reconstruct his pig sty.

loans.use: To rebuild pig sty

loans.name: Ma. Lida

texts.en:
Ma. Lida is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Ma. Lida is borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Lida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia es cesante de Educación de primaria, y en la actualidad la socia se encuentra trabajando con la venta de productos de Salud, Omnilife; La socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para niños, la socia es una mujer alegre y junto a sus hermana trabajan juntas y comparten todos sus días y como nos comenta, le gusta reunirse con sus amigas en este grupo y siempre es grato verse y algunas ocasiones ellos se reúnen para cenar, la socia es una mujer que goza de un buen sentido del humor y se la encuantra siempre riendo y haciendo bromas; este banco comunal está integrado por socios disciplinados y llenos de mucho entusiasmo por la vida. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar sus productos y mercadería para vender. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar y abastecer su s negocios.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 65 years old and single.  She used to be an elementary school teacher and is currently working selling Omnilife health products.  She also buys and sells children's clothes.  Carmen is a cheerful woman and, together with her sister, she works and shares every day.  She tells us that she likes to meet with her friends in the community bank.  It is always nice to see each other and sometimes they get together to have supper.  Carmen is a woman with a good sense of humor and she is always laughing and joking.  The members of this community bank are all disciplined and full of zest for life.

Carmen would like a loan so that she can buy products and merchandise to sell.  She is requesting this loan to buy products and stock her businesses.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products and stock her businesses

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mr. L. is 56 years old, married, and has two children. They live in their own home in the village of Las Juntas in the Pacora district of the Lambayeque region of Peru. 

For the past 6 years, Mr. L. has dedicated himself to his business of raising and trading livestock. He raises his animals near his house in pens that are spacious and appropriately built. When the animals are fully-grown, he sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. He has built up a loyal client base in this market. Mr. L. learned this trade from his father, who provided him with significant experience and knowledge.

Mr. L. wishes to expand his business and plans to invest this loan in the purchase of more animals and balanced feed to fatten his livestock. He hopes that his animals will reach a better weight and size in less time so that he can sell them for a higher price at the market. He also plans to make repairs to his corrals. To achieve these goals, he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. 

Mr. L. is a hard-working and responsible man. He had received a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and had repaid it punctually. His greatest goal is to continue investing in his business so that he can use the income to pay for his family’s expenses and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase additional livestock and feed, and make repairs to his farmyard

loans.name: Jëf Jël Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JËF JËL est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MEDINA FALL2

Madame DIODIO D. (accroupie à droite de la photo avec une écharpe noir et levant le pouce) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison (des oranges, mandarines, mangues etc.)

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Jëf Jël is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They came together as kin and as neighbors.  The group is a member of the Medina Fall 2 "Banc Villageois" (village bank).

Ms. Diodio D. (pictured at right in the photo wearing a black scarf and giving a thumbs-up) is the group leader.  She is married and a mother of seven.  She also cares for five additional children entrusted to her by close friends and relatives.

She runs a small business selling seasonal fruit (oranges, mandarins, mangos, etc.).

With this new loan, she plans to increase her inventory in order to raise her profits.

Her ultimate goal is help cover her family’s financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family (in-laws).    

Sarah sells charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Sarah sells her products from home, at retail.  She also generates additional income through renting rooms and selling second-hand clothes.  

Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.   The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only.   Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal
