Adolfo is a very skilled baker because he learned the craft as a little boy from his father. What he most likes about the job is baking bread which he does with great care. He has had this occupation for 30 years and he considers the most difficult part having to get up so early in the morning every day since for him there is no such thing as weekends or holidays. For later in the future, he would like to set up a store to sell the bread that he himself bakes. This is his first loan with MFP and he doesn't want to fail to repay it for lack of money so he is willing to save day by day to repay it. Besides, he is very responsible and respectful toward the other members. With the one-thousand soles requested he will buy new baking sheets and stands for his bread and he will also get his oven repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
G. Tserendolgor is 49 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He and his wife have one daughter and she is 26 years old and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. G. owns a motorcycle which he uses as a taxi at the local market. Since his motorcycle is cheaper than a taxicab, those who are going home from the market with bags of stuff like to use his motorcycle. When he has more time, he also retails cattle skins and sheepskins. He purchases animal skins from the herder families and resells them at the market for a profit. G.'s wife makes traditional clothes at home. She is a talented sewer and has been making traditional clothes for locals for many years. G. says that he works hard with his wife to send some money for their only daughter who lives in the capital city. They want her to purchase her own piece of land where she can reside in the city. G. requests a loan to purchase more animal skins for his business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins to sell

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a wooden house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two daughters, aged 10 and 6, both attend a local secondary school while her husband operates a taxi service in town.

Ganchimeg operates a grocery shop near her home which she inherited from her mother. When the business began, her mother operated out of a small booth which was passed down to Ganchimeg. Since getting the business in 2002, Ganchimeg has successfully expanded it and grown it into a full shop. Now, she not only sells grocery items, but also coal and firewood which are used as fuels in order to heat her customers’ homes.

Currently Ganchimeg earns between 400,000 and 500,000 tugrugs (~280-350 USD) per month and attributes her business success to her good accounting skills.

Ganchimeg would like to keep expanding her shop in the future and is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of food supplies, coal and firewood for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of food supplies, coal and firewood

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata G. est couturière depuis 1980.Elle a 49 ans, elle habite dans la cite Apecsy a Yoff. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse d’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis juin 2000.Elle est marie et mère de 4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 19 et 28 ans. Elle a aussi 4 personnes à sa charge. En même temps Madame G. s’adonne au commerce d’habits confectionnes.
Elle a héritai l’activiste de couturière de ses parents, sa maman était une grande couturière et c’était presque un don chez elles. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est la satisfaction des clients de par son esprit créatif. C’est une grande styliste.  Elle a déjà rembourse 2 crédits dans l’institution. Maintenant elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus bazin, voile et aussi des garnitures pour la confection d’autres habits a vendre. Ainsi elle pourra renouveler son exposition. Les bénéfices réalises lui  permettent de maintenir et d’augmenter sa participation dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata G. has been a seamstress since 1980. She's 49 years old, and lives in Apecsy city in Yoff. She's been a member of the U-IMCEC savings group since June 2000. She's married and the mother of four children, age 19 to 28. She also has four persons to support. At the same time, Mrs. G. also sells clothing. She inherited this activity from her parents, her mother was a great seamstress and it's almost a gift to them. What she finds most interesting in her business is satisfying her clients through her creative mind. She's a great stylist.

She already repaid two loans from U-IMCEC and she's now seeking a loan to buy Bazin and veil fabrics, as well as accessories for other clothing she sells. This will enable her to renew her display. The profits enable her to maintain and increase her participation to the daily expenses.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the support of lenders, succeeds in supporting populations in revenue-generating activities, which promotes valuable socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Bazin and veil fabrics, and clothing accessories

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.es:
Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita junto a su esposo se dedican a la vende de chompas, bufandas, guantes, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria con un triciclo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Juliaca.
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Fortunita sueña con ampliar su casa y negocios.
texts.en:
Fortunita, 41, is a member of the Firmeza communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children. Together with her husband, Fortunita drives around in their three-wheeled vehicle selling jackets, mufflers and gloves; she gets her products in Juliaca. Fortunita needs a 2000 sol loan to buy jackets. Fortunita dreams with enlarging her home and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets.

loans.name: Maria Reveca

texts.es:
La Sra. María , tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin , Departamento de San Martin , la socia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de María II” , es casada ,  presenta estudios de secundaria completa  y tiene 04 hijos , 01  que aun estudia y depende de ella .

Maria, se dedica a la venta de Comidas Preparadas y lleva 10 años en el negocio, se encuentra ubicada en un puesto del Mercado Central, un lugar muy amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas,  es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida. Con su primer crédito de 500 Nuevos Soles, compró ingredientes para el preparado de sus comidas como, arroz en kilos, pollos en javas, plátanos en racimos, y parte del dinero lo invirtió en utensilios.  

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito  de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como, arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, plátanos , maduros en racimos y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marita como le dicen de cariño , se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es tener un Minimarket  y implementar su propia tienda de bebidas gasificadas , muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in the Tarapoto district, in the San Martin province in the San Martin department. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Flores de María II.” She is married, has completed her secondary education, and has 4 children, 1 who is still in school and dependent. Maria has been selling prepared meals from a place in the Central Market for 10 years. Her place is very large and is equipped to serve the customers who come daily. She tells us that she has very good sales each day; she is well-known, and is very welcoming to her customers. With her first loan of 500 Peruvian soles she bought ingredients to prepare her meals such as kilos of rice, crates of chicken, bunches of bananas and also utensils. Currently she will continue with the same business, and she is very content with the work she does every day. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic friendliness and charm. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chicken, bunches of ripe bananas and also some utensils, so that she can better serve her customers. Marita, as they refer to her fondly, feels full of life and has a strong desire to succeed. Her dream is to have a Minimarket, to set up her own well-equipped store selling soft drinks. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movimiento organization for helping her to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals

loans.name: Laura Fariñas Group

texts.en:
Laura F. is from the town of Tinang, Concepcion. She is 32 years old. Laura is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Laura is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a business venture selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal and home products to tourists and local community members. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laura joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Laura from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. (pictured above), age 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyhoeun Tep, age 35, have been married for fifteen years and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers outside of the city.

Soeun has been a barber for 10 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for 7 years. Soeun doesn’t have his own transportation, so he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Angel Edisson

texts.es:
Ángel M. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa atiende el local de repuestos ellos tienen 3 hijos de 19, 12, 5 años. 

Hace 13 años atrás el trabajo en un taller como mecánico automotriz pero lo pocos ingresos que tenia y  la frustrante idea de tener su propio taller mecánico le fueron de empuje para invertir sus pocos ahorros en repuestos para carros.

En la actualidad el tiene un taller con venta de repuestos y con los bueno ingresos que ha tenido en estos años ha contratado empleados para que le ayuden. Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para carros, como válvulas, inyectores, rulemanes etc. 

En el futuro quiere tener mas surtido su almacén y más empleados para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel M. is 45 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and receives all the basic services. His wife attends to their parts store. They have three children (ages 19, 12, and 5).

Ángel has been working at a repair shop as an auto mechanic for 13 years. He has always had the idea to open his own garage, but he has been frustrated by the fact that he has very little income. Therefore, he decided to invest his small savings in automobile parts.

He currently has an auto parts shop. Revenues have been so good in recent years that he has hired employees for help. With this loan he will buy auto parts such as valves, injectors, bearings, and other items. Later on, he wants to acquire more inventory for his store and hire more employees so that he can ensure his children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts such as valves, injectors, bearings, and other items

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia de l’association Tièssiri sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37  ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Goni, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
 Ces femmes se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de charbon de bois. Mama S., la présidente du groupe est un des éléments qui excelle beaucoup dans l’achat vente des céréales dans lequel elle est très sollicitée et appréciée.
Les femmes du groupe Lafia collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités.
 Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt, et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, Mama S. compte acheter, une grande quantité de céréales auprès des producteurs du village et  environs et revend sur place dans le village et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elle estime réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture,  la santé et l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Lafia Group of the Tièssiri association are married women with an average age of 37 years and 5 children on average. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Goni, in the subprefecture of Fana in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other due to familial and neighborly ties. They sell cereals and charcoal. Mama S., the president of the group, does well in the cereal business and is very well known and visited. The women of the Lafia group are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, so as to have constant financial support for their activities. They are requesting their fourth loan and all of their previous loans were repaid in full. With this new loan, Mama S. hopes to buy a large amount of cereals from growers in the village and nearby, which will be sold on-site in the village and in the surrounding marketplaces to a client base consisting of both men and women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. The profits will be used for food, health, and the business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta que significa Bella Flor en quechua.
Nicolasa es viuda, tiene 78 años, Nicolasa tiene una empresa D. confección D. prendas artesanales como bolsas, correas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. personas que le brindan el servicio D. bordado.
Nicolasa necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lanas.
Nicolasa sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliar sus mercados.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a member of the Sumacc Huaya (with means Beautiful Flower in Quechua) Communal Bank. She is a widow, 78 years old, and has an embroidery enterprise that makes artisan personal effects, including purses and belts. Her creations are done with the help of other persons who offer embroidery services. Nicolasa needs a loan of 3,000 sols which will be invested in buying different wools. Her dream is to better her business and expand her markets.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOOLS FOR EMBROIDERY TO MARKET

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 35 años, está casado con Edith de 30 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, todos ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en un lindo paraje de la ciudad de Tarma. Esta familia lucha por salir adelante por medio de la agricultura. Sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, por eso cuida continuamente sus cultivos, principalmente el de papa y arveja, que son los productos más comercializados en los mercados de su ciudad y de La Meced.
Es así que lleva 20 años en la agricultura, sembrando sobre sus terrenos propios y sobre terrenos  arrendados, paralelamente a esta actividad, cría animales vacuno, ovino y porcino, en donde su esposo estás a cargo de la crianza. De los frutos que comercializa recibe buenas ganancias que le permite vivir cómodamente con su familia, esto lo motiva a continuar sus labores diA.. Edgar aS. que le gusta labrar la tierra pensando en que algún día será de propiedad de sus hijos, además sabe que los productos naturales de esta zona continuarán creciendo. Su meta es comprar más terrenos para ampliar su siembra y aumentar su productividad, además de construir una casa en la ciudad e instalar una bodega. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y manifiesta que le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal porque lo incentivan al ahorro, además que encuentra personas que son merecedores de toda su confianza. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, costales de semilla de papa, además podrá pagar el alquiler de los terrenos en donde piensa sembrar esta campaña.
texts.en:
Edgar is 35 years old and is married to 30 year old Edith. They have two children and they all live in their own home in a beautiful area in the city of Tarma. They work hard to progress through their farming business. They know they all hard work is rewarded which is why Edgar is continuously taking care of their crops, primarily potatoes and peas, which are the most frequently sold crops in the city and the region of La Meced. He has worked for 20 years in agriculture, cultivating his own land as well as rented land; he also raises cattle, sheep and pigs. The fruits of his labor provide him with a good income to help his family live comfortably which motivates him in his daily work. He likes to work the land thinking that someday it will belong to his children; he also believes that the products of this area will continue to grow. His goal is to buy more land to expand his harvest and increase his productivity; he would also like to build a house in the city and put up a small store. This is his 6th loan through MFP and he enjoys work in groups because it encourages him to save. He also feels like he has found many people through the group who deserve his utmost confidence. With the $1050 he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer, potato seeds and pay the rent on the land he hopes to use this season.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, potato seeds and pay rent on land he will cultivate

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda T. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Nilda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nilda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala lives with her husband and children in Multan, Pakistan. She is a housewife who plays her role by taking care of her family, staying at home. Her husband operates a canteen in a school. He wants some more refreshment materials for his canteen. 

Ghazala has applied for a loan to financially support her husband in expanding his canteen business. She hopes that it will increase his income and their family will be able to have a better life, financially speaking.

loans.use: Purchase eatable items for canteen business

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat I. is 48 years old and lives with his family in Lchashen village, Sevan region. His family consists of his parents, his wife and their two daughters. Smbat graduated from a military academy in Russia, and for about five years he worked at the Hrazdan Humanities Institute as a lawyer. Now he works at a Hrazdan thermal power plant as a head assistant.

At the same time, he is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. His family helps him in his farm work. Smbat has cows and sheep at his farm. On his land, he is raising oats, which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. With his incomes, Smbat supports his family and pays for his daughters’ educations; they are studying at Yerevan Institutes.

Smbat is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and to do some sowing on his land. In the photo, you can see Smbat and his father.

loans.use: To buy some calves and to do some sowing on his land

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es: María Estela C. D. P. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es madre soltera, la cual ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales tienen 23, 17 y 15 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor trabaja, y los dos menores se dedica a estudiar. María posee un taller D. costura, el cual esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación ella elabora todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir como: blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos, así mismo elabora cortinas y cubrecamas. María realiza su trabajo por pedidos previos y debido a su trabajo tan bien elaborado y a todos los años D. experiencia que posee las personas confían mucho en el resultado D. su trabajo. Debido a que María es alguien quien siempre desea poder obtener más D. su trabajo ella también realiza ropa para niños, pijamas y boxers para hombres, los cuales comercializa en su casa y D. forma ambulante en diferentes mercados y departamento del país, todo con el deseo D. obtener ganancias extras para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar. María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar tela en diferentes colores y estampados y D. esta forma elaborar más mercadería.
texts.en:
María Estela C. D. P. is 45 years old and resides in Soyapango, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. She is a single mother who works very hard so that her three children (ages 23, 17, and 15) can get ahead. María considers them to be her greatest work. The two younger children are students. She has a sewing workshop located in her house where she makes different types of garments such as blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses. María also produces curtains and bedspreads. She receives her work through orders that are placed in advance. Since she has many years of experience and her work is well-crafted, María has earned the confidence of her customers. María is the type of person who wants to get more out of her work, so she also plans to start producing children’s clothing, pajamas, and men’s boxers. Her products are sold at home and also on the street at various markets and in different regions of the country. Everything she does is a result of her desire to earn extra income to meet all of her household expenses. María is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric in different colors and patterns so that she can produce more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de  46 años de edad,  es casada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la selva tropical ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia. Todo empezó cuando sus padres le obsequiaron una pequeña parcela, para que así trabajase y  cultive cacao y café, pero nunca pensó que le iba gustar tanto; una vez que cumplió la mayoría de edad, sus padres le dieron la independencia y desde luego que sus padres estaban pendientes del progreso de su hija. Hoy vende a los grandes mayoristas de su localidad, en donde le generan un margen de rentabilidad positivo con respecto a las ventas anteriores, de todas formas les agradece a sus padres por las buenas lecciones que lo brindaron. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo ayuden a trasladar su producto hacia los puntos de venta y a un precio competitivo. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su producción con la finalidad de que pueda obtener mayores ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas, además está contenta con su grupo comunal, ya que le otorga muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de prevenir cualquier evento que perjudique su producción.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 46 years old, is married and has three school-age children. They live together in the town of Santa Rosa, located in Ayacucho's tropical rainforest, where they have their own house. It all began when her parents gave her a small plot of land so she could work and grow cocoa and coffee, but she never thought that she would like it so much. Once she reached adulthood, her parents gave Alejandra her independence, and of course her parents were keeping an eye on their daughter's progress. Now she sells to the big wholesalers in her town, who give her a good profit margin with respect to her previous sales. At any rate, she is grateful to her parents for the good lessons they gave her. Alejandra generally receives help from her husband, but at harvest time she needs hired workers to help her get her products to the sales points and sell at a competitive price. Her future plans are to expand her production so that she can earn more income. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to continue paying on schedule. Besides, she is happy with her communal bank, as it gives her many benefits. Alejandra is thinking of investing the requested loan in maintenance for her cocoa fields, with the goal of preventing anything that could adversely affect their production.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of cocoa fields

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca, cliente que vive en la ciudad D. la paz, en la Zona D. Villa San Antonio Alto es casa alquilada, no cuenta con hijos dependientes ya que todos sus  hijos son mayores y tienen su profesión. Vive con su esposo el Señor Melitón que tiene como actividad el servicio D. gastronomía cuenta con 14 años D. experiencia en el negocio   se menciona que el crédito será invertido en la compra D. chompas del desaguadero y soleras D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz que están D. oferta por la época, la Sra.  Es muy trabajadora, su esposo le ayuda en su actividad le acompaña en lo viajes,  y ambos se hacen compañía, la  Sra. Cuenta que su orgullo es haber sacado a todos sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
The client, Francisca, lives in the city of La Paz in the Villa San Antonio Alto area. She lives in a rented house, and she has no dependent children. All of her children are adults and have their professions. She lives with her husband, Melitón. His activity is food service, and he has 14 years of experience in the business. She mentions that the loan will be used to buy sweaters from Desaguardero and sleeveless tops, which are on special for the season, from Santa Cruz. She is a very hard-worker. Her husband accompanies her on the trips, and they keep each other company. She says that she is proud to have gotten all of her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters

loans.name: We Believe God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “We Believe God” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Zainab F.. She is age thirty-five; she was born in Matotoka village about eight miles from Magburaka town, where she is currently living with her husband and five children. Her husband is a teacher; two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. 

For many years now, Zainab has been selling pepper and palm-oil. With this loan, she will buy pepper and palm-oil wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy pepper and palm-oil wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. S. sells dessert and groceries, earning an income of $5 per day. S.’s daughter is a security guard for a private company for an income of $2.50 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia B. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Sitio Kalubihan, Barangay Don Pedro, Bogo, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $283. 

Virgilia is now borrowing 18,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Virgilia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza  O. is 37-years old, married, and supports her family by operating a pig fattening business. She lives in Sitio Pasil, Barangay Punao, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts by working hard in her pig fattening business. She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.00.

Analiza  is now borrowing PHP 14000 so that she can purchase more pigs. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Analiza  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase new assets.

loans.name: Demberelsambuu

texts.en:
Demberelsambuu L. is 58 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment. His wife is a schoolteacher, while his older daughter is a university student and his youngest daughter attends a local high school. Demberelsambuu is a hardworking man.

Demberelsambuu operates a household furniture and products trading business in a local trade center that was newly opened. His daughter suggested that he run his own business; therefore, he decided to expand his daughter's business by selling a variety of furniture, lampshades and curtains. He started this business one and half year ago and was successful in his new business within a short time.

Demberelsambuu is requesting a 3,400,000 MNT loan to increase his product line and selection due to the upcoming holidays and celebrations in autumn.

loans.use: To increase his product line and selection

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun L., 32, is a professional tailor, making $3 USD each day. She lives in Takeo province. She is married and supports two children who live at home. Her husband, Man Kosal, makes approximately $4 USD a day, running a moto-taxi business. Soun L. would like a loan of $1,000 USD to make a new investment with her sister, selling used phones at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase used phones for resale

loans.name: Nafees' Group

texts.en:
Nafees lives in Multan, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its history and shrines. For many years, she has lived there in a two-room brick house in the area named Islampura.
 
She is 50 years old and married to M. S., who has a business of welding. He operates his shop in the market and provides welding (repairing of iron items) services to his clients. 

She is a working woman who supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the markets of Multan and sells to her local area clients and to her relative as well. She is well-known for her good variety of clothes.  

She has two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is 25 years old and has a business of selling sweetmeats. He left his education after 8th and started doing this work. Her other two children are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantities and fulfill the larger orders on time. 

She is a responsible client and this is her second loan application.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and electricity bills. 

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Bibi faces a major challenge in  competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking fat oil, and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking fat oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Rose Marilyn

texts.en: Rose Marilyn M. is from the village of Marannao. She is 38 years old. Rose Marilyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Rose Marilyn plants and harvests corn for sale. Rose Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2007, Rose Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rose Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rose Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rose Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Gloria is a widow and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately $125 a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Ozamis-San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 viven con ella en su casa propia, viven en una comunidad muy tranquil, doña Sonia inicio vendiendo zapatos ya que ese negocio le eredo su familia desde que tenia 15 años despues paso a un salon de belleza y daba clases en un colegio privado, tambien tubo una tienda pero la cerro ya que le era mas conveniente viajar a la frontera y comprar productos mexicanos, actual mente vende zapatos los fines de semana en el mercado de su comunidad, Sonia esta solicitando un credito a Fape ya que ella tiene muchos pedidos en esta temporada del año, porque con la mercaderia que tiene no le es suficiente ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en: Sonia Elizabeth is married.  She has three children, two of whom live with her in her own home.  They live in a very quiet community.  Sonia started out selling shoes as she inherited that business from her family when she was 15 years old.  She later set up a beauty salon and gave classes in a private school.  Sonia also had a store but she closed it because it was more convenient to travel to the border with Mexico and buy Mexican products.  She currently sells shoes on a weekend in her local market.  Sonia is requesting a loan from FAPE because she has a lot of orders this season but doesn't have enough merchandise to fill her orders.

loans.use: To buy footwear wholesale

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her beauty salon business.  She is 37 years old and married to N. M., who is a security guard earning a low income.  Farzana started a beauty salon business to financially support her husband. Now her business is well established and she has a good number of clients in her community. She lives with her family in a city Gujranwala which is located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its rice industry. Her home is located in Kalar Abadi which is a small residential area of the city and contains 2 rooms.  She is the mother of 4 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education except the youngest one who is only 3 years old. 

Farzana started this business 11 years ago and she is confident that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business. She will invest the loan in buying beauty products like facial creams, mascaras, eye shadows etc.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always attended every meeting and paid her installments on timely basis. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for a beauty salon business

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a married woman who lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  tailoring and a general store business.  Her husband Francisco, who is 66 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 12 children who are between 11 and 41 years old. Purita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 27 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Purita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 28th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, to buy materials and equipment for tailoring and stock for her store so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and to get a better job. Purita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http//www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for sewing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en la Republica de Argentina, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina industrial recta y el saldo comprar materia prima como ser telas, hilos, etc., para empezar a trabajar en Bolivia. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia en Argentina, parte del tiempo y también tiene una casa propia en la zona Villa Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.  Es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Señora Elizabeth earns her living making garments in the Republic of Argentina.  She needs the loan to purchase an industrial upright sewing machine.  The balance of the loan will be used to purchase raw materials like fabrics, thread etc. so that she can start working in Bolivia. This business is the only source of income that she has to cover her family's expenses.  She lives in her own home in Argentina part of the time, and she also has her own home in the Villa Los Andes nieghborhood in the city of El Alto in Bolivia.  She is a widow and has three children.  This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial upright sewing machine.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Bethlehem. He is single and lives with his family. Ahmed applied to run one of the cafeterias of Bethlehem University and was accepted.

In order for Ahmed to run the cafeteria he had to pay fees so he took out a loan from FATEN. This job will help Ahmed start saving and be independent from his parents.

Ahmed is photographed here in front of FATEN's branch office.

loans.use: to pay fees to Bethlehem University to run its cafeteria.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es comerciante y tiene un puesto de venta de Cd`s y venta de ropa ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciuada de El Alto; su esposo le ayuda con esta actividad; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de CD`s y DVD`s para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, de esta manera cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona 16 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto,  es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La señora se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos  que se le otorgaron y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Maria is a merchant, and she has a stand where she sells CD’s and clothes.  The business is located in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.  Her husband helps her with this business activity.  

She needs the loan to by CD’s and DVD’s in order to be able to offer them to her customers.  This is the way they cover the family’s expenses.

They live in her mother and father in-law’s house, which is in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.  She is married and has four children.  

She is very happy with the loans that have been granted, and this is the second time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy CD's and DVD's to sell at her stand in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas de alpaca, ella teje las chompas y luego lo reparte en las diferentes tiendas que venden chompas, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chompas de alpaca. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Isabel divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling sweaters made of alpaca wool. She knits the sweaters and later distributes them to different stores for resale. Isabel wants to expand her business of selling sweaters, so she is requesting a loan to buy alpaca wool in bulk.

Isabel is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool in bulk for making sweaters.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: La señora Mayra R. es originaria del poblado de mina el limón en León, es casada y tiene 3 hijos estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. Ella es maestra jubilada y se dedica a la actividad comercial donde vende refrescos, ropa y reposterías actividad que tiene 10 años de ejercerla. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito porque requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que ha estado muy dañada, para ello solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para comprar cemento, bloques, zinc y perlines para iniciar a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Ella es una dama muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy comprometida con el bienestar de su familia por lo que espera que su crédito le sea proporcionado y así mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en: Ms. Mayra R. lives in Mina el Limón.  She is married and has three children who are studying in local schools.  She is a retired teacher, and for the last ten years she has been selling soft drinks, clothes, and sweets in front of the school. Currently, she is seeking a loan because she wants to improve the conditinos of her home, which is in great disrepair. She wants to buy cement, blocks, zinc, and beams to begin the improvements. She is a very hardworking woman and above all is very committed to the well-being of her family. For this reason she hopes that she receives her loan and thus can improve her home as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, breeze blocks, zinc, iron, and wire.

loans.name: Elmina Silvestre

texts.pt:
Elmina Silvestre nasceu em Maputo Distrito de Marracuene, sul de Mocambique é solteira e mãe de um filho ja empregado. Fez a 6ª classe, teve que interroper devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Marracuene enviando lhes uma sexta básica no valor de 1000.00mt mensalmente.
	
Elmina saiu de Marracuene para Namaacha, alegando que ia estudar, fica grávida e interrompe os estudos.Começa a fazer mukero(venda de produtos cantra bandiada )  na Fronteira da Swazilândia, Com o fundo colectado, consegue construir uma barraca na sua residência onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade, (arroz, açucar feijao, amendoim e mais) tem receita mensal de 4.000.00mt e consegue poupar  1.000.00mt  mensalmente.

 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves da sua vizinha que e cliente desta instituição.Este é o quarto empréstimo de Elmina na Hluvuku e Kiva para comprar mercadoria aumentando assim a quantidade. Os empréstimos anteriores foram todos de 10.000.00mt para o comércio.

 Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo porque com a mudança da barraca tera mais aceitação. Futuramente pretente adiquirir mais empréstimo e construir uma loja grande.
texts.en:
Elmina Silvestre was born in Maputo in the district of Marracuene in southern Mozambique.  She is single and the mother of one son who is already an adult.  She finished through the sixth grade and did not complete more school because she became pregnant. She lives in her own home and is also responsible financially for her parents, who live in Marracuene.  She sends them 1000 meticals every month.

Elmina left Marracuenefor Namaacha to go to school, but she got pregnant, which interrupted her studies.  She began to sell contraband products on the border with Swaziland.  With the money she mande, she managed to construct a stand in her home where she sells basic goods (rice, sugar, beans, peanuts, and more).  She makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticals and saves 1,000 meticals a month.

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is a client of the institution.  This is Elmina’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and Kiva to buy merchandise to increase her inventory.  Her previous loans were all in the amount of 10,000 meticais.

She is confident that she is going to make her payments before they are due.  In the future, she is planning to acquire more loans because if she moves to a larger stand, she will have more business.  In the future, she hopes to acquire another loan to construct a large store.

loans.use: To buy products (rice, beans, peanuts, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Zinunula Omunaku Women's Group

texts.en: Teddy, runs her 20-year-old food sales business at a stall in Kayunga food market. The mother of four, she also does some farming. Most of the foods she sells are harvested from her own garden. She sells mostly bananas and cassavas. Weekly she says her sales revenue totals shillings 40,000. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase additional bananas and cassavas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and cassavas to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Janet vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y su única hija. Janet es contadora pública y tiene su propio estudio contable. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Janet was born in the city of Cusco (Peru), and she is 31 years old.  Janet currently lives in the city where she was born with her husband and their only daughter.  Janet is a public accountant, and she has her own accounting office.

She has had this business for eight years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Janet needs a loan to buy work materials and some other things.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that her colleagues invited her to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy work materials and other things.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is 73 years old, married to Nancy, and supports a family of four people. He owns a farm in Mutwot location in Kapsabet town and has been raising livestock for a period of 40 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Barnaba has borrowed KES. 50,000 as his third loan after repaying previous loans successfully. He hopes to use the money to purchase a dairy cow and dairy feed. The profits will be used to build rental houses on his plot of land. He hopes to live a happy life and increase the number of livestock in his farm.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and dairy feed

loans.name: El Pedregal De San Jorge (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal De San Jorge.
 
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos  pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Enma, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 16 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganarse algo por sus propios medios se dedica a preparar y vender comida. Ella prepara bocadillos y platos para fiestas, además de pastelillos, morcillas rellenas, bollos entre otros platos y bocadillos deliciosos, todo lo que ella prepara es bajo pedido, nos cuenta que todas las semanas tiene pedidos y que trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana, viene realizando esta actividad ya por seis años y que le va muy bien ya que sus platos son los mejores asegura.
 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "El Pedregal de San Jorge" community bank meet in San Jorge, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is a group of people who decided to come together and form a loan group which would be very helpful as they can use the loans to improve their small businesses.  They work in a range of different business activities such as farming, general commerce, services, etc.
 
Here we meet 43 year-old Enma who is married and has three children aged 17, 16 and 3.  Her two eldest are in high school.

Enma is a very good housewife who, in order to make some money herself, prepares and sells food.  She makes sandwiches and dishes for parties.  She also makes 'pastelillos' (similar to empanadas), 'morcillas rellenas' (blood sausage), bread rolls and other delicious dishes and sandwiches.  She makes all her food to order.  She tells us that she has orders every week and she works the three last days of every week.  She has been in this business for six years and things are going very well as she assures us that her dishes are the best.

Enma will use this loan to buy food products to prepare her delicious dishes.  This is her first loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because the loans are disbursed quickly.

Enma's dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Agil

texts.ru:
Agil jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Agil 40 let.
 On uje 7 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsy v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chotibi pochinit yeyo. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata kotoriy toje rabotayet taxistom.
texts.en:
Agil is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  Agil is 40 years old.

He has been a taxi driver for seven years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts for his taxi and repair it.  He started this business with his older brother who also drives a taxi.

loans.use: to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children: two attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the month of April and May the availability of coconuts is lower in supply compared to demand. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.en:
Nurjamal, 53, is a resident of Tup, a nice village in the western part of Kyrgyzstan. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she has raised three sons and a daughter. The two older sons are employed, the daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the youngest son is at school. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 20000 soms, Nurjamal built a store and started to sell groceries. She earns about 5000 soms per month. This profit has made it possible for her to purchase household appliances to improve the family’s living conditions. She applied for the loan because she needs to purchase more goods for trade. The loan will  be used to purchase sugar (500 kg), oil (200 liters) and other goods. Nurjamal hopes that the loan will help her to increase business turnover. In the future she wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old, married, with two children. His monthly income is KES.5,000. He has been a farmer for the past ten years. Farming is doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.


He learned about KADET through one of their advertisement. This is his first loan with KADET which he plans to use to buy farm supplies.

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plough back into the farm. He has never taken another loan from any MFI. He is an honest man who strives to achieve, if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en el  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de carne de cordero y alpaca, tiene un puesto en el mercado de la zonas, trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará siete animales para luego carnearlos, los compra en las feria de Acora, Ilave, Zepita.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.
La señora desea seguir y mejorar el negocio para dar estudios a sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the "Central Vaqueria" Communal Bank, located in the Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 46, and a single mother of six. She has a third-grade education.
Justina sells lamb and alpaca meat and has a stall in the local market. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was 500 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business.
With this new loan of 1,000 nuevo soles, she will purchase seven animals to butcher later. She will buy them from the Acora, Llave and Zepita markets.
Her children help her with the business.
She wants to keep up her business and improve it in order to provide her children with an education.
What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings, the ease of acquiring a loan, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy seven animals to butcher.

loans.name: Anamely

texts.es:
La señora anamely cuenta con 33 años de edad, está casada con el señor Juan, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Wendy, América y estefany, de las cuales las tres estudian, dos están en segundo y cuarto año de primaria y la más pequeña esta en tercer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo, desde hacen 8 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas catálogos, labiales, rubores, cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, etc. Y así contar con un mejor surtido de productos.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña Ana (ya que así le dicen en su familia) es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio. “GRACIAS”
texts.en:
Anamely is 33 years old and married to Juan.  The couple have three children: Wendy, América and Estefany.  All three girls are in school.  The two eldest are in the second and fourth year of elementary school and the youngest is in the third year of pre-school.  

Anamely's business is selling perfume and cosmetics through a catalog.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She tells us that she decided to start out in this business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband a little and to support their children with their education so that they can enjoy a better future.  She also wanted to be in a very good financial position.

Anamely invested the loan that she received in buying more catalogs, lipsticks, blusher, creams, perfume, deodorants, etc.  This gave her a better selection of products.  Ana (as her family call her) says that one of her dreams is to grow her business much further and to provide an excellent service so that she can gain more customers and make more and better income.  She says that this is the best support that she could have been given because, as a result, she now enjoys a better quality of life and has a good business.  "THANK YOU".

loans.use: to buy more catalogs, lipsticks, blusher, creams, perfume, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old, married  to Makau, and they have seven children. She has been selling both new and old second-hand handbags for the last five years, and with a monthly profit of KES 10,000.  


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a registered client of KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more stock of new and second-hand bags for sale.

With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children. In future she plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new and second-hand bags for sale.

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru: Бахри вдова и у неё один ребенок. Она трудолюбивая и четная женщина. Более 10 лет Бахри занимается продажей продукты питания. Она имеет собственный магазинчик возле своего дома, и имеет много постоянных клиентов, которые живут в её махалле. В неделю два раза она ездит за товарами в город и покупает хорошие свежие продукты питания. Кроме того в свободное время она вместе с соседками шьет киргизские ковры. Основные покупатели ковров является жители сельских местностей, которые собираются проводить свадебную церемонию. А также она занимается откормом овца дома. Бахри хотела бы получит займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки товаров для магазина и приобретение шерсти для шитья ковров. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Bahri is a widow and has one child.  She is a hardworking and honest woman.  Bahri has been involved in sales of food products for over 10 years.  She has her own store near her house and has many loyal customers, who lives in her mahalla.  Twice per week, she travels to the city to buy products and buys good, fresh food products.  Besides this, in her free time, she and her neighbors make Kyrgyz rugs.  Local rural-area residents, who plan to hold wedding ceremonies, are the main customers for the rugs.  Bahri is also involved in fattening up sheep at home.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2000 Somoni to buy products for the store and wool for making rugs.  She thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase food products for the store and wool for making rugs

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Juana Luz; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia sigue en su negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria gallinas,chanchos y cuyes ella los hace engordar y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Chinchero,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y también para comprar animales como pollos,cuyes y chanchos mal por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
46-year old Sra. Juana Luz is married and has two children. She continues to raise animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. Once they are fattened, she sells them in the Chinchero market. With the income from her business she is helping her children get ahead. 

Now Juana wants to expand and improve the business so she is seeking a loan to buy animal feed and also to buy animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs at wholesale prices. She is happy to have the opportunity to get a loan and promises to pay back the money.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and young animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a single parent and has six dependents. She has been selling cloth and cosmetics at Kwahinkrom for the past 12 years now. Esi uses her income to provide for her children. She will use her loan to buy more cloth and cosmetics for sale. Esi has planned to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics and cloth for sale.

loans.name: Gerturde

texts.en: Gerturde is 41 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 22. She sells items such as salt, sugar, and cooking oil in a store she has run for ten years. Gerturde would like a loan to buy more salt, sugar,cooking oil and other new items to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To add more items in his store such as salt, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Patricia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3  años y un bebe de 3 meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de madera.
 
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual puso  hace poco  con la ayuda del crédito que recibió de la institución, allí vende de todo un poco, aunque reconoce que aún le falta mucho para poder surtir por completo su tienda es por eso que solicito un nuevo crédito para lograr compra mas mercadería para darle a sus clientes lo que necesitan y así tener mas clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Tiene recién cuatro meses con su negocio y le gusta ya que se gana algo sin tener que descuidar su hogar y a sus hijos que necesitan muchos cuidados.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 2 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the “Camino Al Progreso” communal bank meet in Montecristi every two weeks.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally known arts.  This is the area of the famous straw hats.

Patricia lives here.  She’s 21 years old, in a live in relationship, and has two children, ages 3 years, and 3 months.  Her husband works at a sawmill.

She has a small food store in her home, which she started a short time ago with the help of a loan she got though the institution.  There she sells a little bit of everything, although she recognizes that she still has a long way to go before she has a full assortment.  It’s for this that she requested a new loan, so that she can buy more merchandise to be able to offer her customers what they need and attract new ones.

She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.  Her business is only four months old and she likes that she earns something without having to neglect her home or her children who need lots of care.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her store by buying rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and other primary need products.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because she’s made friends in the group.  Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and to grow more each day.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 72 años de edad es una mujer casada que tuvo 7 hijos y que ahora se encuentran en las edades de 36 a 54 años. Ella vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde tiene una tienda llamada la económica, que hace honor a su nombre por los precios de venta que estima para sus productos, sin ella perder dinero. Su clientela está ubicada en su barrio y son familias que viven también en los aledaños a su negocio, donde ofrece ranchos, víveres y bebidas, al detalle.  Antonia conoce muy bien el negocio, pues sabe que cuando compra en mayor volumen, obtiene más ganancias que cuando lo hace poco a poco. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ranchos, víveres y licores, en  mayor volumen para ganar descuentos que trasladará a sus clientes, para tenerlos contentos y  que le sigan comprando, mientras  ella respondiéndole y gana dinero, lo cual le proporciona a ella y a su familia cada vez mas bienestar.  Ella obtuvo su experiencia comercial de manera independiente,  cuando emprendió una cafetería en la que le fue muy bien, la amplió diversificando, hasta convertirla en la tienda actual. En la actualidad ha recibido 6 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual tiene 12 años de estar vinculada, desde cuando ingresó en un grupo solidario y esta es la organización  con la cual quiere seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Antonia, 72 years of age, is a married woman who had 7 children that are now ages 36 to 54.  She lives in the city of Cartagena, where she has a store called “The Thrifty One”.  Its name honors the low prices at which she offers her products, while still making a profit for herself.

Her customers live in her neighborhood and areas near her business, where she offers food, supplies and beverages at retail.  Antonia knows her business very well since she knows that, when she buys in bulk volumes, she makes a better profit than when buying supplies little by little.  This is the reason she turns to Kiva credit, as it will allow her to buy products in larger quantities and therefore at discounts that she can then pass along to her customers.  She wants them to be happy and to continue to buy from her.  In the meantime, she earns money that helps her provide for her family.

She obtained her experience in commerce independently, after starting a cafeteria that did really well.  She continued diversifying, and it became the current store.
