To date, she has received 6 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has been part of for 12 years.  She started when she enrolled in an independent group, and this is the organization with which she wants to continue to grow.

loans.use: buy food, supplies and beverages.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  Ofelia requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.  She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mapitch

texts.en:
Mapitch is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Mapitch has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mapitch hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jhenny

texts.es: La señorita Jhenny terminó sus estudios, es soltera y radica en Patacamaya, vive con sus papás comparte un cuarto con sus hermanos, desde muy niña empezó a trabajar en tiendas vendiendo dulces y abarrotes y en restaurantes como ayudante de cocina  y siempre quiso independizarse y ayudar a su familia, pues también dedicaba medio tiempo para estudiar en el colegio, viendo las ganas de superación sus papás le heredaron una parcela de terreno para sembrar papa, zanahoria haba y otros productos y así fue que gano experiencia en esta actividad, con la ayuda de sus hermanos y padre ella vende los productos en la ciudad de La Paz, el Alto y Patacamaya, como no tiene mucho recursos económicos acude a solicitar este crédito para comprar un ganado ya que sus papás están dispuestos a colaborarle en la crianza de ganado y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, también la señorita Jhenny tiene como meta Estudiar en la Universidad pública Mayor de San Andrés en la carrera de Técnico Superior en Agronomía.
texts.en: Jhenny finished her studies, is single and lives in Patacamaya. She lives with her parents and shares a room with her siblings. Since she was a little girl, she worked in stores selling sweets and groceries and in restaurants as a kitchen aid and has always wanted to be independent and help her family. She also dedicated half of her time to studying at school. Seeing her drive to overcome, her parents gave her a parcel of their land to sow potatoes, carrots, beans and other products. That is how she gained experience in this business. With the help of her siblings and father, she sells her goods in the city of La Paz, el Alto and Patacamaya. Since she does not have a lot of financial resources, she is resorting to requesting a loan to buy a head of cattle. Her parents are ready to collaborate in livestock raising and in this way improve their income. Jhenny also has the goal to study agronomy in the public university Mayor de San Andrés.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гульнура, 35 лет, замужем, есть сын. Образование у Гульнуры высшее. Она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав почти с нуля около 10 лет назад, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гульнуры есть 5 коров, 25 овец, 6 лошадей. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 21,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is a 49 years old woman who has nine (9) children and she acquires the formal knowledge of this business for 6 months. She resides at Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The amount she requested above it to help her improved on her business.

loans.use:
To buy additional sewing machine and  clothes for 
Sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a young bull.

loans.name: A.m.

texts.en:
A.M. started his business on a very small scale in 2003 by selling general goods from a stall in the local market.  In 2005 he joined SMT and with his first two loans was able to eventually build his own small store. Additional working capital will help him increase his inventory and improve stock rotation time.

A.M. is married with 5 children, some of who help out at the store after school.

loans.use: Purchase general merchandise stock (plastic wear, sundries, kitchen utensils, etc.)  to increase the variety of goods offered in his store, thus attracting more customers.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana J. S. owns a general store in Magdalena, a community in the Dominican Republic with strong cultural ties to Haiti. Mariana, like most of Magdalena's residents, is of Haitian ancestry; her family immigrated several generations ago in hope of a better future. Mariana sells bread, canned fish, candy, and other edibles; she will use this loan to expand the offerings of her store. Mariana is divorced with three children: Milagro Garcia (28), Jenifer (22), and Yerba (7). She hopes that the further success of her business will allow her to someday buy her own house in Magdalena; she currently lives with relatives.

Note: Mariana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Store stock expansion

loans.name: Eni

texts.id:
Eni H. owns a business selling beef meatballs and soto ayam (Indonesian chicken soup). With $35 capital she purchases meat, herbs and other ingredients to make her own meatballs. She sells those meatballs and soup in Gilimanuk port every day from 1pm to 11pm. Each day Eni H.'s business sells about 2kg meatballs that earn her $5 profit. During the Muslim fasting month and holiday season, Eni needs to purchase more ingredients to make more meatballs to satisfy increased demand and make more profit. Eni hopes that she can get enough additional capital funding so she can save to purchase her own house and increase her future prospect.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Eni H. mempunyai usaha menjual bakso sapi dan juga soto ayam dengan modal Rp. 350.000,- untuk membeli daging, bumbu, dan bahan lainnya. Daging yang telah dibeli, kemudian diolah sendiri menjadi bakso yang kemudian siap dijual di pelabuhan Gilimanuk setiap hari dari jam 13.00 Wita sampai jam 23.00 Wita. Setiap harinya Eni H. bisa menghabiskan 2 kg pentol bakso dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 50.000,- apalagi saat ini menjelang bulan puasa dan juga menjelang mudik lebaran tentu eni membutuhkan lebih banyak lagi modal agar bakso yang dijualpun bisa lebih banyak. Eni berharap agar dia mendapatkan modal yang cukup untuk meningkatkan pendapatan dari setiap usahanya agar supaya bias menabung untuk memiliki rumah sendiri dan untuk masa depan yang lebih baik.

loans.use: Purchase Meatball Ingredients

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama F. is a  38-year-old woman who owns a sheep raising business in a small southern village of Azerbaijan near to the Imishli region. She started her business in 2002 when she and her husband found it necessary to start their own business, because they both were unemployed and it was very hard period for them. They borrowed some money from their friends and first purchased  two lambs. As the sheep grew, Shamama sold them to the local bazaar trader and earned money. With their first income they paid back their debts and continued raising sheep for meat production. Mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat almost  every day . Selling sheep is the only financial source in their family. Shamama has three children. As their children grow up they havemore expenses, but the money they earn from selling is  not enough to cover big family needs. Shamama has applied for 1200 USD for purchasing 20 sheep. The estimated cost for one sheep is 50-60 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Annath

texts.en:
Across the oceans from America and Europe travel second-hand clothes, which are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to people like Anath who then takes them back to her village of Yombo Kilakala where she re-washes and re-irons them for sale to her neighbours and other customers. Anath has been engaged in this business since 2003 and currently requires a loan of $425 to travel to Dar es Salaam and replenish her stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Yuldasheva

texts.en:
Yuldasheva G. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has a child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  

She is engaged in the business of food products selling.  She has a wide assortment (milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products and etc) and the repeat customers.  

But working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It will permit her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Mrs. Yuldasheva requests a loan of $850 for business development and assortment widening.

loans.use: For business development and assortment widening.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi has always been very diligent. She works incessantly to be able to offer the best to her small children. Her youth and her desire to get ahead give her the strength to conquer all obstacles. She sells kebabs and skewers of chicken in the door of her house all afternoon. The good seasoning that she uses has brought success to her business and she will continue ahead with this activity. She would like to improve her business quickly by buying another grill in better condition, since she would like in the future to open a store in her house in order to continue progressing and to have her own house. At present she lives with her husband and small one in the house of her in-laws. Part of what drives her each day is the desire to consolidate the family that she has formed with her husband. Heidi requests a loan to buy another grill and ingredients for the preparation of her delicious kebabs. It will help Heidi to continue working for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Heidi siempre ha sido muy empeñosa, trabaja incesantemente para poder brindar lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos, su juventud y los deseos de superación le dan fortaleza para vencer todos los obstáculos. Vende anticuchos y brochetas de pollo en la puerta de su casa todas las tardes, por la buena sazón que tiene su trabajo ha dado frutos y seguirá adelante con esta actividad; piensa mejorarla pronto comprando otra parrilla en mejores condiciones ya que desea a futuro abrir una tienda en su casa para seguir progresando y tener una casa propia; debido a que actualmente vive con su esposo y su pequeño en la casa de sus suegros y parte de sus proyectos es que cada día pueda consolidar la familia que ha formado al lado de su esposo. Heidi solicita un préstamo para comprar otra parrilla e ingredientes para la preparación de sus deliciosos anticuchos. Apoya a Heidi a continuar por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a new grill and ingredients for making her delicious kebabs

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Viên Thị Hà, 43 years old, is a fifth tear member of the TYM Fund. She took out many loans from the Fund to invest in her husband’s fishing tools. With better equipped, the fishing business runs smoother, gets higher production and more profitable. This year, she is applying for a loan of 400USD to replace aged tools. The monthly income is 150USD. 

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.  
 
Là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương, chị Viên Thị Hà, 43 tuổi, đã trải qua nhiều vòng vốn. Với gia đình chị, nguồn kiếm sống cơ bản là đánh bắt cá do đó các vòng vốn vay trước của chị đều đầu tư vào mua các vật dụng đánh bắt. Từ khi được trang bị đầy đủ các đồ đánh bắt cá, công việc tiến triển thuận tiện rất nhiều. Lượng cá đánh bắt tăng lên, thu nhập đều đặn, kinh tế phát triển. Sang năm nay, do một số phương tiện đánh bắt đã cũ nên vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD để mua thêm đồ nghề. Thu nhập bình quân gia đình 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and prime material for his store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 64 years old and is a married woman with 10 children, ages 18-32 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 40 and 49 years old. Halima owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to open a new cafe.

loans.use: To open a new cafe

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr:
Ndiémé G., aged 45, is married with four children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for two years. She wants to boost her business selling fabric, shoes and gold-plated jewelry. She buys supplies in Dakar to sell in Bignona. With her income she contributes to the family expenses and is saving to buy some land. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ndiémé G., 45 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 2 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de tissus, chaussures et bijoux en plaqué or. Elle achète à Dakar pour vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle participe aux charges familiales et épargne pour l’achat d’un terrain. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Business selling fabric, shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan C. sells Cambodia noodles in Anlong Chambok Village, Siem Reap Province, earning about $2.66 per day. Her husband is a fisherman in Tonlesap Lake, a livelihood he has pursued since he was 18 years old. They live with four children, all too young to find income to help support the family.  Because of the rising cost of living, Mrs. C. needs to increase the family’s income, and so is requesting a loan to purchase a boat for use in her husband’s fishing business. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase more rice to make Cambodia noodles.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for her husband's fishing business and more rice to make Cambodia noodles.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina E. sells bananas and plantains. She is a widow whose income is not sufficient for Georgina and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome is 32 years old, a mother of 4 children all of whom are currently studying. She lives with her husband Alfredo, who she loves and together they have many business plans. For 10 years, she has been selling a variety of icepops from home, which she does all day long. Currently, her freezer is in a poor condition, preventing her from working. And so she is now selling grains (beans and corn), selling her new products all day as she desperately wants to fix her freezer. Salome works hard and is determined to cover the cost of her children's education. With the loan money, she want to fix her freezer so that she can continue her business and at the same time continue selling grain.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Salome tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos estudiantes. Vive junto a su esposo Alfredo, con quien se lleva muy bien y tienen juntos, muchos planes de negocio. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de variedades de helados de hielo, en su vivienda, atiende durante todo el día. En la actualidad, tiene en mal estado su refrigeradora, esto no es motivo para seguir trabajando, entonces por ahora está vendiendo granos (fríjol y maíz) al por menor, trabaja vendiendo estos nuevos productos todo el día porque quiere reparar su refrigeradora. Salome trabaja y se esfuerza para solventar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo, quiere reparar su refrigeradora para continuar con su negocio y a la par seguir vendiendo sus granos.

loans.use: To repair her freezer which she uses to sell icepops.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa Nelly inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares como apoyo también para su esposo. Comenzó hace dos años, vendiéndole zapatos a una amiga pero poco a poco tuvo su propia clientela y decidió invertir su propio dinero para ella ganar mas y tener su propio negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir mas mercancías que tiene de pedidos para tener contentos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Nelly began her business in order to increase her family’s income and to help her husband. She began 2 years ago, selling shoes for a friend but little by little she built up a clientele of her own and decided to invest her own money so that she could earn more and have her own business.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will repay in 3 months and which she will use to buy more merchandise to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Limkheng

texts.en: Mr. Limkheng C., 53, makes about $5 per day farming in the village of Kork Kandal in Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Theng Yen, is 55 years old and earns about $5 per day making wooden cupboards from their home. Limkheng has five children, two single and three married. Limkheng now requests a loan of $500 to purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer to use in her farming business and to buy a motorcycle for transporting produce. Limkheng realizes that the loans will help her produce enough income to cover her family’s living expenses and further her children’s studies.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and fertilizer to use in her farming business and to buy a motorcycle to transporting produce.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
G. Abdulla is 43 years of age.  Since he was young, his father taught him to work on the land where together they produced wheat, corn and different kinds of vegetables.  This type of business constitutes the economic base of the settlers of Shahrituz due to the characteristic botany of the zone.  For ten years, G. has been dedicated to the production of wheat, onions and potatoes as his main economic activity.  This activity has permitted his family to move forward.  His wife is a housewife.

At present, the cultivation of the crop that he is producing is of a low quality due to the fact that the land needs chemical fertilizers to improve the performance of the soil.  Thus, Abdulla is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) that he is willing to repay in 12 months.  Abdulla is counting on your help.  He deeply appreciates the support that you are giving to him, and promises to repay the loan with accuracy in time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
“Our family is currently living in a humble house without any electricity,” a mother from Barangay Sisim Alto Tumauini, Isabela narrated. 

Rubylyn D. is 25 years old and married to Lodgie who operates their own passenger tricycle. Their four-year-old daughter gives them inspiration to work harder in order to uplift their life from poverty. 
	 
Rubylyn wants a loan for the improvement of their house and to venture into a hog raising business. She is requesting at least PHP 7,000 to start a new business and to earn more income.

“I hope that through the loan, our life will improve. I know that I must be wise to be able to save for our future including the education of our child," Rubylyn said.  

She believes that there is hope while there is still life.

loans.use: Venture into hog raising business and repair house

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank. Emilia is 53 years old. She is married and has six children. Emilia runs a store from her home, located in the Calvario neighborhood, where she sells vegetables, dry goods (like rice and sugar), fruits, and meats. On Saturdays and Sundays, she also sells traditional Peruvian food from her home or in the San Juan Bautista Market. Emilia needs a loan of 750 soles to buy rice, sugar, and pasta.  Emilia’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to improve her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso. 
Emilia es casada, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Emilia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio del Calvario en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, frutas, carnes. Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica en su casa y también algunas veces lo lleva a la feria de San Juan Bautista. 
Emilia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo.  Los sueños de Emilia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling juice and phone vouchers in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for many years. She earns an average monthly profit of $80. She is requesting this loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more phone vouchers and juice for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profit and expand her business. Fatma is 40 years old, married with five children aged 19, 17, 15, 13 and 9.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Khadija, who has her own small business selling charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more phone vouchers and juice for her business.

loans.name: Hansen

texts.es: Hansen tiene 31, vive con su madre y hermanos en L. casa propia D. sus padres. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desD. hace 5 años D. manera independiente, ya que desD. niño realizó esta labor apoyando a sus padres. Su trabajo diario consiste en velar por sus tierras D. cultivo para asegurar una buena cosecha libre D. plagas, como lo hizo recientemente aplicando insecticidas (se muestra en L. foto los sacos ya utilizados), él cultiva los principales productos que se dan en su zona y D. variada calidad. Hansen sabe que las ganancias en L. agricultura se dan después D. 6 meses  aproximadamente, por lo que consiguió un trabajo D. medio tiempo que le permite obtener ganancias para optimizar su producción, trabaja en L. municipalidad D. su localidad por las tardes. Ahora tiene proyectos D. seguir emprendiendo su desarrollo, y uno D. ellos es invertir en un nuevo negocio para mejorar L. producción D. sus cosechas, hasta el momento  su forma D. trabajo le ha brindado buenas ganancias, ya que sus cosechas las lleva a vender por grandes cantidades a L. ciudad capital. Es L. tercera vez que Hansen tiene un préstamo con MFP, es uno D. los integrantes más responsables D. su banco comunal, y siempre ha impulsado un trabajo ordenado y honesto a los demás compañeros D. su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en L. compra D. fertilizantes para sus tierras D. cultivo, y también para el alquiler D. un stand D. ventas en el centro D. Huancayo. Con 1000 soles comprará los fertilizantes, con otros 1000 arrendará el stand y los 1500 será como parte del pago D. una máquina fotocopiadora para empezar a brindar este servicio.
texts.en:
31-year old Hansen lives with his mother and siblings in his parents’ own house. He has been working as an independent farmer for the last five years, the same kind of work he has done since he was a child helping his parents. Every day he checks his fields to make sure his crops are free from pests. Recently he applied insecticiD. (the used bags are shown in the photo). He grows a range of the crops best suited to the area. Hansen knows that profit from agriculture is realised after six months, so he has found a temporary job to earn money during that time. He works in the local municipality office in the afternoons. Currently he has more projects in development, one of which is investing in a new business to improve crop production. He is doing well from this method of working; he now takes his abundant harvests to sell in the capital and earns a good profit from them. This is the third time that Hansen has asked for a loan from Kiva partner MFP. He is one of the most responsible members of the community bank, and he has always worked in a disciplined and honest manner with the other members of the bank. The money that he is asking for will be used to buy fertilizer for his fields, and also to rent a stall in the centre of Huancayo. 1000 soles will be used for fertilizer, 1000 soles to lease a stall, and 1500 soles as part-payment for a photocopying machine to start a new business providing photocopying services.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to lease a market stall

loans.name: Chhy

texts.en:
Chhy R., 37, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the local market of the Kampong Cham province. She is able to make about $2.50 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and also acts as a dealer selling motorbikes. On average, he makes $3 of profit per day. This couple has four children: one is a student, two are too young to attend school, and one is a construction worker.

Chhy R. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to sell for extra profit to help raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to sell

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru: Исмоилов Файзали, проживаюший в городе Куляб ему 40 лет, женат имеет 4 ех детей, имеет среднее образование. Клиент занимается торговлей, на местном рынке Лола, этим видом деятельности, занимается более 12 лет.Клиент торгует бывше употреблённом товаром.Клиент на полученные деньги хочет увеличить свой товар.От получаемого дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Fayzali I. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He finished secondary school. The client runs a business at a local market named Lola, and has been in this business for more than 12 years. He trades in previously used goods. With the money from this loan Fayzali wants to increase his inventory. He will use the income to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila es una joven muy alegre de 26 años, vive en la casa de su padre, a quien quiere dar una vejez tranquila y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Para Petronila la crianza de ganado es una actividad que viene de familia, desde muy pequeña  aprendió a realizar esta labor, actualmente realiza este trabajo y es muy buena haciéndolo, su ganado es muy solicitado en las ferias de Huancane y Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastar a sus animales y permanecer al aire libre, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es llevar a sus animales hasta las distintas ferias para venderlos. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número de ganado que tiene para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Petronila con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad brindada, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los 1000 soles solicitados comprará una vaca para incrementar su ganado, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero de sus ahorros si es necesario incrementar el monto.
texts.en:
Petronila is a very happy young woman who is 26 years old. She lives in her father's house, who she wants to give a tranquil old age. What she wants most is to get ahead in life. For Petronila, livestock husbandry is an activity that comes from her family as she learned how to do it from a young age. She currently carries out this work and is very good at doing it. Her livestock is very sought after in the Huancane and Juliaca markets. What she most likes about her work is to graze her animals and to be outside in the fresh air. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and the most difficult part for her is to take her animals to the different markets to sell them. In the future she hopes to increase her number of heads of livestock to improve her income. This is Petronila’s first loan with MFP and she feels happy about the opportunity it provides. In her communal bank she is a much loved member as she always helps in everything required. With the 1000 soles requested she will buy a cow to increase her livestock and for this she is prepared to contribute money from her savings if it is necessary to increase the amount.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, junto a su pareja tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles los cuidados necesarios a sus dos pequeñas hijas, quienes requieren un lugar donde vivir, ya que  por el momento están alojados en la casa de sus suegros. La necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos económicos la llevaron a aprender repostería, cuando terminó sus estudios tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir un pequeño horno donde ahora prepara bocaditos que distribuye a diversas tiendas. Este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace un año y en el poco tiempo que tiene, ha logrado conseguir gran cantidad de clientes, quienes le hacen pedidos quincenalmente. Además, María brinda sus servicios para fiestas y otros eventos sociales, donde lleva sus deliciosos bocaditos para consumo de los asistentes; a pesar de ser esporádicas estas reuniones, gana lo suficiente como para seguir trabajando y cumpliendo sus pedidos menores. Para el futuro, anhela tener una pastelería en el centro de su localidad, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y obtener pronto una casa para la comodidad de su familia. María llegó a MFP hace un año, está en su segundo crédito y junto a sus compañeras ha podido generar grandes ingresos en beneficio a su grupo, pues las actividades que realizan las ayudaron a crecer económicamente. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará los productos e ingredientes para el preparado de sus pasteles, y así incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and, together with her partner, has the responsibility of providing the necessary care for her two small daughters who require a place to live. For now, they are living in her in-laws’ house. The need to increase her income led her to learn to bake and, when she finished her studies, she had the opportunity of buying a small oven that she now uses to prepare her goods to distribute to various stores. She has been in the business for one year and, in this small amount of time, she has managed to build a large customer base that places orders with her every two weeks. In addition, María provides her services for parties and other social events where she takes her delicious treats for consumption by attendees. Despite the fact that these events are sporadic, she earns enough to continue working and complete her other small orders. For the future, she wishes to have her own bakery in the center of her locality with the aim of generating greater income for her home and to obtain a house so her family can live in more comfortable conditions. María arrived at MFP a year ago, is in her second credit and, together with her colleagues, has been able to generate a large amount of income to benefit her group as her activities help them grow economically. With the 2000 soles she requests, she will buy products and ingredients to make her cakes so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cakes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Lilia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business selling firewood. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is 38 years old. She is married and has one son and two daughters. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. Adwoa lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Adwoa's husband is an electrician, while she is a trader who sells plantains. She has sold her goods in nearby markets for the last 10 years. 

Adwoa is requesting a loan to buy plantains in bulk. She currently buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She aspires to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Lang K., 21, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish,  in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Sinath; she is 19 and works with him in the fishing business. The young couple is blessed with one young child who is still not enrolled in school. Lang K. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es: Asunción es una mujer muy trabajadora, lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, con quienes comparte gratos momentos, tratando siempre de brindar los mejores cuidados a sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 15 años y en todo este tiempo ha ido mejorando sus ventas gracias al trato que brinda a sus clientas, quienes están muy contentas de contar con Asunción como consultora de belleza. Pero para seguir progresando requiere de un capital adicional para instalar un puesto de venta en su casa, ya que tiene mucho interés de tener  un bazar donde venda diversos productos para el hogar. Para ello, Asunción seguirá trabajando  con el mismo ritmo, saliendo todas las tardes a visitar a sus clientes regulares y a nuevos clientes, con quienes pueda incrementar sus ventas. Asunción también trabaja con jóvenes que le ayuden a vender sus productos a cambio de un porcentaje de las ganancias, esta estrategia le está dando muy buenos resultados. Este es su 6to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, esta oportunidad de crédito le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que desarrolla junto a sus compañeras un trabajo coordinado en su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que ahora solicita serán invertidos en la compra de productos de belleza para entregar los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Asunción is a very hardworking woman who struggles hard to help her family get ahead, sharing great moments with them and always trying to give her 2 children the best care. She has been selling beauty products for 15 years. During this whole time, her sales have been improving thanks to her great customer service. Her customers are very happy to have Asunción as their beauty consultant. However, in order to keep making progress, she needs additional capital to set up a sales stand in her house because she is very interested in establishing a shop in which she sells various household products. For this, Asunción will continue to work in the same manner, going out every evening to visit her regular customers, as well as new ones who will boost sales. Asunción always works with young people who help her sell her products in exchange for a percentage of the profits. This strategy is yielding great results. This is her 6th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her chance to obtain loans has allowed her to improve her quality of life because she and her fellow group members grow as entrepreneurs, working in conjunction with their microfinance institute. The 3,000.00 PEN that she is currently requesting will be invested in purchasing beauty products so that she can distribute her pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
U. Bakhtiyor is a 24-year old man. He is married with two small children. Bakhtiyor’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Spitamen in search of customers. He has owned his business for five years. He also raises cattle at his house with the support of his wife.  Bakhtiyor is asking for a loan of $ 800 US in order to replace the fuel supply system in his taxi with one using gas, as gas is cheaper than petrol. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make such help possible.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a kapron gas-cylinder

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, con quienes trata de disfrutar gran parte del día, aun cuando tiene que salir a trabajar. Sus ganas de progresar la motivan diariamente a salir a las calles con la esperanza de vender  algunas de sus prendas de vestir en las puertas de los mercados. Esta actividad la viene realizando por tres años, tiempo que ganó experiencia en ventas y ahora busca variar sus productos acorde a la exigencia de sus clientes. Yesica desea adquirir un puesto de ventas dentro del mercado para realizar su actividad con mayor comodidad e implementar un negocio de venta de comida, el cual viene realizando sólo los fines de semana o fechas festivas con la finalidad de mejorar el capital que tiene e invertir en sus dos negocios. Este es su 6to crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sus anteriores préstamos fueron de gran beneficio para ella y todas sus compañeras con quienes conforma su banco comunal. Los 800 soles que solicita los invertirá en su negocio de venta de comida, pues ha tenido gran acogida por las personas.
texts.en:
Yesica is 33 years old, married, and has two young children, with whom she tries to enjoy a large part of the day, even when she has to go to work. Her desire to progress motivates her daily to go out with the hope of selling some of her clothing in the entrances to markets. She has been doing this for three years, in which time she has gained sales experience. She is now looking to vary her products in accordance with her customers' demands. Yesica wants to acquire a booth within the market to work more comfortably and to start a business selling food, which she only does on weekends and holidays in order to increase her capital and invest in her two businesses. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Her previous loans were of great benefit to her and all the members of her communal bank. The 800 soles she requests will be invested in her food business, since it has been well-received.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her new food business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with eight children and she is 50 years old. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. This is her main source of income. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: Jimena

texts.en:
Jimena is 21 years old and single. She lives in the community of Colkapirua, which is in the Sumumpaya Province of Cochabamba Department. Jimena has been working as a "lechera," or dairy cow farmer, for the past six years. Growing up helping in her family's dairy cow business led Jimena to where she is now. Jimena still lives at home and she now owns her own livestock.

Jimena will use her loan to purchase food for her livestock; specifically, soy bean husks. She hopes that this will improve her cows' milk production. Jimena is currently studying at a technical institute each night, and she looks forward to finishing her studies and becoming a professional.

loans.use: Purchasing food for livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to earn a living and to meet the needs of her family. She is 44 years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maruim

texts.en: This is Maruim, daughter of Z.. She lives in district 2nd of Kabul Afghanistan. She is a young girl of 25 years. Even though she is so young, she still feels lots of responsibilities towards her family members. She lives in a family of 7, including her father and mother. She is the oldest daughter in her family and Maruim wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Since the Taliban regime she has sewn clothes. At that time they had lots of economic problems. Now, with the Kiva loan she wants to support her family members. She has requested a group loan of 14000 Afghani ($300US). She would like to mention the effectiveness of the Kiva loan process and its effect on their business progress.

loans.use: For expanding business.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve B., 42 years old, manages her village store which is situated in her house. Though she is busy managing her business, she is very proud because her family has a harmonious relationship. She is happily married to Manuel and they are blessed with five children: Melinda- 19 years of age, college level; Maryjane -17 years of age, first year college student taking up Education; Marife- 14 years of age, a sophomore high school student; Melvin- 11 years of age, a grade- VI  pupil and Mark Paul- 4 years of age. Their family resides in the Barangay of Marobbob Amulung,Cagayan.

Wanting to support the education of her children, Salve wants to make her variety store more productive; thus, she is requesting a loan of Php10,000 from KIVA lenders for the expansion of her business. With the loan, Salve will purchase more merchandise such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy soft drinks and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lideresas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín,  Es Casada, tiene 58 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independiente.

Anita, como le dicen D. cariño, lleva 25 años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo D. actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller D. costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donD. diariamente atienD. a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel belongs to the Las Lideresas II Communal bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 58, married, and has three independent children. Anita, as she is affectionately called, has been making clothing for 25 year. Having knowledge about this type of activity, she had no doubts about setting up her own clothes making shop, which is located in her own house in a very well equipped area. She waits on her steady customers daily. They know her, and they need her service. She works on orders that her customers make in advance. She now feels very happy and proud of what she has achieved. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy meters of different types and colors of fabric, instruments that she uses like scissors, large spools of different colors of thread, sewing and machine needles, pins, and buttons. She now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping lot of women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Florence Awino

texts.en:
Florence Awino O. is a mother of 9 children, all of whom are in school. She is also a wife and businesswoman. Her main business is selling fresh fish at the Malanga market, Busia district, Kenya. She also manages her farm where she sells fresh items straight from the farm. She would like a loan of KES 20,000 which will go into increasing her fish stock and expanding her farming area.

Her future plan is to ensure education for her children and expand both her businesses to become large scale.

loans.use: increase fish stock and expand farming area

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, se dedica a la venta D. comida es V. y la única que solventa los gastos D. alimentación, ropa y estudios D. su hija. 
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Achumani D. la urbanización concepción D. la ciudad D. La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra insumos (papa, arroz, fideo, aceite).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Sabina sells meals. She is a widow and must cover her own expenses for food, clothing and the education of her daughter. Her home is located in the Concepción housing development in the Achumani area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to buy supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles and cooking oil.) This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to purchase potatoes, rice, noodles and cooking oil)

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El joven Luis Manuel vive con sus padres en colonia San Antonio a 15 kilometros de Nueva Guinea, y aunque aun no se ha casado es un joven muy responsable  y le brinda apoyo a sus padres con los  gastos familiares, se desempeña como docente de primaria  desde hace cuatro años, actualmente  esta estudiando  una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn ya ama su trabajo, el se caracteriza por  es un hombre humilde , responsable con muchos deseos de seguir estudiando, El se siente agradecido con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con el credito  anterior logro comprar un solar en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, y este credito lo desea para comenzar la construccion de un cuarto en este solar y poco a poco tener su propia casa, sueña con tener en el futurouna vivienda amplia, bonita y trabajo para salir adelante con todos sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel lives with his parents in the San Antonio neighborhood, 15 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. Although he isn't married yet, he is a very responsible young man who helps his parents with family expenses. For the last four years he has been an elementary school teacher and he is currently studying to get his bachelor's in education; he loves his work. He is an unassuming, very responsible young man who wants to continue to study. He is grateful to AFODENIC because his last loan allowed him to buy a plot of land in Nueva Guinea's urban zone. He will use this funding to build a room on the lot so as to begin to build his own house bit by bit. He dreams with having a spacious, pretty home in the future and to continue to work and get ahead with his various projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Dina Saraí

texts.es: Dina Saraí L. D. C. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar como motorista del transporte público y junto a cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Dina posee un tienda en la cual comercializa diversos productos como alimentos, golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales son muy necesario en el hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poder brindarles mayores beneficios a sus cuatro hijos. Tanto Dina como su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras y respetadas por contar con muy buenos valores y por ser personas quienes se esfuerzan mucho por el bienestar y estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Dina Saraí L. D. C., 32, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department, with her husband, who is a public transportation driver, and their four, minor childlren, who are students. Dina has a small store where she sells various products like food, sweets, detergent, basic grains, etc. which are needed in the home. She is asking for funding in order to buy larger quantities of her basic stock items to offer her customers. She does this in order to increase her sales to proviD. more benefits for her four children. Dina and her husband are very hard-working and respected people because they have very good values and because they are people who make every effort for the well-being and stability of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Josefa's Group

texts.en:
Josefa A. is from the village of Malamag West, Tumauini, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Josefa is the group leader of a 14-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Josefa A.'.

Josefa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Josefa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Josefa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela R. D. P. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar en una ferretería, y a sus cinco hijo, todo menores D. 9 años D. edad, D. los cuales los cuatro mayores se dedican a estudiar. María posee una pupusería, en el cual se dedica a elaborar y vender pupusas desD. hace tres años atrás. Así mismo posee una pequeña heladería en la cual venD. sorbetes y paletas al dos por uno, lo cual atrae a muchos clientes todo gracias a las promociones que posee. María creó sus propios negocios, en vista D. la necesidad que su esposo tenia D. contar con una ayuda extra la cual le permitiera salir adelante. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del que pueda comprar maíz, frijoles, arroz, queso y chicharrón, los cuales son los ingredientes con los que se elaboran las pupusas. Así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. sorbetes, ya que esta es la única venta D. sorbetes que hay en el lugar, razón por la cual no posee competencia. María desea mucho poder mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia, es por esto que día a día se esfuerza mucho por brindarles lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Ángela R. D. P., age 30, lives in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who works in a hardware store, and their five children. The children are all younger than nine years old, and the four oldest go to school. María has a business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). She has been making and selling pupusas for three years. At the same time she has a small ice cream business. She sells sorbets and popsicles as two for one. This attracts a lot of customers, and this is all thanks to the promotions she has. María created her own businesses upon seeing that her husband needed extra help, which would allow them to get ahead. María is asking Integral for a loan to be able to buy corn, beans, rice, cheese, and “chicharrón” (pork rinds). These are the ingredients she uses to make the pupusas. She also wants to be able to buy a larger quantity of sorbets. She has the only sorbet sales in the area. Therefore, she does not have competition. María really wants to be able to improve her family’s living conditions. That is why she puts forth a lot of effort everyday to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food and buy sorbets

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Juan Alejandro Téllez Méndez, quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado quince crédito con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás del patio de su casa. y.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan works as a security guard in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has three school aged children. He has had 15 loans through CEPRODEL over eight years. He will use the money to make improvements to his home and will buy building materials such as cement, sand, and stone in order to build a wall behind his house. He wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio vive en casa propia con sus hermanos es huérfano de padres, vive en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de productos en una tienda que instalo en su casa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para abastecer su tienda con más productos y poder de esta manera tener mayor clientela ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, vía Kiva; el carácter social del crédito ayuda para que Eugenio pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Eugenio lives in his own home with his siblings; he has no living parents. He lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood in the city of La Paz. He has a business selling products from a store that is set up in his house. The loan that he requests is to increase his capital so that he can restock his store with more products and in this way have more customers, since this is his only source of income. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO via Kiva. Eugenio's good character helped him qualify to access this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase capital to buy more products for his grocery store

loans.name: Susi

texts.es: Susi tiene 28 años, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos, por quines se esmera en darles lo mejor. El negocio al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosas y productos comestibles en su tienda que instaló en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa, desde entonces le va muy bien, es por ello que procura atender con mucha amabilidad  a sus clientes. Por las  mañanas trabaja sola y por las tardes su hijo  Manuel de 12 años la apoya. Lo que más el gusta de su negocio es tener abastecido su negocio con variados productos, además disfruta mucho atendiendo a sus compradores. Es así que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo hay veces que no cuenta con el presupuesto suficiente para invertir en más mercadería. Es por ello que desea ampliar su tienda y suministrarlo con productos a precios accesibles para sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas ya que desea contar con posteriores facilidades. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en productos básicos para el consumo humano y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Susi is 28 years old and lives in the home of her in-laws with her husband and two children for whom she tries to provide the best. She sells sodas and food products from a shop set up in a small space inside of her house. Susi is doing very well since she tries to provide friendly service to her customers. In the mornings she works alone, but in the afternoons, her 12 year old son Manuel helps her. What she enjoys most about her job are stocking her store with different products and attending to her guests. Susi has been in this business for five years, but there are times when she does not have sufficient funds to acquire more merchandise. She wants to expand her store and fill it with products that are affordable for her customers.

This is her first loan with MFP. Susi promises to submit her payments on time because she wants to be eligible for subsequent loans. The money she requested will be used to buy merchandise, such as basic products for human consumption, so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Vicenta Regina

texts.es: Doña Vicenta Regina C. A., de veinte años de edad, Casada vive con sus dos hijos lleva, tres años trabajando como Artesana, con su esposo se dedican a la Tejeduría de cortes Típicos,  por falta de capital para poder adquirir un telar y generar otro trabajo y mejorar la producción, se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprar el Telar la que contribuirá al mejoramiento de su calidad de Vida y poder satisfacer sus necesidades familiares y personales
texts.en:
Ms. Vicenta Regina C. A., age 20, is married and lives with her two children. She and her husband have been making handmade traditional clothing for three years. She now turns to Asociación ASDIR for a loan because she lacks the funds to purchase a loom to generate more work and to increase production. With this loan, she will be able to purchase the loom, which will contribute to improving her quality of life and allow her to meet both her personal and family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a loom

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai Thị Phạm was born in 1986 and she lives in Ha Lam village, Thuy Lam commune. She is married with a son. Her husband is a carpenter.

Mai Thị Phạm not only grows rice but also raises two hundred chickens to scratch a living. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and has repaid punctually. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Diana Espinoza

texts.es:
Diana de 24 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es tallador de muebles con el tiene tres hijos que están estudiando. Ella tiene un local de venta de pañales para niños. 

Al ver la necesidad de las mujeres de su sector que necesitaban un lugar donde comprar los pañales desechables de sus hijos ella decidió invertir sus ahorros en pañales y venderlos a sus conocidos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación logro readecuar un local y convertirlo en una tienda de pañales y usos papa bebes. 

Pero para tener mas rentabilidad en su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pañales, teteros y artículos para bebes. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana, 24 years old, lives in the suburb of Guayaquil. Her husband makes furniture for a living, and they have three children who are studying. She has a shop where she sells diapers. When she saw that the women in her area needed a place to buy disposable diapers for their children, Diana decided to invest her savings in diapers and sell them to people she knew. Little by little and with much effort and dedication, she acquired a space and converted it into a store to sell diapers and other baby items. In order to make her business more profitable, Diana would like to use her loan to buy diapers, bottles, and other items for babies. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open multiple branches.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diapers and baby bottles

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Shirnen Otgonbayar is 39 years old and lives with her five children in Darkhan province, one of Mongolia's big provinces. She and her family live together in their own house. Four of the children are secondary school students and her older son is a military officer.  

Otgonbayar's family moved to the town from the countryside, where she was a herder, eight years ago in search of a better life. Her husband works in a local company, where his salary is between $100 and $200 per month, in order to help them with their living expenses. Otgonbayar now operates a grocery store with a few basic items. Her store is in a good location where there are always many people around. 

She began her business in 2002 by operating a small booth. She says, "I will work hard to pay the bank loan on time and I will use it to grow my business." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon.  He has been the owner of an Internet café since 2003 with seven years of experience in this field. This is where most teenagers visit to chat and do research. Since Rabih’s work is in Southern Lebanon & most of the Lebanese leave the city for the mountains during the summer season, Rabih’s work needs to be developed to stay up to date with the necessary programs and materials. It’s the first time that Rabih has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to do the necessary maintenance on his equipment and to increase the number of computers, which will increase the number of visitors per day and thus increase his income. His dream is to own a bigger place in addition to a retail showroom.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Kaïraba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de de solidarité KAÏRABA est né depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois en Mars 2001. Le groupe est composé de 09 femmes de différents ages, qui habitent le même quartier. Elles mènent des activités telles que la production de savon, le petit commerce et le maraichage. Elles ont un bon niveau d'épargne. Avec les revenus qu'elles gagnent elles soutiennent leurs maris dans les charges de la famille que sont la nourriture, la santé, la scolarité des enfants et l'habillement. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KADIOR

Madame AWA B., assise en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe  verte foncée est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 69 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfant mais a la charge de 5 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle est transformatrice de savon. C'est avec le soutien de ses enfants en garde que l'huile est transformé en savon et vendu dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité

Avec son crédit elle achète des futs d'huile pour la fabrique du savon.

Son objectif est de croître ses revenus afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et mieux prendre en charge les enfants qui lui sont confiés.
texts.en:
The KAÏRABA solidarity group was created in March 2001 at the first cycle of the Banc Villageois of KADIOR, to which it belongs. The group consists of nine (9) women of varying ages living in the same neighborhood. They carry on activities such as soap making, petty trade and market gardening. They sustain a good level of savings. With the income they earn, they help their husbands with family expenses such as food, healthcare, children’s tuition, and clothing. Mrs. AWA B., sitting second from the right in the photo and wrapped in a dark green scarf, is the head of the group. She is a 69-year-old widow with no children but takes care of five (5) children entrusted to her by relatives. She is a soap maker. With the children’s help, she processes the oil into soap, which she then sells at the local weekly markets. With her loan, she will buy barrels of oil to be used in soap making. Her goal is to bolster her income in order to meet her personal needs and better provide for the children in her care.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her business

loans.name: Peter Macharia

texts.en:
Peter has been in the motorcycle transport business since 2008. He is 26 years old, married to Jane Wambui and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid off his first loan well and on time. He plans to use this cash to buy a used motorbike. He will employ someone else to run the motorbike for him. This will increase his income.

Peter is planning to buy a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima A. is a 52 year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: dried fish vending and a ready-to-wear clothing business. She lives in Tangkong, Barangay Sillom, Bantayan, Cebu . She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dried fish vending and ready-to-wear clothing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Zosima is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Zosima aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Liv

texts.en:
Liv Y., 54, is widowed and resides with her husband and two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia: an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. Y. sells fish, earning an income of about USD 3.5 per day. The family has to spend USD 45 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

Y. appears in the photograph at home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah T. is 43-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating one business venture: buying and selling household appliances. She lives in Purok Doridad, Brgy Plaridel, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her buying and selling of household appliances, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4000. Leah is now borrowing PHP 21,000 to use as additional working capital for the business.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leah aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Choeurn L. is 28 years old and sells vegetables in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$2 every day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns US$3 per day. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Choeurn L. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda resides in Multan, which is a big city in Pakistan known for its history and tombs. She lives there in a small housing colony, named Muhallah Rahimabad, with her family in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 8 years ago. 

She belongs to a poor family. So, in order to financially assist her family, she makes embroidered clothes and also sells cloth. She buys clothes from the markets of Multan and sells them to her local area clients for good profit. Basically, she is a very creative lady and loves to craft beautiful embroidered dresses. She sells her embroidered dresses to different boutiques and people admire her talent and give her good orders.  

Saeeda is also a very good wife and mother. She is married to F. who also has a business of embroidery. She is bringing up her 6 children with great care. Her elder son does his own business, while her remaining children are getting their education. 

Saeeda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah in order to improve her clothes selling business. She will utilize the loan to purchase clothes in bulk quantity that will help her offer more variety to her clients and make more sales. She is hopeful that, in this way, she will be able to make more money and provide better living facilities to her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saeeda.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business
